Reviews.Title: “Awful, outdated small rooms, bad service, do not recommend!!!!””
Reviews.Author: sam A
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel. We booked a room with the sea view, it was so smelly as the curtains were full of mould. We complained and they changed the room but it was stinky as well. As results we got bad sore throat. The view is nothing special as it overlooks the highway, room are so small

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View”
Reviews.Author: Georgia F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight because it was the only thing we could get last-minute in our price range, and it was a treat. They upgraded our room, so while it was cozy, it has an amazing view of Hong Kong Harbour. I wouldn't have thought that this kind of view was available for the price we paid, particularly since we had a corner room and had floor-to-ceiling views of the water on one side and equally expansive views of the city on the other.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clautec
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, I enjoyed the inspiring view from the window of the suite. Very clean, fast service. Staff well educated. Reasonable price compared to others of the same level. Is there a picture of the window that I was for a few days. Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Overall it was good”
Reviews.Author: cavaboom
Reviews.Content: It is in a bit of an odd location but located near a fantastic Pastry shop with great coffee (A-1 Bakery) which was a HUGE plus considering it seemed hard for us to find quality coffee while in Hong Kong. The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating and the rooms were clean with good views of the bay. We stayed here because a friend reserved it for his wedding so I can't say much about comparative pricing but I thought the value seemed good for the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Island Pacific -Business Tour”
Reviews.Author: Maryam_RUae
Reviews.Content: Standard rooms are a bit smaller in size so go for superior rooms. I did not try the spa or the breakfast. Everything else was great espc. the staff. Close to the central. Regular shuttle service to key locations in the centre of the city. Good value for money. Good for business travel. Would gladly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location & à clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: bikerbabe22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated & its easy to reach by bus or metro. The rooms are small, but they are a typical size for Hong Kong. The staff are very helpful. The beds are comfortable and the shower/bath is à good size.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms - big facilities”
Reviews.Author: hotwog4all
Reviews.Content: Rated 3 star but based on global 'standard' should be higher. HK has lots of offerings so it's easy to get very decent for budget value. Hotel has room service, on site cafe, bar that has live bands on weekends, and pool/gym too.

Reviews.Title: “Good at all”
Reviews.Author: Mario T
Reviews.Content: yes, the standard room are small....but what do you want. it is very good value for the money. It is clean and all the staff is very friendly and helpful. The bellboy was not even expecting a tip. About transportation: it is a couple minutes walk from Shueng Wan MTR station, but simply take the tram to go to/from the hotel....the next stop is within 100m on Des Voeux Road...nothing easier than hopping on one of the frequent trams...$2.30 per ride. The Airbus stop (from the Airport) is also just around the corner. Going to the airport you have to walk for 5min. to Water Street. The breakfast is good (I got my for free as an upgrade), if you have to pay for it....go somewhere else.....or eat for hours (the variety is good). I will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: tengboon
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here off and on over the last 15 years. It still feels like a brand new hotel, the room is compact but efficient. There's no lack of space to work, nor sleep, with the desk and full-size bed very well layed out. For the money, this is one of the best deals in HK, but you have to book early. If you're the type of traveller who simply sleeps in the hotel without using facilities, this is ideal. Yes they have a pool, but it's pretty grim, and it's not worth getting breakfast as there's loads of local spots in the area. Elevated flat-screen TV in the room means you can keep in touch with news while going about your business. Overall, great hotel for business travellers, or those that are happier to explore HK and all it's amazing sites. Not recommended for holiday tourists who just want to lounge in the hotel, as the facilities are poor. But the room is great, and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeerzadaMushtaq
Reviews.Content: I reccently stayed in this hotel with my family ,The hotel is excellent with a great customer service,Whenever i will visit Hong Kong we will stay there & we recomend people to stay in this hotel.Very friendly staff ,clean sorooundings, excellent living standards maintained.

Reviews.Title: “One of the beat deals in central HK”
Reviews.Author: KubKunKrab
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for my parents who were coming to see HK in May this year. As is common on the HK accommodation scene - prices were rather high, but our corporate travel agent managed to score us a good deal. Rooms are clean and the ones facing the harbor have an amazing view of Kowloon, the ICC and the passing ships and catamarans. Overall the value for money and location are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: LondonEveJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely with lots of space and fantastic views even in the standard room. I had an issue with my TV, it had a constant whistle. I called front desk and I had people trying to fix it within 5 mins. Unfortunately it couldnt be fixe and I was moved rooms in 20 minutes. The beds are huge, large bathroom, desk, fridge in the room with complimentary water, full size ironing board, everything you need in the room. The front desk people where always so help and food in the Resturant was priced quite well. There is also a nice pool and gym which is nice to relax in. I work in Central which is either a 20-25 min walk or 10 min taxi ride for £3 equiv I will definately be going back and staying at the hotel again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a 15 minute walk from MTR station”
Reviews.Author: limericklin
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at Island Pacific Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. 1) How to get there We bought an Airport Express Travel Pass online for 285 HKD (it's cheaper online) with 50 HKD being refundable when you return the card at the airport. This is only useful if you intend to take MTR most of the time and if you are there for three days. From the Airport Express Hong Kong Station, you can either take a taxi or walk back to the hotel. Taxi costs about 30 HKD, depending on traffic. You can also walk from the Sheung Wan and it takes around 15 minutes if you walk at a moderate speed. I read some reviews stating that you could actually take a tram which gets you somewhere near the hotel or that there is a bus from the airport. However, when I sent an email enquiring about public transport options to the hotel, the only answer I got was that I should take a taxi. 2) Location The thing you will realise about this place is that it sells plenty of dried seafood. Everytime we walk back to the hotel, we will smell the dried seafood smell. I'm not particularly adverse to it, but just thought I should mention it. Sometimes, you will see some seafood being dried by the side of the road as well. Safe neighbourhood, with bakeries, convenience stalls, dessert stalls and restaurants all in the vicinity. Shuttle bus from the hotel to various locations, but not from various locations to the hotel. For example, you could take a shuttle bus to Sheung Wan, but you can't take a shuttle bus from Sheung Wan to the hotel, unless you call them. 3) Service Excellent service. Everyone from the concierge to the receptionists were very friendly and polite. The concierge were also responsible for asking you where you were going if you wanted to take the shuttle bus. 4) Room The room was well stocked. When we reached, we had three complimentary fruits and two bottles of water. It oversees the harbour and you can also see the buildings in the neighbourhood. There is an iPhone dock which was really convenient because you didn't even need a charger. Only gripe was that the thick curtains couldn't close fully such that we got awaken by the morning sun daily. 5) Bathroom The bathroom was quite small but suitable for all purposes. Toiletries are also provided. Hairdryer available. 6) Other amenities A swimming pool and a gym is also present in the hotel but we didn't get to use them because we didn't have the time to. Overall This isn't exactly the best location to stay at, if you are looking at shopping near the Kowloon area. However, the presence of shuttle buses to Central MTR may alleviate that problem slightly. Nonetheless, you have to also keep in mind that the shuttle bus ends pretty early so you would have to settle your own transportation back to the hotel. Other than the location (which really isn't that inconvenient if you don't mind a 15-20 minute walk), everything in this hotel was pleasant and worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location not what I thought”
Reviews.Author: tamitzer
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was an excellent facility. The rooms are very small, but clean and modern. Only stayed here for two nights because the hotel in Kowloon could only accommodate us for the previous four and we had to find another place. Unfortunately, Kowloon is the place to stay. I prefer locations which are walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and attractions. The neighborhood that the Island Pacific is in seemed to be the everyday working person neighborhood. While it was nice to get a glimpse of the local culture, it was not close enough to walk to the ferry station, which is what had been stated on one of the informational websites. There was a typhoon warning when we were there, so the pool was closed and there was nothing to do nearby, but walk past fish shops and fruit stands. Not even a Starbucks in the immediate neighborhood. Good thing that the internet was complimentary and was a strong connection. On the positive side, the staff were extremely courteous and there was entertainment in the lounge on the Friday and Saturday night that we were there. The dinner buffet was pricey, so we chose to eat in the lounge and even that was pretty expensive compared to some of the places we had been while staying in Kowloon. We did walk about six blocks away and found some small restaurants, one of which we went to on Saturday night. It is certainly not the area for night life. To be fair, we didn't have much of a chance to even get to a public transportation station while there, but I will say that when I visit Hong Kong again, I will definitely stay in Kowloon, at the waterfront, which is absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Hong kong room.”
Reviews.Author: Exclusive T
Reviews.Content: Nice room. Good location. Very helpful staff. Easy going lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: CharitraMaheshwari
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nightds during June 2012 and our stay was quite comfortable. The hotel staff was very friendly and ready to help at any hour. The price offered by their website was real bargain offer. However the only let down was the breakfast, too little choices for any vegetarian. I would request them to please work on their breakfast menu a bit more. Otherwise for everything else, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good high-rise hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Oz-Bluey
Reviews.Content: This is a good 3-4 star hotel in the Sheung Wan district of Hong Kong island. Our room was small, but we paid a bargain basement rate through Agoda, so we weren't too concerned. Aircon, hot water, etc was fine and the staff very obliging. There is also an open air pool which is a bonus. The evening buffet dinner was outstanding at AUD$40 per head. The location is good, a short distance to Soho, Admiralty, Causeway Bay and Central Station. Buses, trams and trains are close by.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel for a short getaway”
Reviews.Author: FamilyYogaSpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a short getaway and we have no complaints. Great value for money. We got what we paid for, and the little add ons and extra touches made our stay very comfortable. From the bell boy and concierge smiles to the Front Desk staff, they all greet, speak clearly english and are extremely helpful, specially when calling for taxis. The rooms are small (which didn't bother us at all since we were there to shop and walk around) and clean. Swimming pool and gym are clean and have the basics for a work out. The hotel is at a convenient location, just 10minutes walk to-from the busy streets and shopping areas in central. We did try the Bar once, for some lunch. Menu had a lot of choice, presentation was good and tasted good as well :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Mon59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as a single female traveller. Requested a non-smoking room and was given Room 308 which was right in front of the elevators which was great for me. It was a corner room, very small but compact and comfortable. I could not fault the cleanliness of the room and the airconditioning packed a powerful punch! Bathroom was standard but clean and everything in the room seemed fairly new. It also had a flat-screen TV and a small work desk. Room would have been tight for a couple. The view on one side was of the harbour and on the other side, the surrounding streets (not a great view) and neighbouring flats. Location was convenient to get taxis but am not sure of the distance to the nearest MTR and it is in a very local area with a mish-mash of dried seafood shops, little local eateries, convenience stores etc. My rate did not include breakfast and I suppose I could have gotten a better deal for this room but all in all, i felt safe and comfortable here. The staff were exceptionally polite and friendly, always smiling and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “High quality/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: D G
Reviews.Content: We hesitated to pick this hotel because of the location, that many described as a problem since it is 15 to 20mn away from the nearest subway entrance. However the tram is only 3mn away by foot, so location turned out not to be an issue at all (even with luggage: bus A10 from the airport drops you 3mn away from the entrance, and on the way back if you wanna take the subway you can get there thanks to the hotel's free shuttle bus, mentioned below). The room is small, alright, but this is Hong Kong's standard so there's not much more to say about it. Everything was clean and we just got disturbed at 9.00 in the morning by the cleaning lady (since we arrived the previous day we wanted to sleep a little bit). However this was dealt with the next day by hanging to the door the "don't disturb" paper. Check-in and check-out were no problem (we booked through Zuji.com as we read the deposit from booking.com was not necessarily taken into account) and it is possible to leave the luggage in the hotel if coming too early for check-in or leaving too late for check-out. Also the little shuttle bus provided by the hotel turned out to be quite useful (although not that frequent: every 30-45mn) to join main destinations fast (IFC towers, Central...) and it was no problem to use it even after check-out, to get to the subway. The concierges at the entrance were all very friendly and helpful so we strongly advise to shoot your questions at them. Special mention for the in-room wifi and the 2 free water bottle we got every day. If we have to provide downside, we'd mention the expensive food (but there are plenty of cheap places just outside the hotel to eat breakfast or a full meal) and the difficulty to set the air conditioning on "not too cold". Maybe also the swimming pool closing too early (7 pm) but we didn't really come for that anyway... Finally if we ever come back, we'll most probably pick this hotel again, and that is a sign of quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: alissaks
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit to Hong Kong and was there on business. The hotel was recommended by the folks I'm visiting because we could get a good corporate rate and easy to get to where my meetings were. Having said that, if I come back for business again, I would stay elsewhere. The main reason is that it would be nice to walk outside and have a restaurant or bar(s) around, which there aren't any or at least not any that I found. The hotel itself is fine. Everyone is very friendly and the concierge service was excellent. There is shuttle service to Central and the ferry, which I took advantage of and then walked from there but, as taxis are quite inexpensive, I did take those as well. The rooms were fine, with small bathrooms. There was complimentary bottled water, which was nice and a minibar which I didn't use. Upon checkin, I asked for a room higher up, which they agreed to grant me since I was staying her 4 nights. It was worth a shot to ask and glad I did since I had a floor to ceiling window of the harbour. The best part of the room. I ate breakfast one morning, which was a buffet and $20 and not worth it. It was simply mediocre and not at all worth the price. I'd rather grab a coffee later and eat a tasty lunch out (which is what I did). There are a few convenience stores nearby where I bought more bottled water, snacks and beer, which I was glad was nearby. I've read other reviews about the fish smell and I never noticed it, although this is the largest area in the world for selling shark fins. To be honest, I didn't look at any other hotels since this was where it was suggested I stay, so perhaps it is that much cheaper. However, with the size of HK and the amount of hotels I've seen, I feel I could've found something in an area with more restaurants. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st class service”
Reviews.Author: Antony K
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife for our third anniversary to Hong Kong and Island Pacific Hotel served us really well. The location is just right for holiday goers as you have access to the trams, buses and the MTR!! you can go anywhere in Hong Kong from there. They treated us like super stars and we really enjoyed it. We stayed in the habour view room that was just amazing both during the day and at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but small and airless”
Reviews.Author: Jack9003
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonable hotel if you need to be close to the University of Hong Kong. It is also just across from the Sun Yat Sen sports facility with a magnificent pool and views of the harbor. The breakfasts are extensive and expensive. Apart from the location and the food, this hotel has little to offer. The views from the rooms are great but the rooms themselves, at least rooms that are not suites, are small, very small, cramped and airless. I found myself quite claustrophobic in the small space for 5 nights. All in all, I think you can do better in Hong Kong than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: moonysummer
Reviews.Content: I had a very good experience with the hotel and the staff. I called their front office to check if i could do early check in since i arrived in Hongkong early in the morning. The staff told me he could not guarantee but i could try. So i went there. The staff ( i forgot his name) was very accommodating and he allowed early check in for me. I requested for a good view and when i checked my room, wow! i had the best harbour view! It was really nice! The room has almost complete amenities, it has flat iron and the "iron horse", it has ipod dock, hair blower among other things. I just didnt' expect it for the price i paid. It really was worth it or much more. The only downside is it's far from shopping district but it's ok since they have shuttle service and airport bus but for the airport bus, you have to reserve 2 hours in advance, i wasnt able to avail it though. The staff, they all are really helpful. I asked their conscierge how to go to St Paul Hospital and where to take #5B bus. The staff wrote the address in cantonese character and told me to present it to the driver of the bus. He also told me where to take the bus. All in all, i found the stay totally wonderful, enjoyable and super worth what i paid!

Reviews.Title: “Please do not have your expectation set high”
Reviews.Author: Sam B
Reviews.Content: Very good value hotel if you are not expecting much. The rooms are aged, but decently clean. Pictures are a little bit deceiving and it is not in central or sheung wan it is in sai wan. This is where people in hong kong go to have an affairs and the clientel is mainly from china. Checked out the first night when i arrived as it was below my expectation. I would give this hotel a 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, will be perfect when new train terminal finished. Service at front desk could be better.”
Reviews.Author: oceanomad
Reviews.Content: After staying in various hostels across China this was our first bit of 'luxury', although expensive it lived up to our expectations, it was clean, comfortable, easy to find. We had some food in the Cafe near reception which was a tad expensive for lunchtime but good nonetheless. The pool was clean and well maintained with two lifegaurds on duty all the time. The concierge service was efficient and always manned, booking a transfer to the airport was a breeze. The location of this hotel is good, about fifteen to twenty minutes walk from Central station and right opposite the exit of the road tunnel from kowloon. When the new train terminal is finished by the International conference centre this will be an ideal place to stay as it is about a five minute taxi ride from Kowloon under the tunnel and out almost right in front of the hotel. This hotel would make a perfect place to stay if on business - we used a price comparison site to find the best price and booked only a few days before we arrived. We would definatly stay here again if we came back to HK. We only had one gripe and that was that when I booked the room I asked for it to be ready early in the morning around nine o'clock. We had come from China on an overnight sleeper bus and were very tired. When we arrived we were told rather rudely that our room wouldn't be ready until 11am even though we specifically requested early check in in our booking.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, improvement needed to housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Joy2212
Reviews.Content: I had stayed 4 nites at this hotel recently. It would have been an excellent hotel if is not due to its housekeeping standard. Location: although it is not located very near to sheung wan MTR, but tram station is just walking distance from hotel and taxi services also easily accessible. It was just about 10min tram ride to Central. There is also free shuttle bus services to few key locations. Services: the staffs were excellent and always helpful. Check in and check out were fast and hassle free. Room: my room was upgraded to executive room at 27th floor. Overall the room amenities were alright. The only drawback would be its housekeeping. On the first nite, we found out hairs beneath the floor mat, which was quite disgusting. On the 2nd day, while we were having afternoon nap, one staff pressed the bell, asking whether any housekeeping done for our room. It was quite disturbing actually. In addition, we also spotted hair and stain on the towels. So, overall I would rate this hotel as average for its housekeeping standard.

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: ellie m
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. There are much better ones that are cheaper. They market the food highly and it is the worst place that I ate in my 2 week stay! Really bad food! The room smelt of smoke every time that we came back to it (on a non smoking floor) and when we rang down to reception they sent housekeeping up with a worse smelling air freshener and that was it! Not the best value for money. Location is not too great either, it is on a street that has a lot of dried fish shops and it smells so bad! so so bad!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sawadeek
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during 3day stopover in HK,excellent service and amenities with true value for money spent Airport bus leaves round trip from Water St 2 blocks north,easy walk even with luggage $65 HK return would definetly stay there again upgrading to a larger room

Reviews.Title: “One Word: Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bebe M
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT)))))))))))) My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 10 nights, it was excellent..... - Our room was prefect, clean, comfort with the lovely harbor view. - All staff were very attentive, efficient, professional, friendly and helpful. - We stayed over 4 nights get the 20%off, just like 3 stars hotel price but get the 5 stars hotel service with the beautiful lovely harbor view room. it was excellent value!!! - Easy to get the taxi, bus, mini-bus, MTR and cable car..... also hotel have a shuttle bus for all hotel guests, it was very easy to catch a ferry to go to Kowloon. - Good location for get some HK's style food/restaurants, 24hours Circle K is just next the hotel, supermarket walk around 3mins and 24 hours Mc Donald just walk around 4mins. you wont get hungry :) - The hotel got many type of pillows for all the hotel guest. - Love the fresh fruit. - The buffet breakfast was good, but they just give a person/ per room a free buffet breakfast. - The house keeper was awesome, we called them ask for some ice at mid-night. they still gave you a nice smile when they're serviced us :) - The TV was not that good!!! but we dont care it, because we not always stay at hotel room and watch TV. - Free Wi-Fi @ Room..... fast speed!!! awesome :) Dear island pacific hotel: i will be back soon <3 Seriously....... if you look for a hotel which have a nice harbor view with the great valus. this is the one what you looking for!!! Please Do Not Miss It!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: WindDancer9225
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few days at this hotel in April . It is right on the waterfront and, if you ask you may get a room that looks out over the busy harbour( as did the room I had ). Easy walk to the nearest MTR and there are always taxis, cheap in HK as well as trams and buses. Buy an Optus Card , ( electronic sotrage ) best thing to get around with.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Shaowei
Reviews.Content: Big room for HK, nice view, free wi-fi, free shuttle bus to a few locations, bath tub, excellent service. Only minor complaint were drilling related to repairs on the ground floor, and long wait for elevator.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel with great attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: dreamer2207
Reviews.Content: stayed in this hotel whilst having a holiday with my mum, its about a 15-20min walk into the main shopping area of Hong Kong, its a short taxi ride to the train station where you can get the underground to the ladies and temple street markets. You can get the bus from round the corner to stanley market. The hotel itself had fantastic who gave fantastic customer service - they wouldnt let my mum or i carry our own bags insisted on taking them for us. The room was a good size with two single beds, clean bathroom,a LCD wall mounted tv and a fridge with mini bar. There was also free bottles of water in the room which were replenished every day if you drank them. Our view from the room was onto the harbour which was beautiful with floor to ceiling windows. My mum and i ate in the hotel for breakfast every morning, buffet style with all types of foods (yogurts, eggs, beans, sausages, cereals, mountains of fresh fruit, breads, pastries, and also cantonese selection). In the round about area of the hotel was made up of mostly food shops that sometimes did have an unpleasant smell but nothing major

Reviews.Title: “Good seaview and convenient”
Reviews.Author: suyt
Reviews.Content: Back from Shanghai, stayed here for1 night. Clean and good sized room with complete facilities and furnishings. It's not too crowdy/noisy like in Causeway Bay but must accept the fishy smell from numerous shops selling dried seafood when you travel by tram or walk out. There are many eateries nearby, 5min walk to Wing On and Sincere department stores for your shopping so you dont have to squeeze with crowds in central and Causeway Bay. This is closeby to Macau ferry terminal, IFC accesible by taxis anytime. Most importantly use trams which is the cheapest mode of travel as shuttle to any part of HongKong without getting caught in traffic jams. When in coffee shop, make sure that the pasteries are fresh as noticed that unlike singapore, unsold items are discarded and not offered to customers overnite.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: wanderingage
Reviews.Content: 4 star hotel at 3-star price! We slept great and would stay here again. The hotel is just outside the main areas of hong kong, but cheap cabs make it a convenient location. We took cabs to the center all the time for 20-30 hkd per trip. Wired and wireless wifi worked great. Only downside was probably the fan in the bathroom. There was no way to turn it off so there was always this constant fan noise. But we slept with the bathroom door closed and that helped.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: Daniel-CPT
Reviews.Content: If you manage your expectations you should be satisfied. The hotel is located in the old part of Hong Kong island amid many dilapidated buildings - which HK has many of in stark contrast to some of the most amazing skyscrapers. The area is very safe and close enough to tourist attractions and the harbour where you can get a ferry to the mainland/ Kowloon. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service to key points on the island. Taxis are readily available and there is a tram stop within a stone's throw from the hotel. Public transport is very affordable. The room I stayed in was spacious enough with all the necessary amenities to make my stay very comfortable: aircon (a must!), flat screen tv with a good choice of channels, hairdryer, desk, coffee making facility, stocked bar fridge, slippers and a gown. The fast and free wi fi came in handy. The bath could do with a new coating. I only used the shower (head above the bath) because of this. The view from my room (on the 21st floor) was lovely! The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a champion. The staff at the hotel is professional, friendly and helpful. The restaurant, lobby, gym and swimming pool is nothing to write home about, but nice to have should you decide to use any of these. The facilities are clean and well maintained with signs of aging starting to show here and there (in comparison to newer hotels). This hotel offers good value for money. It is not the latest and greatest, but good enough for a comfortable stay in Hong Kong at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: GordonELondon
Reviews.Content: We chose a room with harbour view, which gave us great views of the bustling harbour and across to Kowloon. Floor to ceiling windows on two sides. All staff were very attentive and efficient. You got the feeling that nothing would be too much trouble for them. The room was perfectly adequate for a couple. The location appeared to be in the Chinese quarter of Central West, which made it interesting to walk around. Always felt safe. The bustling Central district was only a short tram ride away, but you could take the free hotel shuttle service if you wished. We had a very pleasant stay in Honk Kong and if we do return, we will certainly stay at Island Pacific Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “small high end hotel at lower cost”
Reviews.Author: Andrea2018
Reviews.Content: Very nice room with all amenities and free wireless internet. It's now my first choice of hotels when I am in Hong Kong. The main reason that the rooms at the Island Pacific Hotel cost less than comparable rooms in other hotels is it's location - on the western side of HK island, a bit away from the Central district. The subway does not go all the way to the area of the hotel, so that seems a deterrent to staying there. However, you can take the tram, which has two stops in close vicinity to the hotel on Des Voeux road - turn left into Des Voeux for the closer one. Any one of the trams will take you to Central for 2.30 HK dollars and any but the one marked "Western Market" will take you back to the hotel. If you're nervous about getting off on the right stop on the way home, take stop "Eastern Street", which is the second stop after the tram makes it's zig zag away from Des Voeux road around the Western Market building. For dinner, you are best off taking the tram to another area because the few restaurants you'll find are all extremely local in nature, possibly even without an English translation of the menu. If you do want to stay in the neighbourhood, turn right (west) on Des Voeux - you won't find any restaurants if you turn left/towards Central for about 15 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mic213
Reviews.Content: My partner and I come to the Island Pacific every time we stay in Hong Kong. We stayed in the Full Harbour Room, which allowed us an unobstructed view of the ICC building in West Kowloon. List of all the fabulous things: - the front door staff, who are so polite and helpful, and the free shuttle bus which takes you to places in Central including Hong Kong Station - the comfortable bed and (relatively) spacious hotel room - the complimentary bottles of water which were restocked daily - the free toiletries, including the free toothbrush kit

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but nice staff and very good service”
Reviews.Author: KikouOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with an elegant chandelier in the lobby. Although the rooms are quite small, they have floor-to-ceiling windows, some looking out over Victoria Harbour, and high ceilings which prevented claustrophobia. I haven't stayed elsewhere in Hong Kong so I don't know if this is the normal room size in HK. Compared to other countries however the room was very small although well designed. The room was very clean and modern with a desk and flat screen television. Unfortunately, the channels in English were not very interesting. News, sports and not much else was available. Amenity kits provided emergency toothbrush and paste and a razor and shaving cream as well as the expected shampoo and soap. Nice touch. The hotel is located in a very Chinese neighbourhood where not much is signed in English. I had difficulty in finding somewhere local to eat since most little restaurant showed no pictures and had menus only in Cantonese. However, it is a quick ride by taxi, bus or tram to the city centre taking mere minutes. There is a bar where you can eat in the lobby but I didn't try it. I used the business centre's free internet station. The business centre lounge is quite utilitarian but offers some snacks. I didn't use the pool. The doormen staff were particularly attentive and pleasant which made for a nice welcome. At one point I rang for service when I couldn't get a pay-per-view movie to show on TV. A technician arrived within five minutes to see what he could do. While he wasn't able to fix the problem, I appreciated his promptness. The staff at this hotel succeed at providing very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay + Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Kean L
Reviews.Content: The staff in the hotel make you feel welcome. Free shuttle bus to the MTR station, walking distance to the Ferry Terminal, located near eateries, Great location away from the busy city. Well maintained hotel. Room is just great as well. Best of all, the staff just keep smiling everyday no matter what time you arrive back to the hotel lobby, they greet you happily. I received the below note in my email upon arriving back to my home country: Dear Kean, Thank you very much for your stay at Island Pacific Hotel on your recent trip in Hong Kong. We hope your stay with us was delightful and enjoyable. If we can be of any assistance to your future stay, please feel free to contact us. My team and I look forward to having the pleasure of your back in the near future. With warmest regards Management and Staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Surprising Drinks”
Reviews.Author: CityJudge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to everything. The buses, trams and mini buses are just in front of the hotel and access to all kinds of eateries and shops are just minutes away. There is a bar on the second floor lobby and to my surprise they offer a wide variety of surprising drinks --- including even a boiled coke with ginger which according to the grandma's family recipe is healing to the cold and running nose and that really works! The rooms were clean yet the service was only so-so. I like the hotel anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnZ05
Reviews.Content: Location quite good on Hong Kong island, 20 min walk from Central, 10 min to Macau Ferry. They provide a free shuttle during the day. Hotel full of charm, certainly a bid old but very well kept and maintained. Had a standard room on a high floor at a very very interesting price (around 800 HKD) for what it delivered. Quite small (especially if you are 2 as there is not much storage) but very clean, a quality bed, free Wifi in the bedroom with strong signal, very pleasant glass windows with a nice view on the city, which gives the room a lot of charm, a small desk and a plasma TV on the wall with a good choice of channels. Small marble bathrooms, but very clean, with everything you need (dryer, soap, shampoo)... Free slippers in the room. With the offer I took (30% off for a more than 4-night stay), breakfast was included, which was very good and quite complete(there was even freshly squeezed carrot juice!). Staff efficient but a bit cold (and finicky, they argued for 40 HKD cents which is roughly 5 USD cents on a bill over 500 USD). Overall a very pleasant experience, especially at the price you can get it (800 HKD!)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Gowapo
Reviews.Content: Great Staff to start with, the rooms biger then the standart rooms on Hong Kong, clean, polite staff, the total 4 days i stay was good and i will be back, close to the MTR and if you read a map, its easy find your way around, we made it to Disneyland by MTR and the price was less the a McDonalnd burger. Free internet wireless or wired was great, close the every place you like to go, food, shopping. Overall: Get bus #A10 from the Airport, he drop you in front of the Hotel way to get here and save money for gifts...lol Thank you for all the staff who made our stay nice. Gowapo

Reviews.Title: “reasonable”
Reviews.Author: scugnizzoHongKong
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times. A very comfortable and well located hotel. obviously not 5 star but the rooms are nice and well appointed - although a little small by international standards, by Hong Kong standards they are fairly standard (we have stayed at similar hotels in Hong Kong) and the staff are always cheerful and helpful. they have a very convenient shuttle bus down to Central District. The surrounding areas are interesting worthwhile exploring. I would certainly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerGirl00
Reviews.Content: Located just west of Central, this hotel was perfectly located. The tram toward Central is around the corner and is just a 10m ride. Also within 1 - 2 blocks of the hotel you have Watson's, 7/11 convenience store, and small & tasty dim sum shop, herbal stores, markets, etc. The hotel itself is nice with friendly staff. The rooms are of good quality and well maintained. The room and bathroom are both small -- but this is on par with the rest of Hong Kong hotels, particularly centrally located affordable ones. Water pressure and hot water in shower were excellent as well. Would stay there again as we had a good experience and found it to be good value.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the Job Done”
Reviews.Author: sfo2mnl
Reviews.Content: If you need a good price option for a hotel on the Hong Kong side, the Island Pacific gets the job done. The rooms are not too small for a city of small hotel rooms. The room was clean though the amenities are a bit dated. The breakfast buffet is decent, the staff helpful enough, and getting a taxi was very easy. Also, getting to other parts of Hong Kong are easy as the trams are easily available on Connaught Road and Central and the Star Ferry a few minutes walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Island Pacific”
Reviews.Author: charliewhittaker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times while in Hong Kong and would recommend it for anyone looking for a place to crash. The staff are particularly helpful and friendly, and the breakfast is decent and well replenished whenever something starts to get depleted. The rooms are small but clean and tidy. The location is quite central but taxi drivers can end up taking a long detour to drive from Connaught Road so don't be afraid to yell "stop!" when you see the sign. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kondan
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at the Island Pacific Hotel. We have found the hotel to be clean and well appointed although the rooms are tiny. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom is clean but small. The breakfast is reasonable but not luxurious and the dinners at the restaruant are overpriced. All in All, staying at this hotel is a pleasant experience and a good value. We will probably stay there again. It is located in easy walking distance to Cenral, IFC and the Star Ferry. We like the location because it is easy to hop a tram to go most places on Hong Kong Island an is also easy to get to the subway to go to the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: Was there in Mid Nov 2011 for a family trip. Received a warm welcome from the hotel staff and throughout my 5D4N stay, they were always helpful and friendly. Food-wise, the hotel is surrounded by local eateries and fast food. McDonald's is just around the corner, Cafe de Coral is 2 streets away, and there's are two neighboring stalls that sell braised goose and local porridge which is delicious. There's a convenience store around the corner too Hotel's shuttle bus operates till 6.30/7pm, which isn't very helpful if you intend to venture into the nightlife of Hong Kong. The local buses stop at about a street away so you may need familiarise with the surroundings before taking the buses. However, the drop-off points for the shuttle bus is helpful in the day, may it be heading to Macau from the Ferry terminal or just to the Central MTR station. Just be sure to check the schedule before you make your plans. Otherwise, cabbing from Central would probably cost you only about 30-40HKD. Hotel room's a little small, in particular the bathroom. They have bathtubs but don't expect the standalone tubs. Furniture in the room is also a tad outdated. Gym is minuscule too. Bathroom has some mold and mildew on the wall tiles. All in all, a hotel with friendly and helpful staff, not-so-convenient location with little facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: My first visit to this hotel. Rooms were pricey due to a big event in town, but still reasonable compared to other hotels. I do not know this area so I cannot comment on whether the hotel is well situated, but we did struggle repeatedly to get a taxi. Check in was fast and pleasant. Staff were nice. Room was fine and had great harborview. Internet was free! Bathroom was well maintained, but not updated. My room rate did not include breakfast. Checkout was very fast. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is definitely Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Deelum
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a charming part of the old town very nostalgic just like in the 60's when I first came here as a small kid will bring my grandson on my next trip . Thanks for the memories

Reviews.Title: “Watch your credit card”
Reviews.Author: 92ttz
Reviews.Content: Had some good and 1 really bad experience at this hotel. Rooms are nice, wifi is good and the restaurant is ok. I checked in 14th and stayed 7 nights. Last night American Express called me and asked if I was in Hong Kong, i confirmed and they then asked if I had used my card a lot lately, something I denied. I had only used the card when booking the hotel at Booking.com and then i was in Thailand, and upon arrival at this hotel. Amex told me that someone had used my card (copied) around Hong Kong at places like Watsons, Pizza Hut, supermarket etc and they had now cancelled the card. I alerted the reception about this and talked to one of the managers and although polite and trying to be helpful, nothing much really came out of it. They asked me to report it to the police, but this is Amex thing not mine and i cant report it to the police as i dont have the details, Amex do. they showed little understanding for that. My problem was that i was a long way from home, without a working Amex card and i was going hone the next day and have to change some plane tickets that will probably cost me some and i am not sure how to fix that without Amex. Compensation from the hotel for causing me all this problems, 53 hkd discount on breakfast. WOW.

Reviews.Title: “Photography does wonders”
Reviews.Author: lexi1980
Reviews.Content: Wow- the photos had me sold...also some very good reviews. So what the heck type of room did they give me? Picture a 1985 Holiday Inn Room. Annoying noise in bathroom all night...and the beds.. I won't get started on how bad the beds were. Room faced a good view of buildings (maybe the water view rooms are nicer?) Staff was good though - after some language barrier issues (I think), they came around. Nice shuttle bus to airport though - prompt and you get great scenery over the bridge- cost 20 USD. Location is good as long as you like to walk. Try Grand Stage for dim sum.. also a good claypot rice place - 15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “In the Chinese quarter great views if you get a harbour view”
Reviews.Author: BorntocruiseUK
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking. The first room we were given smelt of smoke but they changed us with no hassle. The staff were helpful and friendly. The rooms were a good size with a very nice bathroom. The fridge contained a bottle of complimentary water. With tea and coffee available. The bathroom had a lovely supply of toiletries. Slippers were provided. Our first room over looked the residential blocks. You could see people going about there every day life in them. The second one overlooked the harbour which was beautiful and great to watch the Macau ferry travelling up and down. The hotel is situated in a mainly Chinese district. This only caused problems trying to find something to eat; as all the menus were only written in Chinese. It is easily placed for transport be it buses or trams. The hotel has a restaurant which all though we didn't use looked reasonably priced. It also has a beautiful swimming pool. Free wifi is available in the bedrooms. The windows are from floor to ceiling, with a pleasant seating area. There is also an iron and ironing board with a safe in the wardrobe. The exchange rate at the front desk was comparable to what you could get outside. We found the bell boys extremely helpful with both information and maps. I would recommend the hotel and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really?”
Reviews.Author: Milloscampeon
Reviews.Content: Is this the same hotel you see in their website? Really? Small room, really small bathroom ( move to the side to close the door type ), HORRIBLE disgusting carpet, smelly obviously used to be all smoking rooms. Stayed one night price on Agoda was competitive with 'similar' hotels such stayed somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Doublekite
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at this hotel and I still cannot find a fault. OK so its not in the 5* league like some hotels in Hong Kong, but you are paying nowhere near the 5* price either.We booked in the UK through British Airways website (although we flew with Qatar!) and paid less than the hotels best direct price. We also got a daily paper and late checkout included. I doubt if any of the top hotels (of which I have stayed in some) could better the standard of customer service and friendliness of the staff which starts the moment you walk through the door, and are relieved of your luggage without asking. The reception staff are very welcoming and rooms clean and inviting. Of course, like all HK hotel rooms they are not over huge, but who, when in HK, spends much time in their room? All the necessities are there, tea and coffee facilities (with extra supplies on request) and complimentary toothbrush, shampoo etc. However as another reviewer has said, up the side street opposite is a 7/11 convenience store and a Watsons (like a Hong Kong version of Boots the chemist) where all necessities can be bought if required. The mini bar in the room is of course expensive (which hotels aren't ?) so I bought beer at 7/11 where its about £1 a pint bottle and sometimes on offer too. The 7/11 sells fresh milk if you prefer it to the hotel sachets of creamer.We had wi-fi in our room and its free, as is wi-fi in reception. The nearest McDonalds if only 5 mins away round the corner from the above stores and is open 24/7 like many others in HK if you crave Western food. One tip for HK..many local small restaurants look like they are for locals only, with Chinese menus outside, but just ask if they have an English menu! Transport from the hotel is good, frequent and cheap. The trams going to the left as you leave the hotel go to Central and right across to Causeway Bay and beyond for a flat fare of less than 20p. To get to the Star Ferry, catch a bus 7, 91 or 94. Once at the SF terminus there are ferries to all the islands, across to Kowloon and buses up to the Peak (15). So, in summary, its a great location, great price, with plenty of local facilities. You can't go wrong! For the best harbour views, get a high floor and try for rooms ending in 08, 09, or 10 (eg 1808). I would be pleased to help anyone with public transport tips as we go everywhere by bus, tram and underground as its so cheap. All means of public transport runs early till late on high frequencys, have English & Chinese on the destinations, so you can't get lost!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Critic1974
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, as it was cheap and decent. It has good bus/tram links and a free shuttle bus service from the hotel. You can pop out and have a quick bite to eat at local restaurants at very cheap prices. Think duck and rice was only HK$20 which is pretty amazing. There were guys that hung around to help with luggage and queries which was a nice touch from the hotel. The bar was small but pretty quiet most of the times. Live night entertainment which was cheesy but it got better as the week progressed. The room itself was cold as the weather had turned unexpectedly during Chinese New Year, the heating seemed to have stopped working. The gym was basic but usuable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with good location at a reasonable rate...”
Reviews.Author: angeles624
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this hotel on September 14-18, 2009 and November 15-18, 2010. The hotel is located near the Macau-Hong Kong Ferry Terminal in Sheung Wan. From HKIA, you can take the Airport Express train and drop off at Central station. From there, it's only few minutes taxi ride to the hotel (about HK30). The Sheung Wan MTR station is about a 10-15 minutes walk from the hotel but you may opt to take the double-decked tram (fare: HK$2) to reach the station. Bus and tram stops is just around the corner. You can find an array of fast-food stores and restaurants such as McDonald's and Cafe de Coral nearby. For your personal needs, there is also pharmacy (Watsons) near the hotel. For your grocery needs, there are three (3) 7-Eleven stores and one supermarket (Wellcome) nearby. Room is ok. Room facilities include: Iron and ironing board, hairdryer, radio clock, and lcd tv. Minibar items, as expected, is very expensive. We are provided with welcome fruits (apple, pear and orange) but no complimentary bottled water. The hotel also provides shuttle service to the Airport Express station in Central. Overall, we had a very good stay and would book other hotel should we go back to HK again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: allanmac81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November 2011 for four nights. On entering the hotel itself we were greeted by the portering staff who immediately relieved us of our cases and directed us up the escalator to the first floor reception desk. We were checked in very swiftly and then directed up to our room on the 26th floor, arriving just moments before our cases. The rooms itself was small (as I believe is the norm for Hong Kong, where space is at such a premium), but this was not a problem. We had floor to ceiling windows on two sides giving us a fantastic view of Victoria Harbour and Kowloon beyond. It is about a 20 minute walk to Central or Soho from the hotel, but there is a free shuttle bus (which we didn't use) and the tram stops right behind the hotel on Des Voeux Road West (which we did use). The staff were all lovely, the hotel was spotlessly clean, each morning a copy of the South China Post was hanging on the door outside our room. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel as there are so many places around about to eat, so I can't comment on that. Whenever we were leaving by taxi the staff insisted on hailing it for us, while we waited in the foyer, a bit embarrassing at first, but it's all part of the service to them. When we return to Hong Kong it will definitely be to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel on Hong Kong island”
Reviews.Author: mleach74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights after booking it through the British Airways website for a very good rate - £158. Breakfast wasn't included but if you 'like' the hotel on Facebook (you each have to do this) you will get one free breakfast each. Breakfast was ok but I don't think I'd pay extra for it - about £15. We preferred getting the tram into Central and eating in a café (we liked 'Classified' - they have a branch in Sheung Wan which you can walk to in about 20 mins or get the tram and get off at the Western market then a 5 minute walk from there http://classifiedfoodshops.com.hk). Our room was ok - had a view of the harbour and it was very clean. Staff were very friendly. There is a free shuttle bus but we only took this once when we wanted to get to Hong Kong MTR station for the airport train. The tram stop to go into Central is just a few minutes walk. If you're using public transport I recommend you get an Octopus card at one of the MTR stations - we paid HKD $150 and used it for trams, the Star Ferry and the MTR. It didn't run out and in fact we handed them in at the airport and got the remaining money refunded. Another tip - if you're getting the airport train and there are two of you there's a special rate. Only takes 25 minutes. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a good value 3-4 star hotel on Hong Kong Island. Good location, great value and you don't feel like you're in a soulless area designed for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenny_S_W_1988
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is excellent – close to the trams, the shops, restaurants, entertainment etc etc. Lovely modern room, clean bedrooms, excellent food and extremely friendly & helpful staff! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staffs, clean room & convenient transportation.”
Reviews.Author: harapan123
Reviews.Content: We went to Hong Kong in mid January 2012 and stayed at Island Pacific Hotel. The location is very convenient, there are many food stalls, convenient stores within walking distance. The room is neat and clean and, the mattress is firm. The public transport is also easy to access and high frequency, such as buses and trams with the bus/tram stop nearby. The cost is affordable, we can take bus number 5, 5B to go Wan Chai which costs about hk$2.40/person. The hotel staff is very helpful to provide all the transport information we need. Moreover, most of the Hong Kong young citizens are English speakers and can give us direction. Furthermore, the hotel also provide free shuttle bus to the IFC mall which takes about 15 minutes. We can take the airport express train from here to the Hong Kong International Airport or vice versa. We can also check in our luggage at this point for most of the International airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the madness!”
Reviews.Author: flufster
Reviews.Content: We travelled to hong kong in November and stayed at this hotel. We knew it wasn't central but it was in a charming traditional area with good transport links nearby. There is a team stop outside the hotel and costs $1.60 hk for a journey. The mtr station is only 10- 15 mins walk away but often we just kept walking to central in the mornings in order to take in the atmosphere. The hotel runs a good shuttle service but it finishes early evening. Plenty circle k and seven eleven stores nearby to stock up on essentials. Also many laundries nearby that offer great service at cheap prices! Never use the hotel laundry! We found out on our last day that the hotel actually used the laundry we did but charged through the nose. We paid 20 dollars for full bag of washing! The concierge staff were excellent and always able to help and give advice. We found the reception staff we dealt with a bit aloof. When we checked in we mentioned that we had liked the hotel on the Facebook book in order to receive free breakfast. The person didn't really listen so we asked someone else later and were told just to sign anyway. We were still charged for breakfast despite all this but it was refunded eventually! The reception area of the hotel had an overwhelming perfumed scent probably due to the dried seafood in the area round about which incidentally isn't bad at all. Rooms were compact but clean with excellent shower and comfy bed. Free wi- fi always a bonus. Will definetly be back

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, very clean and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Arunprasad85
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during Chinese New Year. It's located within 5 minutes taxi ride from Central (costs about HKD 24.00 by taxi). However, the hotel run a shuttle between the hotel and central/HK station/admiralty every 30 minutes. So, we almost never needed a taxi when we had to commute to the MTR. Free WiFi connection is really good. The hotel staff set very high expectations for customer service right from the minute we checked in. I had wrong information about the hotel shuttle service and hence missed it when I arrived in the HK station. So, took a taxi to the hotel. Surprisingly, the front desk refunded me the taxi fare when I casually mentioned them that I couldn't find the shuttle at the station. (remember, I didin't even ask for the taxi fare becoz the mistake was partially mine). The cafereria is really nice and deccently priced; a la carte breakfast costs from $75- 100 HKD and a buffet cost about HKD 140... I stayed in a superior sea view room. The room was compact, but convenient for two people. This place is slightly more expensive than a budget hotel; but its worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SofiaofStockholm
Reviews.Content: First of all, I love the location. I always stay in this area when I visit HongKong; It has a lot more charm and a more genuine Chinese atmosphere than Central or other parts. The tram station is right outside the hotel, you should not visit HongKong without taking a ride on a tram! It is such a nice way to travel, and only costs about 2 HKD. The ride to central takes about 5-10 minutes. The hotel was surprisingly good, small but sufficient. Clean bathroom, comfortable bed, lots of international TV-channels. The difference is in the small details which I really appreciated; docking station for Iphone, free and really good wifi, and excellent service. I will recommend this hotel to my friends and I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, super service, good value”
Reviews.Author: docstefano
Reviews.Content: I am almost every month for a couple of days in Hong Kong. I have been staying in the Island Pacific already very often. pros: Rooms modern, clean, size is OK, not huge but definitely above Hong Kong average. Ask for the harbor view and high floors. fantastic panorama view over to Kowloon. Nice restaurant in house, Room service working well until very late. Bar is small but nice. Many restaurants in walking distance. Staff is very friendly, service flawless, Wifi free and speedy. cons: a bit off the track, but convenient shuttle service or HKD 30 to MTR stations. price is quite volatile. Booking directly over hotel web page is too expensive. Best rates from Agoda etc, and best in advance, then nice prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel.. If you dont mind a walk to the MTR”
Reviews.Author: Keith R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here January for 4 Days.. All the staff are very attentive. The Hotel lobby and bar over look the harbou and are very impressive.. The rooms are a little bit on the small size. But are very functionable with a good sized comfortable bed. The only downside is the walk to the MTR station. It probably only takes 20 mins but its hard going after a full day of walking around hong kong ..

Reviews.Title: “Good property in Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: Sandyraj1
Reviews.Content: Positives: Good clean 3 star hotel Rooms are clean and well kept You can see the ocean from some of the rooms Located in Hong Kong Island in Sheung Wan Buses and trams connect the area to Hong Kong Central The hotel also runs buses (for free) to Macau Ferry and Airport Express terminal Negatives Nearest MTR is 15 mins walk away The hotel is located in a market kind of area (some shops may be smelly with dried sea food) Rooms are fairly small (but that is true for most hotels in HK Island) Overall a good budget hotel located in Hong Kong Island

Reviews.Title: “A good option if you want this location”
Reviews.Author: vivian2010_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just on the western edge of the Western District, so it is not as convenient to MTR, Macau ferry, etc as other hotels. But it does have a convenient shuttle to the Sheug Wan MTR and central (Star Ferry, IFC, Airport Express). It also has a shuttle from the HK Airport which is much more convenient than doing the train (which is marginally cheaper but then requires a wait in the taxi queue, or MTR to Sheung Wan + a 10 minute walk). It is also pretty close to Hong Kong University, and seems to be a place to stay for the academic visitors. The breakfast is extremely average, but the buffet dinner was good. Rooms are on the small side, though pretty average for Hong Kong. Free internet is a plus. Views of the harbor and Kowloon is always welcome. The district remains old Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Andre D
Reviews.Content: An interesting area with lots of dry herbal shops, antiques and more. It's just far enough away from the centre to make an interesting trip, in most cases a little far to walk but still possible if you prefer this. Plenty of taxi's to get you where you want if you are in a hurry. It's very easy to jump on a tram within about 50 metres with plenty available often. It's a little far from the MTR, only if you are in a hurry....If so Just take a tram. A very nice hotel, good views. Very nice polite and helpful staff. All in all, a really great choice. Small rooms... All are small in hong kong. But less is more- it's the quality that counts. Remember most of the time spent in room is probably sleeping anyhow! You can save a good 90% on clothes cleaning by walking down the street 50 metres. The pool looks great in the photo. Of course it's only knee high to belly button deep at best! But, relax you have at least two life guards on duty....Just in case. I stayed. I enjoyed.. A lot. For the $ I can't fault it. .....Just book it. As long as your expectations are not 7 star plus, more like 4 1/2 to 5 You will probably be more than be happy with this hotel choice.... I was.

Reviews.Title: “Book a room with a view of the harbour”
Reviews.Author: Birthdaygirl01
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming and helpful staff, fantastic views to wake up to.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for room with HK harbour view and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: L00ps
Reviews.Content: My partner really wanted harbour view and for the price we paid, it was probably the most affordable around for HK island side hotels. The room was not big but comfortable. Wifi worked pretty well in-room which was appreciated. I also appreciate the issue with convenient access to MTR. We were fine just catching the tram (there is a stop on Des Veoux Road outside the hotel) to and from Central - not recommended if you have luggage, though. In terms of getting to the hotel from HKIA (airport), the A10 (single decker) Cityflyer bus (think it was HKD 48 one way) drops off at Connaught Gardens (first stop after the harbour tunnel) and the hotel is just 20 metres or so away, visible from the bus stop. This would be far cheaper and more covenient than getting the Airport Express into Central. Though the return journey isn't so covenient as the Cityflyer stop is located a 10 mins walk away on Water Street opposite the Courtyard by Marriot Hotel. However there are 2 Cityflyer airport buses including the A10 going from this stop to the airport i.e. more services. This hotel would work well if the traveller is happy to put in some effort to get to grips with transport. The CitybusNWFB app (on iPhone) is very handy. Plenty of well priced local eat places, pharmacist (Watson's) and supermarket (Wellcome) across Des Veoux Road on Centre Street. We particularly liked the Thai restaurant on First Street. The staff spoke pretty good English too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel but a little far from the action if you want to be in the thick of things”
Reviews.Author: dc_globetrotters
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, I got a free room upgrade. I booked through Agoda so I may have received the same benefit as one of the other reviewers who also advised that they got a room upgrade when booking through Agoda. Having read the reviews on the hotel, I wasn't expecting anything surprising. The room i was given was quite big for Asian standards and was extremely clean. My room overlooked other buildings but considering I wasn't in my room very much, the view didn't concern me at all - it was actually nice to sit back and watch the life of real Hong Kong residents going about their business. I arrived quite late on my first night so ordered room service - the meal was huge and was really nice. I also had the buffet breakfast one morning and found that it was really excellent value for money. The hotel was a little out of the way so I used the shuttle bus to get into town however either I didn't read the return pick up times correctly or there were some 'missing' pick ups as I sat for over any hour at Central Ferrys waiting for bus to arrive and ended up catching a taxi back instead. If I go back to Hong Kong, I will probably stay a little closer to the main centre but this would be the only reason that I would choose not to stay at the hotel. The staff were all very friendly and very professional and service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: couscous74
Reviews.Content: Average hotel. It was clean. Service was good. Location was a little out-of-the-way. Nearest MTR station is about 20 minute walk, but trolley service is a block away. If you're here as a tourist, you will want to stay someplace closer to MTR so you can get around. If you're here on business, you will want to stay someplace closer to MTR so you can get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, modern and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: GenevaSAFC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a pretty good location. It would be nice if it was a bit closer to the metro station but it's only a 10-15 minute walk or a short taxi ride (20 HKD). From the hotel you can get to the mid levels and Soho in about a 20 minute walk. The hotel has a lot of staff so requests are dealt with very quickly and all staff are very pleasant and friendly. The breakfast is very good and has a wide variety of food - when we stayed there they gave us a free breakfast for liking them on Facebook which I think is a good idea. The room we stayed in half faced the city and half faced the harbour. The outward facing walls are made totally of glass which allows you to lie on your bed or sit at the desk and watch the boats go by on the busy harbour. In summary, it's a very modern and clean hotel with good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel - could be better, could be worse.”
Reviews.Author: andrewsco
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel - all in all a good experience, but a few areas of improvement. First off I will start with the good: The front staff and conceirge are excellent staff - I can have no complaints whatsoever there. The food and drink I ordered in the hotel were good (both room and out of room service). The business centre was ok and the gym looked ok too (although I didn't use). The biggest drawback for me is the location. Although the Star Ferry is only 5-10 minutes taxi away we felt quite far away from everything. Last time we stayed in the YMCA on Nathan Road (Kowloon) and for the location alone it is worth staying there. Where as in Kowloon you have great shopping (both centres and markets) by the Island Pacific, unless you are trying to buy dried fish you won't find much! The room was ok. I've seen better and seen worse. It was small, but so are most rooms in Hong Kong. If you can get a good deal then it's an ok place to stay, but personally I think there are probably better located hotels for the same ball park price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in HK”
Reviews.Author: hoohoolian
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the Island Pacific. In most areas, the hotel struck me as more expensive than it actually was and the view is great if you upgrade to a room with bay view. The elevators were perhaps the quietest lifts I have ever been in. In fact I missed one once, because it was so quiet. I happened to turn and see the doors close and thought to myself: "Sneaky quiet!" The room was spacious (for HK) and the bed was excellent. There was a mini fridge only half used for purchasable items and some complimentary water. The bath was average. There was a desk with business hook ups. The MTR is a bit of a walk (15 min), but as is with all public transportation -- most things are a bit of a walk: try going to the wrong address and tell me how wonderful public transportation is. I opted to try the breakfast buffet on our last day and just couldn't put anything on my plate. The local and international selections were wholly unappealing. 200 yards away I got a lovely duck quarter for 28 HK$. Perhaps the best deals in HK, the US$5 lunch is alive and well here; literally billions of choices of things for under HK$40. Bring your own napkins, though!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but a bit far from MTR”
Reviews.Author: aTouristLawyer
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were given a smoking room despite the fact that we booked a non-smoking room (we have a child with us). The front desk receptionist was nice and gave us non-smoking room after 2 hours of waiting. Its good that we were allowed to wait inside the hotel room. Room was small (standard for HK). Shuttle service is free from hotel to Macau Ferry Station and Airport Express (IFC MALL). The location is a bit far from MTR-Shuen Wan Station - Hongkong Island Line. (MTR is very convenient in going places around HK) From the hotel, we need to ride a tram (HK$2.00) for 5-10minutes to reach the MTR. Outside the hotel, the smell is medicinal considering that the location is known for selling chinese medicines. There are 24hours convenient store available and some small restaurants (cheap food from HK$10), There are no fast food like McDonalds near the hotel. However, all in all, we enjoyed our stay. But if il go back to HK esp. bringing along my child to HK, i might look for other hotel that is located near the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: cqfp123
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights. The room was very small (15 square meters) - standard for HK. With two people, it is difficult to find enough space for the suitcases. The bathroom was also very small and the ventilation insufficient. Amenities included TV, coffee maker, fridge and iron. WiFi is included. There is a small exercise room with treadmill, stationary bike, elliptical (one each) and some free weights. For runners, you can run along the waterfront from the hotel, but air quality is a big problem. Buffet breakfast is excellent but overpriced (over USD 20). The stuff is very helpful. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle service to the ferry terminal and the Airport Express terminal, but it runs quite infrequently. The nearest subway station (Sheung Wan) is a 15 min walk or a short bus ride from the hotel (the bus stop is less than a block from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & decent hotel that's worth coming back again!”
Reviews.Author: JazzieTea
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! Although the room was compact (but not as small as many hotels in Kowloon), the facilities in the standard twin room was rather complete. For a start, I was greeted with a nice bolster on my bed! How many hotels ever provide bolsters, right? So I was thrilled! On top of that, the bed was comfortable with 4 pillows, we didn't have to request for extras. The bedside table even has an iPod / iPhone dock with speakers where we could simply plug in our Apple device and play the music straightaway! The bathroom was nice and complete as well, with 2 sets of toothbrushes and toothpastes, shower cap, ample bath, hand, face and floor towels, and a rubber mat for the bathtub (yes, it has a bathtub too!) to prevent slipping while showering. Island Pacific Hotel is situated in the western side of Hong Kong Island, and the hotel provides complimentary shuttle services to major neighbourhood areas such as the Shun Tak center where you can take a ferry to Macau, Sheung Wan and Central / Hong Kong MTR stations based on the guests' requests. The guests in the hotel mostly consist of business travelers from my observation after staying there for 3 nights. The reception staff and the conciege staff were all very nice and helpful in all possible ways to ease our stay in the hotel and were able to provide guidance on how to travel around the island. The deco of the hotel was also stylish in a classic fashion, ensuring a comfortable stay for the guests. All in all, I really love this hotel and I find the price quite reasonable for the standard and quality it is providing. I will definitely recommend this hotel to everyone visiting HK and I hope to go back again when there is an opportunity in future!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but the room is cramped”
Reviews.Author: VFM_Hunter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very coveniently located and a couple of miles from the Hong Kong Central station and the Macau Ferry terminal. The hotel also operates a shuttle service which is complimentary. The has a full glass window from the floor to the ceiling and the view is that of the Harbour which is pretty good in my opinion. The room had all the required facilities like the Tea/Coffee maker, Iron and Iron Board, writing desk, bath tub and decent quality toileteries. However the major shortcoming was the room size itself, it was pretty cramped which made it slightly inconvenient specially if you have two people sharing the room. I dont know if the hotel offers larger sized premium rooms at a price. Also the breakfast is not included with the room. Overall it was a decent experience and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanDoug
Reviews.Content: The hotel has amazing views across the Hong Kong Harbour from the front rooms.The rooms are clean and a good size. The location is great , with the trams passing the door. There is a curtesy bus to take you to the ferry, central,and other places, which was handy. Best of all were the staff, who went out of their way to help with anything ! Receiption was really good , but the boys at the entrance were fantastic ! I would recommend this hotel as a great well priced place to stay in a true local area .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff are so helpful”
Reviews.Author: MitchellLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in this hotel. The breakfast, which was not included was good although not cheap. Highly recommend it. The hotel staff & concierge are so helpful. Very useful shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Sized Rooms and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: PandoraYorkie
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed at the Island Pacific Hotel 8-15 Oct 2011 whilst on a business trip to visit suppliers and attend a trade show – This was our first visit to both the hotel and Hong Kong. The hotel is 30 minutes from the airport by taxi and overlooks the Hong Kong – Kowloon Bay. It isn’t near any major shops or restaurants. On arrival hotel porters quickly and efficiently took our luggage up to our rooms. We had booked via lastminute.com and paid for superior rooms. We were initially given rooms on floor 3 and floor 15. We had requested rooms on higher floors so that we might see more or Hong Kong and its landscape. Reception quickly agreed to change our rooms to be on floors 15 and 27. Both of these gave excellent views of the bay. Our rooms had large beds, a desk and small bathroom. The rooms were very clean and well presented upon arrival and bedding and towels were changed regularly. Other reviewers have mentioned small rooms in Hong Kong hotels. I have nothing to compare to locally but the superior rooms we had were fine for one person or a couple. There were similar to many medium priced UK rooms. We had booked on a room only basis. Breakfast was available (cost HK$150) and, on the occasions we eat it, had a good selection of international and Chinese food. Given the cost we would book it as part of the original booking if we visited again as we expect it would have been better value. There were very few restaurants nearby and so we walked or took the tram back into the central zone most evenings. A singer or pianist provided entertainment in the hotel bar some evenings.
