My colleague used the swimming pool and gym. The pool is outdoor (as very many other hotels) and the water was cold and seemed to have a slight “taste” which he thought may have been due to vehicle fumes. It didn’t stop him using it on several occasions though. Free Wi-Fi is available throughout the hotel. Free wired internet is also available in the rooms. All staff were very friendly and took a pride in their jobs. On one occasion a taxi we were expecting failed to arrive and the reception manager was very helpful, he called our Chinese supplier to explain the delay and arranged alternative transport. We did not speak Chinese so his assistance was very useful. The hotel provided a free shuttle bus to the conference centre for the Trade Fair. Overall a good hotel and I would stay there again. A few observations about Hong Kong itself: We had expected mosquitoes but had no problem at all in any part of Hong Kong or Kowloon. The hotel is about 30 minutes walk from the main Central part of Hong Kong Island. If you are staying more than a couple of days I recommend you buy an Octopus travel card from one of the railway station customer service desks. This allows you to swipe your fare on trams, buses, ferries, MTR trains and can be used in many convenience stores (7-11, Circle K etc) to buy your shopping. Using the card is far easier than having to find exact fares and being left with a pocket full of small coins. Hong Kong shops sell original goods not fakes so prices are similar to the UK. China is an hour away by train and you can get a 5 day visa at the border. The shops across the border don’t sell originals …. Use the Peak Tram to go to the top of the island; MTR and cable car to visit the Buddhist Temple on Lantau Island. Both are great places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Island Pacific”
Reviews.Author: Manukay
Reviews.Content: Stayed there by mistake because had not booked the usual hotel. Rooms are ok and clean. The safe is smaller than usual and little older. The restaurant ok but high prices. Same for breackfast. The real problem with this hotel is that you are a little away from Central. You can walk there, but its a half an hour walk. It is serrounded bye shops selling dried fish and little more. Difficult to get transportation in rainy days, although you have hotel shuttle to Central, IFC and Hong Kong Station. It is good to stay there if you visit Hong Kong for tourism, so you have time. Internet service included: good speed.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, generally good choice”
Reviews.Author: kobuse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably priced for a comfortable hotel on Hong Kong island. The Island Pacific is located next to Des Voeux street known for the interesting dried seafood and shark fin market (don't be alarmed by the initial smell). Local transport is easily available with a convenient tram stop just opposite the hotel. From there bus and MTR connections are available. (Public transport in Hong Kong is extremely reliable and efficient.) The hotel is also located very close to a CityFlyer A10/A12 bus stop for easy access to the airport. Rooms are average sized (for Hong Kong) and generally well appointed. Aim for a higher floor facing the harbour to get a spectacular view. My single complaint is that the beds were even harder than normal asian standards. It takes quite a bit to get used to. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast is a bit average and I'd recommend rather heading to one of the many excellent eateries in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macey101
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Island Pacific Hotel for 7 days, and found it an enjoyable experience. We had harbour view rooms which were worth the higher rate. Rooms are on the small side, but this is common in HK. Housekeeping was excellent with the rooms vacumed daily, on days that we said not to do the room, receipton would ring to make sure that this was correct and to ensure we didn't need anything. The staff are extremely polite and helpful, rushing to call elevators, opening doors, and carrying luggage for you. Breakfast was good and covered all palates. A shuttle bus service is available to get you to the ferry terminal, Central and airport train stations. Taxis are available at the front door, with trams and buses around the corner. The hotel is located in the dried seafood district so you get to see some interesting sights in the windows. Restaurants in the vicinity are primarily Chinese and the menus are written the same. Try the Derby West pub on the corner of Queens Rd West and Water St for a cool drink and great food, say hi to Alpha, the manager, he is the guy in the spectacle frames with no glass, a great guy, very friendly and helpful. Would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: awe2011
Reviews.Content: First surprise: No lift. We have to carry our big luggage to the second floor where the front desk located. The escalator is so narrow and steep. Beware. The first floor, they have two doors facing different direction. For taxi, it usually comes to the door which face inside to a basement of the building. For walking outside of the hotel, usually the guests use the other door. Confusing. The room is so unbelievably small. It's standard room. I've never become a demanding guest and when I write a hotel review, I try my best to be objective, looking to see all the positives and negatives of the hotel where I stayed from my point of view. You can prove it by reading all my reviews about hotels where I stayed in this site. Somehow, I think for this hotel, I have more negatives opinions than the positive ones. When we checked-in, they said that they would take care all of our luggage to each of the room. I booked 2 rooms, one for my family and one for my parent. Based on that promise, we directly go to the first floor again to continue exploring Hong Kong while we still have time and energy to do that. Surprisingly, when we got back to the hotel at 10 pm, the luggage are still not there as promised by the hotel staffs. We have to wait for almost an hour until they send our luggage. We are tired, want to take a shower, change clothes, brush teeth and use our own toiletries etc so it really makes me upset to wait and wait....until they send the luggage to my room. There are only 2 good points I can address about this hotel. First, it is located in a strategic location. It's near to Hong Kong tram and near to a local market so you can get your breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, groceries, etc along the streets nearby. Second, the view is awesome. It's near the sea so from the high floor room, you can see all those jet ferries come and go from the Star ferry pier. FYI, the standard rooms cost me USD 188,2 for 2 rooms. That means USD 94.1 per room. It was expensive compare to what I got: a very tiny room. Next time when I go to Hong Kong, I'd better survey harder to find a better hotel/better room at around the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevew918
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days and got used to the unique location. It is not near the subway station, so I have to find out more about the local places and transportation. Transportation: There are several ways to travel to and from the airport, including taxi (HK$300), hotel airport bus (HK$140 pp), airport train plus free hotel shuttle (HK$100 pp), and so on. I chose the City airport bus #A10 (HK$48 pp): purchase an Octopus card in the airport terminal, walk towards the right outside the airport terminal, look for the A10 bus stop, get on, about 40 min later, get off the first stop after the cross-harbor tunnel. The hotel is just half a block from the stop. Getting back to airport by the City Airport bus mode is more difficult as you have to walk west three blocks along the tramway to the bus stop on Water Street. To get around to different parts of Hong Kong, the subway station is a long walk away. The hotel does provide free shuttle service to ferry terminal and central area, but the interval is 30 minutes and I did not have the patience. I tend to take the tram near the hotel and go East, and you will arrive near the Sheung Wan subway station. If I need to go Kowloon side, I would walk a block east along the tram way, and look for the bus 109, 104, and 113. In any case, taxi in HK is relatively cheap and convenient. It seems there is always taxi right off the hotel entrance waiting for you. Good news is that the subway is being extended towards the hotel. When completed in around 2014, the subway station will only be about a block away. There is a reception desk on the ground floor, and the check-in is on the next floor. One thing I noticed was that the bellboys were very friendly and efficient. They would smile and open door for you. They would eagerly hail taxi for you and bring your luggage to your room. Wonderful friendly and efficient service! The room is OK size, but it would be very tight if you have more than two people. The bed is comfortable but the lighting is horrible. There is not enough light to read unless you sit at the desk. The view from my room is only OK as it faces high rise residential apartments. I heard the north facing room got beautiful harbor view. The TV has many channels including Chinese, CNN, BBC, movie and sports channels. There are several channels in other languages also. This is the best hotel TV channel package I have ever experienced. The free wifi internet connection in the room is fast and stable. Very NICE! Service was prompt. One day, they forgot to give us the two free bottles of water. I called the front desk, and within 30 seconds, the maid arrived smiling with the bottles of water and apologized. Impressive service! Wonder how they did that! The safe in my room did not work properly, you may want to double check before locking your valuables inside. For laundry, I used the Kwok Wah laundry, about a block up the Central Street. It cost me HK$30 or US$4 for seven pounds of cloths. Got my cloth washed and dried within three hours, not bad. Be forewarned that they wash all your cloth in a batch. You may want to separate your whites from colors first. This is area of dry goods shops, so you will smell some fish and so on. However, there are plenty of small café and restaurants nearby. Circle K and 7/11 shops are just around the corner. Also, if you know where to look, you can find great shopping bargains. I got several jeans for US$8 each, and they tailored fit the length for me for free while I wait, NICE! If you want to shop and eat Western, fancy styles, this may not be the place. However, if you do not mind experiencing how the locals live, enjoy great value and service, and bargain shopping, this hotel is quite convenient. By the way, I used Trip Advisor web site to book my room here and got a wonder deal, hehe.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: alexander_1984_1984
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights (for leisure) in an executive harbour view room. Service was great, staff friendly, attentive and kind, rooms were clean and well kept - room didn't have a direct harvour view which was disappointing but is the only fault I can pick out for my whole stay at this hotel. "Gym" consisted of two running machines and two weight machines but didn't choose the hotel for it's gym. Little extra's that the hotel offered were nice - free wifi, free umbrella rental etc. 15 minute walk to soho where lots of the "action" happens or a 3 minute cab ride - easy. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service, great executive room!!”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie C
Reviews.Content: Despite having the dried shrimp area located outside the hotel, Island Pacific is a great hotel and the concierge really go out of their way to help you, whether it's finding the laundry 1 block down, or the nearest wonton noodle or porridge restaurant. Well situated, take the tram or bus, or take the free hotel shuttle to Central MTR or other stations. Pool is very clean and there are 2 gyms that were helpful. The executive lounge had coffee/espresso with different varieties of snacks, free wifi in the hotel. The noodle place across is good and reasonable if you want a quick breakfast/ lunch. Go straight up to Queens Rd and make a right turn, try Thai In, very good Thai food. Enjoy your trip to Hong Kong, we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, weird location”
Reviews.Author: ZwennK
Reviews.Content: We've stayed 4 nights at the Island Pacific. The hotel itself is very, very good. Very helpful and attentive staff. Nice interior, lobby, bar/restaurant, pool, etc. are definitely at a high 4-star level. Our rooms were on the 21st floor and had side-harbor view, which means that we could see the westerns parts of Kowloon. Rooms were actually more spacious than expected (for Hong Kong standards) and very clean. Bathrooms are also nice, clean, and well maintained. Breakfast was extra - and quite expensive for Hong Kong. While the hotel itself was great the neighborhood around it isn't that cool - unless you like the smell of dried seafood. All around the hotel you'll find small stores selling dried fish and other stuff. There are a few dingy restaurants, no bars. So, for food you'll definitely have to go to Central. Transportation is not much of an issue. The hotel provides a shuttle, but the tram stop is closeby. Takes about 5 minutes to get to Sheung Wan. Taxis are also a cheap alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: AL011
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights as part of a trip alone to visit friends. The room was well furnished and clean. The only drawback is that it was quite small, but as a single traveler I had no problems. Bathroom also is new and cared of. There is a business center on top where you can enjoy a computer with Internet access at a reasonable price (if you go back some time later the staff will recognize you and you will not have to pay again). The staff is very attentive and nice and will do anything to help you with any problem. I suggest this hotel for people who want a deal, as its price is lower than others of the same level, due to the less "central" position, which is about 10 minutes walk to Sheung Wan MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price but a little out of the way for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Scottsdale_Rick
Reviews.Content: This hotel was priced very competitively and had many amenities (updated rooms with super-firm mattresses, on-site hotel, etc.). The only drawback was the distance to the nearest metro station. Fortunately, there is a free shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to the water ferry station, IFC mall and popular locations. The breakfast buffet was very reasonably priced and had a great selection. Front desk staff was also extremely courteous. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pkjain
Reviews.Content: I had a room on the 38th floor. Great harbor views. Staff was good. But the room size was really tiny for the price paid of US$ 200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A_Flying_Scotsman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and were a bit worried about the fact that we were pitching up at 0800 - would they make us pay extra for an early check in? Not at all - the staff were very welcoming and checked us in at 8am with no quibbles. The price was really decent. The location allowed us to walk all around town and right up to the funicular to the view point. When we inadvertently broke the safe, the staff were very quick to come and fix it. The view of the passing shipping from our hotel window was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BooksHampshire_UK
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights here at the end of a China trip and cannot fault their service which in HK, is already good anyway. Small but well-equipped double room with harbour view for less than GBP 70 a night. Terrific front desk and concierge. Interesting location on the outskirts of Sheung Wan amidst all the dried food and marine product shops (you'll either love this or hate this). Right on the tram route so a breeze getting into Central or Wanchai, 15 mins walk to the Sheung Wan MTR (but the tram is so much more fun and the equivalent of 20 pence), 15 mins walk to the Macau Ferry Terminal, regular free shuttle bus to key locations, close to the Sun Yat-Sen park so nice for evening strolls along the water. Free in-room Internet. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, clean, cosy, comfortable and quite!”
Reviews.Author: HerBerg2011
Reviews.Content: 2 nights there. Hotel staff: elegant, professional, available and kind. Room: big, comfortable and really clean, serviced even twice per day. It was mid-autumn festival so I found a welcome box with 8 moon-cakes. Side-harbor view, 10th floor, not really a great view (see the pics). Internet included (both LAN and WiFi), international plug adapters provided. Bottles of water for free, as well as small facilities (a kettle with tea/coffee/sugar) Location: a bit far away from the city center, 15'-20' via tram/bus (2.30 HKD), 10' via cab (30-40 HKD). Great if you want to walk in a "normal" HK road, with plenty of shops and restaurants where the locals are doing their shopping. Free hotel shuttle bus to/from the city center. 45-50' far from the international airport; shuttle bus available for 140 HKD/one way, comfortable, easy and careful door-to-door service. Price: Superior Side Harbour View double Room, 1 person, 2 nights: 1600 HKD, breakfast not included.

Reviews.Title: “SUCH A TREAT!”
Reviews.Author: uspork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Island Pacific for four nights and it was a wonderful experience! Location is great - close to Central, Sheung Wan, Lan Kwai Fong, IFC, and Kennedy Town. The trams and buses get you almost anywhere and they run late. Neighborhood is nice - tons of local cafes which are great places for breakfasts! There's a Watsons and a Manning if you want to do some shopping. The hotel has a airport shuttle service which we used both times, it's a bit pricey compared to Airport Express (140/person/trip) but it's the easiest. Room was decent and the service was impeccable. Newspaper was brought to our door every morning and they even gave us and big box of mooncakes!! Staff were polite, friendly and very helpful. I've always lived/stayed in Shatin whenever I'm in HK so staying near Central was nice for change. I liked taking the tram for some reason - I think it's a great way to sight see!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: bittercool
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and really like it for its spaciousness, given that most hotel rooms in Hong Kong are really small and uncomfortable. Located at Sheung Wan area, this hotel is 1 subway stop from Central. You can catch their free shuttle bus to Central or IFC Mall (where you could check in your luggages). For a more authentic feel of Hong Kong, you can take the tram which is a short walk away. There are several HK cafes, convenience stores and drugstores (Watsons, Mannings) near the area too. Hotel provides free wifi, and there is also a gym and swimming pool. Highly recommended for people who needs to stay at Hong Kong Island when in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff, good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: treetopsrainbow
Reviews.Content: We booked a last minute hotel here as we had a breaker on our holiday from Bali and thought we would visit. Staff were very helpful (we arrived at 01.00 am with tired 9 year old daughter) and could have done more. Had a delux room with harbour view & queen sized bed that was very comfortable. Air con was good and quiet so got a few good nights sleep. Location was OK but hotel has a specially laid on minibus to Central Station so easy to get around. Breakfast was excellent if a little pricey. A great hotel for children with swimmingpool (small pool but good for a quick swim) and really friendly staff. Would recommend as a good stop over that is not too expensive but in a great part of Hong Kong .

Reviews.Title: “Adequate 2.5-star hotel, good for short, layover stays”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer64
Reviews.Content: I confess, having just stayed at the much better Courtyard Marriott (not far from Island Pacific Hotel) for an entire week and a Mandarin Oriental hotel in Macau, spending my final two night at Island Pacific Hotel was a demotion, to say the least. However, my long trip to the region was all but complete and I merely sought out a cheap place for my last couple days. As far as layover/short stay hotels, IPH is not bad. I got a decent rate ($1,000HK/night), and upon check in, they upgraded me to an "Executive" room on one of the top floors, which boasted a splendid view of HK Harbour. Kudos and thanks to the desk staff for this upgrade. The room was okay, a bit worn down, rough around the edges, but the worst element was the bed, which felt like a cheap spring box mattress, only much stiffer. Part of this may be cultural. Asians traditionally like hard bed surfaces. I lived in Japan for a few years and got used to sleeping on thin futons on the floor. In my travels in Korea, I saw people sleeping on heated marble-stone beds! But I'm not Asian and when I travel in Asia, I much prefer a Western style mattress - soft and cushy. The desk staff at IPH were great, very friendly and efficient. The room service, same. Different story when I went to use the swimming pool. The two staff pool guys didn't even really acknowledge me, much less offer me a towel, and I was the only guest on deck!. The pool itself was refreshing, a great amenity if you are in HK during the hot & sticky times of the year. But during my visit in early September, there were ants crawling all over the deck of the pool and after a quick dip I didn't see much point in lingering on deck chairs lined with small army ants. I had already stayed at the nearby Courtyard Marriott so was very familiar with the location and neighbourhood. Some reviewers complain about this location, but I find it an interesting, less touristed, quieter part of town, a nice respite from the frantic pace of the more central districts. Public transit (especially the tram) into Central is breeze, and dirt cheap. At the end of the day, I describe IPH as a 2.5-star hotel trying desperately hard to be a 3.5 or 4-star hotel. Peel away the high rise facade and glossy web site images and it's a pretty uninspiring property, not a place I would like to stay longer than a day or two. If you book online at the right time, you may be able to get the nearby Courtyard Marriott for the same low price, or a couple hundred (HK$) more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice but great harbour views”
Reviews.Author: p750777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on hog island a little way from the centre in sheung wan. The area is fascinating as it's very Chinese with lots of small independent shops giving it lots of character. The challenge with hotels in hkg is rom size and the rooms here are small, I had a harbour view room which had a stunning harbour view which I would thoroughly recommend if you chose to stay here. The room made he use of space well but was a little Spartan and not particularly modern but when in hkg you don't nee to spend much time in your room. The room was clean and bathroom functional. I didn't eat at the hotel and there is an outdoor pool but I didn't use that either. This hotel offers excellent value for money if you are prepared to be a little bit out of the centre. I walked unto soho for food / drinks one evening which is a god place for bars / restaurants but is probably a 15-20 minute walk and much of it uphill at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tl8369
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner recently stayed at this hotel as it was recommend to us, we stayed from the 2 July till 24 July 22 nights. Stayed in the basic standard room and it was better than we had holed for, great room with all the usual stuff, view was great looking at the harbour especially during sunrise and sunset, price was fair being peak season plus free wi fi Internet for the full duration of our stay which is a bonus, would defiantly stay again next time, hopefully next year! And would recommend this hotel to all our friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Thorchick
Reviews.Content: I think I must have got some kind of fluke upgrade on this occasion, which may affect my feelings about this hotel, but nonetheless...... I booked for one night via British Airways following my flight into HK. I had already arranged to spend a further five nights at another hotel after this first night, but for the difference in price on balance I think staying at the Island Pacific might have been the better option. I paid around GBP50 for the room, without breakfast. I got an executive room on the 28th floor with an amazing view of the harbour and surrounding buildings (from the floor to ceiling windows). The room was really big - nice comfortable double bed and great bathroom with all the toiletries you need and more, and a separate bath and shower. There was also a little sofa and a separate chair and writing desk. Everything was spotless. As I had booked through BA I was told I didn't need to check out until 6pm the next day, which was a big bonus I wasn't expecting. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. As this was my first day in HK I needed a bit of advice about transport / locations etc and the concierge guys in the lobby were really helpful, even printing off maps etc to help me get around. You are not right in the middle of the tourist hotspots here, but actually I found that quite interesting - the dried fish shops were a sight to behold and you felt much more like you were seeing local life in this area. Also, you are literally a two minute walk away from a tram stop which you can use to get into the centre of things, and there is a free shuttle service to a couple of nearby MTR stations, so I wouldn't let the location put you off unless you really don't like having to make use of local transport. I would absolutely recommend this hotel on the basis of the above, it was amazing value for money. I would however comment that I didn't specifically book an exec room with views (and for 50GBP wouldn't have expected it) so other people's experiences might differ from mine.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynneleanor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 weeks. Bit of a walk from nearest MTR station but good free bus service to Central etc. Rooms comfortable but we found bed rather too firm which gave us backache! Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “For bussinees , sure I will come back & stay”
Reviews.Author: Ywij
Reviews.Content: Rooms is quite small not similiar like photo in hotel website...quite dissapointed for while , hotel is near bussiness area, if you come here for bussiness this is one of recommend htl , rooms is fix for 2 paxs but they have ipod dock , they have suttle bus to some places...if you come for holiday, the hotel is quite far from shooping area like causewaybay but near port to Macau

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: punitworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for a week and found the rooms to very clean and well maintained. Room were not very spacious but just okay. Public transport is a walk away but the surrounding area is not very good. Even though the Hotel is very very good, I will not prefer this for following reasons: - surrounding areas is not very good - very limited options for eating outside the hotel restaurant (unless you want to try local) - comparatively, I found hotels at lower price and in middle of city

Reviews.Title: “nice staying in HK !”
Reviews.Author: lupin83
Reviews.Content: placed in Hong Kong Island, this hotel was a perfect combination between comfort and price ! Hong Kong is a really chaotic city, expecially during the day ... this hotel is situated near the fish market street, the first impression i got when i came there was "oh what a smell!", fearing i couldn't stand it even in the hotel, like the superhot weather ! But fortunatelly the truth wasn't like this: the hall is huge, but the temperature was perfect (air conditioning well dosed), and NO SMELL at all ! rooms are big, bathrooms too (with a very nice shower), beds comfortable, view on the bay is amazing (if you book a room with partial or full view). the hotel also offers you several amenities, like an outdoor swimming-pool, fitness facilities, internet access ...and a really friendly staff ! position is not the very center of the city, but is still not far from parks and tram / metro stations ! if you search for a good hotel not willing to pay too much, go to Island Pacific Hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ed603em
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a group of two adults and two small children (aged 6 and 7) in August 2011. We had two twin rooms which were several rooms apart but there is a telephone in each room which can be used to call other rooms for free (which the kids enjoyed!) so we were not shut away from each other by any means! Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Island Pacific Hotel. The staff were very friendly and always did their best to help. The hotel itself was very clean and both rooms were clean and not too small. There is a fridge in each room where you can put bottles of water the night before to cool so you can take them out with you the next day, as well as a safe to store any valuables you leave behind while you are out. There is an outdoor swimming pool which is fairly compact and watched over by a couple of lifeguards who could do with some lessons from the rest of the staff. They can be slightly rude sometimes (when they are not texting or sleeping!) but overall they were not a huge issue. There is also a gym with some cardio / weights equipment but we did not use this so cannot comment on it. The hotel is located on the western side of Hong Kong island and is 15 minutes' walk from the nearest MTR (underground train / metro) station, Sheung Wan. However there are frequent trams, buses and taxis right outside the door so the location of the hotel was not a problem for us. Public transport in Hong Kong is generally excellent anyway and the trams in particular are very cheap to ride and also a fun way of watching everyday Hong Kongers go about their daily business. Overall, I would certainly go back to this hotel. The staff really do go the extra mile to help you and are an absolute credit to the hotel and to Hong Kong in general. The rooms are clean and well presented and offer some fantastic views of Hong Kong harbour (make sure you request a room with a Harbour view when checking in).

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, keen and friendly - we'' definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: goldmercedes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not expensive but is excellent value. The staff are friendly and efficient. The restaurant staff are particularly good with immediate service. They were all keen to ensure guests are totally happy with their experience. The hotel is easy to get to from the Central Airport train station. It is also quite closse to the tram system. We recommend that you try the tram as you will see the real Hong Kong at a slow pace. The area around the hotel is interesting and while not high class is safe and cheap. A taxi from the hotel to the more up market shopping centres is short and cheap (about 6-8 Australian dollars). The view from our hotel room on the 28th floor was fantastic so we ahve included two pictures with this review. The room was good as was the bed and bathroom. All aspects of our visit were good but the staff efficiency really is uppermost in our minds. The food was a little different from what we are used to but was very good anyway -and quite good value. Try the custard pumpkin dessert - it's great! The pool is very pleasant.We didn't try the gym. Overall our stay was a very nice experience with no negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: ghdoyle
Reviews.Content: Was just going to stay one night. Because of the price I thought it would be cheap and chearful but it was really good and the food was excellent for travellers. It is clsoe to the ferry and HK central plus soho is just a few minutes away. All in all I would recommend it and will go back again for sure. plus good wifi!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful, outdated small rooms, bad service, do not recommend!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaYork_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed as family of 4 in July 2011, had 2 rooms- 'executive' harbour view, was 'upgraded' from standard room which we booked via BA web site. Hotel is very old, rooms furniture looks like NEVER been changed since it was built - LONG time ago!! Rooms was small, smelly! Breakfast is £ 15 per person, including child, so would be £ 60 per day, which I think is overpriced for this kind of hotel!! Swimming pool and area around it was so dirty and outdated as well!!! Do not trust photos on the hotel's web site, as they are nothing like the actual rooms and hotel amenities.The staff were not friendly, when we tried to approach them with some questions, they all looked like they didn't care and were not helpfull at all!!! We did not pay expensive price for this hotel, but felt that it was not good value for money. Interior is so old and this is not the place to stay in modern and vibrant Hong Kong!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: EuropeExplorer18
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay at Island Pacific for 4 nights. Decent room size, comfortable bed, perfect air-cond and strong shower with tub. Location is perfect with hotel shuttle service to nearby metro and convenient public transport just around the corner. As it is located in western side residential and commercial district thus make shopping of daily necessity very convenient too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - interesting location”
Reviews.Author: kylelsim
Reviews.Content: interesting location because its in the middle of the dried goods district of hong kong. the smell isn't that bad and it makes for some interesting finds (sharks fin dried on the sidewalk) standard rooms are very decent with a flat screen television and bathtub in the toilet. size of the rooms are big for hong kong and come with all amenities. dont expect to use their swimming pool though, two very dour looking individuals (i assume are lifeguards) sit guard while you undress and swim in front of them (okay for me, but it made my female companion rather self-conscious) in any case, why are you even swimming when theres a whole city out there to explore!? hotel provides a shuttle bus service so its pretty easy to get to and from central or sheung wan MTR stations. on one occasion, the shuttle bus was stuck in a jam and they had one of their private limousine cars send me to the MTR in lieu of the shuttle bus. excellent service and overall a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to central Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: dreese1
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate for this hotel from the HK Airport Hotel reservation desk (for 900 HKD/nt). It's about a 15 min walk to the subway line at Sheung Wan, but you can get a cab from the hotel to the subway for just 18 HKD. The hotel has a free shuttle bus from Hong Kong Station as well. Rooms were large for central Hong Kong. Clean, quiet with nice views. Beds were a bit firm. Free wifi as well. Staff were very courteous and helpful and spoke good English. If you want to be even closer to central HK, then expect to pay more for a smaller room. Fitness center was small but at least they had one with decent cardio machines. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This was a great stay for a quick sight seeing trip!”
Reviews.Author: labrandt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights on a quick stop in Hong Kong. They staff were VERY helpful and polite. The room was small but more than adequate - it IS Hong Kong after all, and I didn't fly around the world to see the inside of my hotel room! Clean, Comfortable, and most of all, QUITE...we had it all... it was easy to navigate to and from the airport train, to and from the tram. all of it was just super.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but far”
Reviews.Author: 77Eggy77
Reviews.Content: Had stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in June 2011. Pros: good service, clean towels, clean sheet, satelite tv. Cons: location is not near to the MTR.we have to catch the tram (ding ding Che) at night after our sight seeing and it is really tiring (took additional 15-30min to get back to the hotel from hong kong/ central/ sheung wan MTR). We took a airport express to Hong kong MTR and catch a cab @HK35; took the free shuttle provided by the hotel to shun tak centre for the boat ride to Macau. There's a restaurant nearby called 新源兴(wanton shop) that serves good wanton noodle, pork balls(with mince meat fillings) and crispy deep fried fish skin(yes! Fish skin! It's surprisingly nice :) )

Reviews.Title: “Bigger than average size rooms for Hong Kong – definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingHorse
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Island Pacific on a friend’s recommendation who had been here before & were grateful we stayed here than anywhere else. Key points of the hotel: - Room size – bigger than average rooms for Hong Kong which don’t make you feel claustrophobic. - If you get the right room, decent views of the bay. - Peaceful & quiet location away from the hustle- bustle of Central & the crazy crowds of Kowloon. Yet well connected with free shuttle services to Central & HK Express stations. - Multiple tram & bus connections to Central / other places from right outside the hotel - Excellent staff – very cordial & helpful. Helped us find taxis, with directions, stowing luggage We paid about 110SGD/night for our stay here – which is the average rate for any decent family hotel in Hong Kong. The only catch is that the hotel is located in the dried seafood market of Hong Kong which is one of the key centers of shark-fin trade in the world. Expect to see all sorts of dried stuff as you walk around Des Veux Road. However, don’t worry if not your cup of tea – avoid Des Veuw Road & walk along Connaught Road West to the outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: sa1160
Reviews.Content: When we choose this hotel we already know is little out from the city, but overall was very easy for us. Hong Kong's transportation was so good, we go everywhere was very easy. Hong Kong hotels is very expensive and this was a good find. The room was very nice and comfortable specially the bed. We luckily got a high floor with sea view. Night time we can see the amazing lighting and woke up with a beauty sea. After our Macau stay, this hotel was a heaven for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bartje83
Reviews.Content: People who think this hotel is far away really should walk a bit more. We walked from this hotel to Hong Kong Central and back every day. The subway is even closer, about a ten minute walk. Hotel is very nice and good value, during the expensive high season this place only cost a bit more than a crappy room in the Chungking Mansions (at least on the internet booking sites) Rooms are a bit small but well decorated and have amazing views from the floor to ceiling windows. We actually spent a night sitting against the bed with a beer, just looking out the window. Hotel also has a nice pool and small gym. Breakfast seemed overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but the wildlife is a nuisance”
Reviews.Author: 180Opoho
Reviews.Content: Harbour view room ws smallish but had excellent views; very clean; excellent staff - unfailingly helpful and courteous. Free intenet and breakfast as part of our rate. Shuttle to Central every half hour. But .... both my colleague and myself had to be shifted due to the other guests of the biting variety in our rooms. A call to the desk did result in being very efficiently shifted and we do not know of others at our conference who suffered. Maybe we were just unlucky. I would not write the hotel off on this account.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value, Ok Location”
Reviews.Author: Natalie090
Reviews.Content: I will first say that I truly enjoyed our stay at Island Pacific - I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others. However, there are some finer points I would like to note. Our room was very spacious, (even by non-HK standards) however, we had been upgraded from a standard room to an executive room on the sub-penthouse level (28th floor), which is one of the reasons we were satisfied with the value we received for what we paid. We had an excellent view, the room was clean, the layout of the floor was such that you didn't see many (or in our case, any) other guests. I felt the hotel had a good atmosphere, the lobby is impressive, and the doorman/concierge on the lower level was always courteous. This was my second time in Hong Kong so I already knew my way around and the free shuttle to Central (and Airport Express, etc.) was very useful. I might not recommend this location to first-timers, as it is not conveniently situated for wandering around or exploring, but if you are a business traveller or a traveller who knows what sites/areas you want to see, then this is an ideal hotel. On the negative side, I only had one issue. I had some difficulty connecting to the wifi and called the front desk several times to have this corrected. They seemed to tell me every time "ok, we've reset it, try again in 10 minutes." After this didn't work, and since I was on my way out, I went down the front desk. They very convincingly told me, "yes, we've fixed it, when you go back up to your room it will be working." Well, it wasn't. It might be a small issue for some, I felt they could have been more helpful and understanding. After it was finally working, it was reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Service-oriented, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gykk
Reviews.Content: Welcomed by the polite and friendly staffs. I like the smell of the hotel. Although station is a little far, but hotel provide frequent van service to the nearest Sheung Wan station, central as well as Hong Kong station that leads to airport express line with frequent interval. Although island pacific hotel is located at the more residential side of Hong kong, It gives us a different feeling from staying at kowloon. More "simple" life as compared to Kowloon as u can see housewives, butchery and shops selling "hai wei" such as sharks fins, etc. The room is worth the price paying as it is clean, although the carpet is a little old but they provide room slippers, that's not an issue. Pillow alittle soft but they provide additional pillow.3. and complete amenities, toothbrush, shampoo, etc. Don't think this is basic, some hotels in HK don't provide that, the space is relatively big as compared to like Half the size I Have ever stayed it. I got a room with harbour view and room have wifi, ask for the password tho alittle slow better than nothing. They have LAN cable, sufficient power point to charge yr camera,hp. Overall value for money for a hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Tina Turner Would Call This Hotel 'Simply OK'”
Reviews.Author: gagnonsh
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else will tell you the rooms are very small, and it's true. There is a bed and a bathroom and a small desk with a tv mounted on the wall, that's it. What's annoying is the fact that the hotel is very damp. It's likely being so close to the water and their obsession with air conditioning but it's a bit bothersome. The hotel is a bit out of the way but it's not such a big problem. There is no HBO and you need to pay for internet in the business centre but it's only 30 hkd/30 mins. The concierge staff were very helpful though and it is one of the more affordable hotels around so I would say stay there but don't expect to be blown away. If you can afford to stay somewhere nicer, do so.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stanry
Reviews.Content: Nice cosy hotel. Good service and well located at Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Andreals64
Reviews.Content: We booked this via the BA website, as it seemed like a very good-value deal for our 5-night stay. We booked 'side harbour view' rooms, but when we checked in we were allocated two interconnected rooms with views straight out onto the harbour, which our son love as he could sit and count all the ferries! After reading various reviewers complain about the size of the rooms I actually found them perfectly adequate. The bathrooms and bedding were clean, although the carpets our could have done with a clean. The staff we spoke to were very helpful and quickly sorted out our request to remove feather pillows etc. from one of our rooms after we arrived. We loved the location of the hotel, close to 'Dried Seafood Street', as it seemed to have much more character than the flashy shopping areas in the centre of Hong Kong. We found the trams so cheap and fun to use (although not with luggage!). On our departure we were very impressed with the hotel's free shuttle 'bus' service to the Airport Express station, which was actually a hotel car. We didn't eat in the hotel at all, but economised by making do with trips to the nearby 7-Eleven or Circle A convenience shops to get breakfast supplies. Although the hotel's website mentioned free wifi in the lobby only, it turned out we could use the wifi from our room free of charge, which was very convenient. My husband tried the swimming pool once, but it was too cold for our son. Probably not surprising given it was early April!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in hk. 100% coming back!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewSim
Reviews.Content: I have never come across a hotel that goes put of the way when the hotel guest needs help. From the bell boy to the check in staff, all of them never never fail to offer their help or smile when they see u. This have never happen to me before. It is like they r pro in their job yet friendly. Great job to the morning team on 8may 2011. The manager n front office staff did not waste anytime in arranging the transport from our hotel to the hospital when my friend got really sick. I will never this kind of service in any other hotel !! Island pacific will be the first choice hotel when i travel to hk again.

Reviews.Title: “A very Asian "international" hotel. Great for business. Good value.”
Reviews.Author: Akku_Nottingham
Reviews.Content: I chose Island Pacific because it was the cheapest hotel on the internet which was on HK Island near my business meetings and didn't have any seriously bad reviews. I had no great expectations of the place as it was quite cheap for the location. I ended up very impressed by my stay. The thing which makes this hotel stand out are its staff. Every single member of staff there went out of their way to make me feel welcome and to ensure my every need was met. I was even asked at one point if my expectations of the escalator had been met! The standard of staffing is as good as some of the significantly more expensive hotels in HK. I cannot fault any one of them. Standard of English spoken was at least "acceptable" for all staff. Most very good or excellent. The room was an "Executive" which is about "standard" size in a regular British hotel. The harbour view is a wonderful bonus for the money, the city scape view the other way also great. The bed was comfy, the room was quiet and I slept like the dead (I am prone to insomnia). Basic room amenities are provided. Some of the decor is showing its age and there was sign of a recent repair which had been patched over. This didn't bother me. Everything was clean, tidy, comfortable and worked well. Broadband is provided free in the room, but it is wired not WiFi so only laptops etc. with a LAN connector will be able to use it not your phone or iPad. I ate in the hotel a lot. This is because the food was good and very well priced. Also because of the area (more on this later). Breakfast is a buffet of Asian interpreted international standards. The scrambled egg has wasaabi in it. There is boiled pork loin and pan fried ham alongside hash browns. Best breakfast I've had in a hotel in a while. The evening meal is either from the menu (mostly pizza and pasta) or a buffet which again is an eclectic mix of stuff like Duck A la Orange in one pot and some fried squid curry in the next. I don't eat seafood but I did notice they had a lot of local fresh catch of the day dishes on for those who do. This was less than $200 HK for "all you can eat" and the deserts are superb. There are two bars in the hotel (linked by a staircase) and one sells nice sandwiches and so forth. The hotel is located in the Western District and not terribly convenient for the MTR. You can catch a Taxi easily or for the more adventurous there are trams and buses which run the main drag alongside the hotel very regularly. I preferred to walk down to Sheung Wan MTR station and take in the local atmosphere. What you won't find locally are bars or restaurants or anyone who speaks much English! There are cafes but they are very much the traditional Chinese type but very cheap. You can also buy cheap street food, such as fried noodles for just a few HK dollars. There are also a few local bakeries where you can grab something, and the pastries are delicious, but for proper "dining" you need to go further afield. There are some seafood restaurants not too far away but I don't eat it so I can't say if these are good. There are several nice looking eateries in the Western Market building which is a 10 minute walk away offering a range of foods and English signage. I haven't tried these either but they looked good. The area the hotel is in is in the dried fish quarter and there is certainly a lot of "local colour" walking around the stalls and shops. The area is busy and felt very safe even late at night. if you "like" the Hotel on Facebook you get either a free breakfast or a 10% discount on your bill (excluding the room rate) I have business in Hong Kong and when I am next there on my own on business I will very likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointment”
Reviews.Author: luca0060
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is positioned in front of the harbour in Hong Kong island; beautiful view, but a little far away from the Central Station. The service at the lobby desk was good, the people friendly but not the same at the restaurant during lunch a la carte: long wait, high price The room was very small: I had problem even to put somewhere and open the only small bag and the little handbaggage I had with me! The bathroom was small too and not very clean. The total cost was definitively too high compared with the service, the location, the hotel appearence, the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and view from the hotel but rooms could be bit larger!”
Reviews.Author: Anupama R
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the hotel. used the courtesy bus service to the central..very punctual!! Had breakfast at the hotel...wide variety but same everyday( Tuesday to Saturday...no menu change!!)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for central HK and value for money”
Reviews.Author: AlanB12
Reviews.Content: If you are flying in to Hong Kong for a couple of days visit and you aren't too fussed at staying at 5 star hotel (maybe you are actually paying the bill yourself) then what you are looking for is somewhere comfortable to sleep and convenient to your client's office that isn't going to take you forever to reach. The Island Pacific Hotel meets these criteria. At around US$100 a night it compares favorably with its more upmarket competitors. The rooms are small, but adequate. There is wi-fi and the breakfast, although a little expensive at HK$150, is varied and caters for all tastes. Their description of a "sea view" can be a little confusing. You might have to stretch a little to see around the construction of another tower block unless you are in rooms 1 to 6 on the floor so be specific in your booking if you want a nice view and dont trust the description on the web site. Transit to Central is easy either via a taxi at around HK$24 or on the tram at HK$2 that passes along the street within a few meters of the hotel entrance. The trains are just a short tram ride away and once on the train you can get almost anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: JohnP72
Reviews.Content: I booked through BA holidays website and got a really good rate. Some of the other reviewers have mentioned that the hotel is not really centrally located. However, for me this was not a problem as it was only a 10 minute walk to the nearest MTR station which is Sheung Wan which is only a single stop from Central station. In addition the hotel runs a free shuttle bus if you don't fancy the walk, and also this runs to the airport express too. Although you also catch a tram or the cab from the airport express to the hotel was only $40 HKG. Also worth noting is that from the hotel en route to the MTR station is the Shun Tak shopping centre where you can catch the catamaran (Cotai jet) to Macau which only takes 1 hour which was really handy for a day out to Macau (remember your passport though)! In terms of the room it was fairly new and modern although a little small but generally this is the case in HKG. I booked room only, but on a couple of mornings I had breakfast which was quite nice with a reasonable selection although a little pricey at $152 HKG. In terms of the facilities there is a small pool and a gym with basic cardio machines (very little else) but was fine for my stay. The staff seemed friendly and helpful enough although I really didn't need their assistance during my stay. Overall I was very satisfied with the hotel and for the rate I paid I think this represented good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Pranay N
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with excellent staff. good location and good rooms. very helpful concierge and courteous staff. easy check in and check out . regular shuttle bus makes the stay very comfortable and easy.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: krunal_2
Reviews.Content: good location, few steps and u will access to tram.. and u will be in the heart of the city in 15 mins.. clean hotel and room.. nice rooms but bit small .. but u cant complains in hong kong for that. speacially bathrooms are clean and nice.. definitely i can stay again in this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sandeep2011
Reviews.Content: well we were first timers to this hotel great hotel firstly in hongkong side i recommended that alwaty stay at the hongkong side much safer and better. the hotel has everything from minibar to lcd screen and the bathroom amenties are great most hongkong rooms are small compared to our countries excluding japan but well planned rooms and good view of the harbour we had taken a non breakfast room and worked quite cheap for a double room they do give you some lovely offer for breakfast packages once you arrive at the hotel. only disadvantage no free watter in rooms and expensive to purchase water in hotel but they have one 7/11 next to the hotel open 24 hrs next to hotel lots of restaurant serving local food and main hongkong shopping only abt 7/12 mins by taxi the ferry abt 5/6 mins basically close to central Station which is the Major station to go to the airport or any staion as all trains touch central station. we loved the place clean and couteous staff specially they all speak english.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value”
Reviews.Author: Benji_au
Reviews.Content: The hotel service is very good. The staff are numerous and are more attentive than at most Hong Kong hotels. Although the hotel and the rooms are a bit old, it is comfortable, quiet and has a decent restaurant. The location is a bit sleepy but they offer a shuttle service into town. As a business traveller, I find this hotel is usually well priced and offers great value for Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Perfect Service, Not That Spacial Room”
Reviews.Author: Charron
Reviews.Content: he location of the hotel is convenient. It is in Western District. There are bus stops and tram stop at the front door. The staff there are very helpful, professional and efficient! The hotel provides free shuttle buses between the city centre and the hotel. There is an outdoor swimming pool as well. However, it is hardly to swim coz our trip was in winter. The room was not that spacial as we expected. I have stayed in a 3-Star hotel in Wanchai before; the room of that hotel is much bigger. While Island Pacific is a 4-Star hotel, the layout of the room was not designed that reasonably. And there are no small tables in the room. We had to put our luggage bags on the ground. The basin is a little high. When I washed my face, I had to stand up a little bit. The bathtub is narrow. When you stand inside and face the shower, it is easily to be touched by the shower curtain.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: crymsonite
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Island Pacific Hotel in Feb 2011. Very nice hotel. The staff are polite and speak fairly good english. The location was great as well. Only about 10 min walk to the nearest MTR - Sheung Wan and a short stroll to the Macau Ferry terminal .Its also not very far away from the Central pier 4 where u can take the ferry to Lamma Island either to So kwu wan or Yung shue wan. Both places in my opinion are worth the visit but do note that to walk from so kwu wan to yung shue wan it takes about 1hr 30 min. But if u are the adventurous type and dun mind the exercise its really great .The view is nice . I myself was pleasantly surprise at how nice and beautiful the place was. When in So Kwu Wan do go to Rainbow seafood restaurant. The food is great , the service is excellent and they even give u a complementary ferry ticket back to hk island on their own ferry! yes! rainbow customers will be given a vip sticker and will take Rainbow's ferry from the pier only for Rainbow customers. How cool is tat :) The only thing i was not too happy about Island Pacific Hotel was that the windows for our deluxe room was dirty. So though we had the full harbour view we could not enjoyed it fully . Otherwise over all the hotel is great . Very please :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: LEHH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, and it was a great hotel to stay in. The staff was wonderful, smiling, and helpful with every request. The room was great, clean and big and had a nice view. The location was a little far from public transportation, but it wasn't a problem because they have a free shuttle to central which runs several times a day. The buffet meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner) were a little bit pricey, but more than adequate. Also, there are several shops and cheap noodle restaurants in the neighborhood within easy walking distance. We would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssexTraveller169
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June 2010 for just two nights. It wasn't central to anything really, so had to be trams everywhere and tubes but still only about 5 min tram ride. Hotel gym was not great, cross trainer didn't work properly, no other cardio items. Swimming pool was very small, in a small yard overlooked by other buildings. Looked cold too! first hotel room was very damp smelling, i complained they upgraded me, still the same. I was told it's because the windows don't open,due to height so they leave the air con on all the time! Business centre was okay, did what it says on the tin but everyone can read your computer so not discreet if you need to be when reading emails etc Reception and bar area, lovely, had a pianist who was good. Didn't eat here though. I'd suggest to go elsewhere if you're planning on doing more than sleeping here. if you're just sleeping as i did, it's expensive for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Bangkok
Reviews.Content: My main reason for booking this hotel was the price, as I found an excellent rate on the British Airways Holidays website. Having been to Hong Kong many times I was not expecting too much, however was very pleasantly surprised. The hotel staff were very helpful and we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a corner room with 2 walls of floor to ceiling windows offering fantastic views over the harbour. The room was a good size (by Hong Kong standards), very clean and well equipped. Central is only a 20 minute walk away - half of which is on the elevated escalators, the tram is just a few minutes walk away and the hotel also offers a regular shuttle bus free of charge. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value - but not more”
Reviews.Author: Lars1975
Reviews.Content: We´ve been there for two nights because of the price and expected what we got: An average Hotel in a location a bit out of the central. But the tram starts right in font of the hotel and the taxi-ride to central and ferry is just about 30-40 HK$. The area is "real" Chinatown: It´s loud, stinks and is dirty. The houses are old and run down (as the hotel looks from the outside). But from the inside the hotel is fine, looks like a former 4-Star-Hotel, that is also a bit run down. We had the (part-)view of the harbour, what was really nice in the morning, because you sometimes don´t see anything between the skyscrapers.

Reviews.Title: “Unique location-Hong Kong daily life on your doorstep!”
Reviews.Author: Electricean
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights as a base for exploring HK and surrounds.....suited my needs perfectly. Staff friendly and very attentive, had a 'side view' of the busy harbour in a clean comfortable room. If you want to walk to Central then about 20mins if your a reg walker, but MTR about 10-15mins away (Sheung Wan), but for atmospheric trip into Central, hop on the tram ( stop 1min from Hotel, 2 HK$ about 20pence) soak up the noises and smells on a very busy and fascinating trip. Near main ferry terminal also, Macau, mainland China Etc. I ate out most of the time but used room service on two occassions, food very good and delivered very quickly, but typically a tad expensive....but arent all hotels!!! All in all, would recommend to someone and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and a Great View”
Reviews.Author: ibonzer
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel was easy. I flew into Hong Kong airport and took the efficient airport express train to Hong Kong Station (the end of the route) which takes about 20-30 minutes. I then got a taxi to the hotel which cost a very reasonable £3 or so. Despite the fact Hong Kong can be expensive, taxis seem fairly cheap. If I'd known my way around, I could probably have just about wheeled my bag to the hotel. Several people have commented on the lack of proximity to an MTR station, however it's not a huge distance. It's 0.6 miles to the nearest underground station and 1 mile to Hong Kong station where the airport express drops off . If you walk out the hotel front door and look right on Connaught Road you can see the Shun Tak Centre building which is roughly where the nearest underground station is located. On most days I took a pleasant morning walk along the harbour front to the underground. The room was of modest size but comparable to what I would expect to receive in the UK for a mid-range hotel. Americans may find it small by the standards of typical US hotel rooms. Slight niggles were being unexpectedly asked for a $HKD500 (about £41) deposit on arrival. Apparently this was with respect guaranteeing bar and mini-bar charges that may be accrued. I don't know if this kind of deposit is usual in Hong Kong. There were however no issues with this. I proffered my credit card, I didn't use any hotel services and no charges were made to my card. It would have been nice to include free wi-fi with the room, however few hoteliers seem to offer this. I'm hoping one day someone will buck the trend. If you're after free wi-fi, I found it in statue square. The room wasn't perfectly quiet, with the hotel being near a major road intersection. There is a constant distant rumble of traffic at most hours. The view from the hotel window across the harbour was fabulous and is probably this hotel's greatest asset (see attached photo). Spent almost an hour watching the boats go by at night. The floor to ceiling window is great, the sort of thing you'd find in a trendy city apartment. The hotel staff were very good and there were lots of people instantly available. I didn't have to wait long for anything and everything was dealt with efficiently. What really tells you about the quality of customer service is what happens when things go wrong. When I checked out, I thought I'd use the free shuttle bus service to the airport express. However after a short wait, it transpired the bus wasn't available. The concierge was extremely concerned about getting me to my flight on time, so offered to find and pay for a taxi and sent someone out to flag one down for me. After about ten minutes, they were unable to find a taxi and so the concierge fetched a Mercedes car and a chauffeur to take me to the station instead. Excellent service, I don't think other hotels would have gone to so much trouble. If you are using the airport express, you can check your bags in with most airlines at Hong Kong station up to 24 hours before the flight. If you have a flight later in the day, I'd highly recommend doing this, it's a great (free) service and gets rid of your luggage so you can go out and do something. Something else I would recommend is getting an Octopus card for the MTR. This is identical to an Oyster card in London. There is a special one for tourists which provides 2 airport express journeys and 3 days unlimited underground travel. You can pick this up at the airport in arrivals. At the time of writing this was $HKD300 (about £25).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, interesting location”
Reviews.Author: SignalLady
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, friendly and attentive staff, clean and fair sized room. Good choice of breakfast although a little expensive. Food in restaurant was ok, but service lacking a little. A little way out from central Hong Kong but taxi's are cheap enough and only a half hour walk if you have the time. Its certainly not a tourist location, mostly locals in the streets, the main one being full of shops with interesting looking dried seafood products, so the aroma certainly gets you when you step out! Definitely a good choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value with a longer stroll to MTR Station”
Reviews.Author: JY_Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several days while visiting in Hong Kong with my sister. All in all, a great value considering how expensive hotels are on the Hong Kong Island side. My only complaint was that we asked for a non smoking room but somehow ended up on a smoking floor with a non smoking room so the hallway didn't smell as nice. I did not eat at the hotel and had to walk quite a ways to find food as the restaurants and cafes were sparse in this district. Up the street, there is a Watsons, Mannings as well as a 7 Eleven for drugstore and convenience stores needs (and to stock up bottled water). The staff at the front are very helpful and well versed in English. Even the staff at the taxi stand were waving goodbye with a smile as we departed in a cab. It is approximately a 10 minute walk to Sheung Wan MTR metro station along Des Voeux Road. If you don't feel like walking, the hotel is approximately $5USD cab ride from the MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: BeachGirl713
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in Hong Kong earlier this month just to check out the club scene in the Lan Kwai Fong area (10 to 15 minutes away via cab). We did not want to spend much on accommodation since we only needed a place to sleep in for about 5 hours. We were fortunate enough to find a good online deal for Island Pacific Hotel. After reading several pleasant reviews, we booked the cheapest room in the house. Upon check in, however, we found out they upgraded us to an executive room for free. It was a nice treat. The room was small, but it was clean. Not bad at all. Nothing fancy about this hotel, but definitely value for money. Employees (even the manager/supervisor) were very friendly. I'd recommend Island Pacific to anyone who appreciates old Hong Kong charm.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value at a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: arkleseizure
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay at the Island Pacific hotel over Thanksgiving. Found an incredible rate online...so low, in fact, that I was a bit concerned whether the hotel would actually be any good. That concern was very misplaced; the hotel excelled in every regard. The standard room was about the size I expected, meaning not terribly large. But I'm used to this (traveling in Japan) and didn't spend much time in the room so I didn't really care. The room was very clean, with a large bathroom stocked with amenities. Our room only had a partial view to the harbor, but it was still an excellent sight. Wired internet (though not free) was reasonably priced (got the 7 day subscription) and speedy. Nice Sony LCD in room with a good variety of international channels (including NHK World, my favorite). I could see the beds being a little stiff for some people, but I was able to get a great night's sleep every night (probably due to being so worn out!). The location is not too near most of the "touristy" areas, but you can hop on the tram right behind the hotel and be at the IFC / Star Ferry terminal / subway station within minutes for a mere $2 HKD. Actually very convenient, and only a $25 HKD or so cab ride from the IFC. The local area is a dry seafood market, which provides quite a few interesting sights, and only the occasional smell. All in all, the location was a lot better than I thought it would be before arriving in HK. I don't know what the normal prices are for this hotel, but I can't really imagine there being a better value in HK for the rate I paid. I'd definitely aim to stay here if I come back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: menonkuwait
Reviews.Content: Although there are no MTR stations closeby, there's a tram and bus station which serves the purpose. Cabs are easily available. The hotel also has a shuttle to which goes to central. The hotel staff were extremely helpful. The rooms were quite clean and maintained very well. The gym was small with barely 4 to 5 equipments. The pool looked big (although I didn't go into the pool). There's free internet in the lobby, but you have to pay for it, if you want it in the room. Also, there's no breakfast with the room.

Reviews.Title: “For the money - as good as you can get in HK”
Reviews.Author: icedaddyuk
Reviews.Content: Book more than ten days in advance then you can get a really good rate for this hotel, less than £100 a night which is very cheap for HK. If you're looking for a decent hotel for a decent price then the Island Pacific is fine for your needs. OK, it's a little further out from Central than would be ideal but the tram runs to within 200 metres of the hotel for only HK$2 (less than 20p). Rooms and bathrooms are smallish but clean, powerful shower and flat screen TV showing English and Asian channels. I had a side on harbour view room but wasn't really towards the action of Kowloon. The gym is small (2 running machines, 1 bike and 1 cross trainer) and the pool is approx 10m but enough for a light morning session. As in other reviews the breakfast is expensive but is very extensive. Cafes in HK generally don't open until 10ish so it's probably worth taking. I paid HK$300 (approx £25) for a weeks worth of internet access which is not too bad as the speed is very fast, more than enough to Skype home with video. Overall, I'd say, decent, not luxury, but more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: Laurian16
Reviews.Content: Island Pacific is the best find ever! I travel to Hong Kong often on business and pleasure and cannot believe the great rates, great location and amazing views. the staff were fantastic - 5 star service! Attentive, helpful and nothing was a problem Will definitely be back, and have referred several friends already! Im scared to recommend as I dont really want everyone to find it as the prices might go up! :)

Reviews.Title: “A comfort place to stay and easy to reach by public transport after tired exploring HK”
Reviews.Author: J2NN
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel for the room, the view from the room and the service. I booked it through Internet so the price was half cheaper compare if I booked it directly; I know this because of when I got there, my cousin suddenly wanted to stay with us and we had to add one more room. However, the receptionist gave us special rates for additional one room, which is same price with mine. When i prepared for my trip, i asked several times to the hotel about the direction and what transport to use, and they explained it clearly. I also like the neighborhood; it has so many small HK restaurants and the location of the hotel is in the middle of dried food shops. I like the tram that serves this area, and it only cost 2HKD for a trip. You can take the tram from the Sheung Wan MTR and drop off in front of the hotel. For management of this hotel, i would like to give input for their improvement: please add more schedules of shuttle bus. Because its really help us a lot, especially when we are in the hurry.

Reviews.Title: “exellent”
Reviews.Author: Woody976
Reviews.Content: Great views. was clean and staff were very helpful. Very relaxing. Just a short walk to a small park in the morning to watch the sun rise over a busy harbour. Mind you can see most of it from your bedroon aswell The lads in charge of the front doors were exellent. They were almost insulted if you got to one of the doors before they noticed you and you opened it instead of them. One tip. The breakfast looks a bit pricey at £9.00 with 1 bacon 1 egg etc in the menu but its a huge buffet really and you can really fill up, its almost all you can eat. Didn't need lunch after that so i think it was fair value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Good view”
Reviews.Author: ExiledinAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the I.P. for 2 nights. Had a harbour view room on the 17th floor, fantastic view it is too. This is a world class view to die for. Lying in bed early morning watching the river traffic go by. The room was clean, tidy and comfortable. AC kept the room nice and cool. The hotel access is easy, use the tram to get in and out of central HK. At night time when returning to the hotel you can get a taxi back from central (24 HKD) about £2, it will not burst your wallet at that price. Would I recommend this hotel to friends visiting HK ? yes I would and I will use it again if I visit HK at any time.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is OK”
Reviews.Author: xoxo_dt
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to HK every 6wks for the past 6 months. Upon each trip I try to stay at a different hotel. This hotel though it has nice views of the harbour (if you are lucky enough to get a room that has one), its not an EASY hotel to access if you are new to HK. The hotel room was of typical size, and what i did like was that they checked me in early after an overnight flight from Sydney. The room service food was good, but the internet was a little expensive. Towels though were old and had holes in the them. Lighting in the room - well let me say there wasn't enough. Access wise - you can take the free shuttle bus to and from Central (IFC mall). I preffered to take the trams ($2HKD). If you want a decent budget hotel - this is it, if you don't mind taking a tram to and from the MTR

Reviews.Title: “The most uncomfortable beds and excellent view/sound of roads”
Reviews.Author: sueholidaylondon
Reviews.Content: Have just spent one night in deluxe room. If this is deluxe, heaven help everyone else. The bed is incredibly uncomfortable, the view of the harbour overlooks a spaghetti junction of roads which are incredibly loud even on the 19th floor. Have booked 3 nights but looking at other options as this is such a bad choice. Also located away from any transport options although tram does go past. Would not recommend this at all. Staff are very helpful but not a lot they can do about rooms. Have yet to see another resident smile. Extremely bad value

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: yolanderHK
Reviews.Content: I used to work in HK and I know HK pretty well. I stayed in Island Pacific for a 5 day visit to HK. I chose the hotel for its price and because the 2 hotels I wanted to stay at in Causewaybay were all booked up. This hotel may not be in a the best possible location (ie. above MTR station etc) but there were always taxi's available when I reached the lobby. It is a less than 5 min taxi ride to IFC in Central. If it was peak hour traffic, I would opt to take the tram (comes every one minute) which is only a short walk from the hotel, to Sheung Wan or Central MTR station. We received a free upgrade to a deluxe room with awesome view of the HK harbour. The staff took a little bit long to bring our luggages up from the lobby. Otherwise, the room was clean, spacious enough for 2 people and the decor was classy. Hotel staff were always courteous. One warning though, the hotel is close to the "dried seafood street" in Sheung wan, and you may be greeted with a strange smell in the lobby if you are not use to it. Rest assured though that the smell does not travel to the rooms. If you are looking for a hotel in a convenient location, you will be paying alot more than what is on offer for here. This hotel is convenient in its own way and a good alternative to understanding local culture.

Reviews.Title: “This is a BAD option, don't know what happens with other reviewers, Far Away and Not easy Accessible”
Reviews.Author: The_Last_Inca
Reviews.Content: Well, i'm a real reviewer as you can see from my other reviews. I was hosted in this hotel just because my business trip included it with a special rate. This hotel is very bad located, indeed is in a corner of Hong Kong, far from the metro, when you go to the reception they tell you "you have to walk 15 minutes to find the metro station". The room has decent size, but what about the facilities ! the gym is almost a sad joke, is tiny tiny tiny, just with 3 machines and some weights, the swimming pool other sad history really tiny, there where two guys to help you with the towels but with them near the pool was like too many persons, almost a crowd. The only positive about the hotel is the access to the airport but for the casual traveler that knows how to take the bus, just take the A10 line and it practically left you 20 meters from the hotel (dont forget coins or your *octupus card).
