Take Note: Dont be mistaken by the 15 minutes walk to the next metro station! take the cute Tramway that accepts the octupus card, just HKD 2 per way and it has one stop some meters from the hotel, forget about the metro and have fun. + What i like. - If you have to stay in this hotel for any strange reason the only positive thing is that you arrive to it very easy from the airport taking the bus A10 on the airport exit. (like 48 HK$ each way, discount if you use your octupus card for the go and return the same day, i explain about octupus later) -The personal try to be polite and courteous. -If you want to take a new girlfriend you made in hong kong it will be easy here, almost normal in Hong Kong. - If you need to eat at a reasonable price then you can walk like 5 blocks from de voeux road against city center and find a japanese fast food very known in China. (around 30-36 HK$ per dish) + What i dislike - The awful location, very far from the city center, from the action, surrounded by depots and small shops, you can get much better for the same or lower price in HKG. - There is NOT Free wifi in the rooms, it cost you PER HOUR and is not cheap, the only way is to go to the lobby where there are only some chairs so if you need to enter urgently then is very possible you wont find space. - The happy ladies that start to appear in the lobby after 1:00 am + The Tips: - BUY the octupus card once you arrive to hong kong airport, this is THE WAY to know hong kong, it is accepted by the metro, buses and the very cute tramway !!!, also it saves you from having to have the exact change or buy tickets every time. - Dont be like a new tourist and take the airport express once you arrive, just take the bus A10, that stops in several hotels, and as this hotel is very far from the center is one of the first stops, the bus left you almost 20 meters from the door. - To get the hotel dont take the taxi, less the metro, take the cute tramway !!!, and use your charged octupus card :D ! the stop is some meters from the hotel's door - By the way, if you use the tramway dont take the one that says final stop western market ! it will let you far from the hotel, you must take the one that has the final stop at Kennedy Town, which runs more and left you near the hotel. Cheers, i uploaded some pics. Greetings from Lima, PERU !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: agoen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the western market, no access to MRT, the best way to get here is by taxi or tram which is around the corner. The staff is incredibly friendly, when I was checking in the room was not ready and I was escorted for a quick drink and comp use of the Internet at the Executive lounge. The concierge were friendly to help me getting taxi to where I need to be for the week I was there. The room was ok and small, complete with iPod station, TV, on demand film, bathtub, etc. The room view I got was not bad - sea view. All and all pretty decent room. By the way there are regulars comp shuttle bus to Hong Kong station which is free and easy if you want to get to the airport, check with the concierge for time.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ajnBerliner
Reviews.Content: Island Pacific is a good hotel for HK, but average compared to everything we had on our trip in Cambodia and Vietnam. The location is OK and I liked the atmosphere of the streets nearby. It gives you an insight of the real Hong Kong. Its close to everything if the traffic is normal. If it's not (and it wasnt several times), it could take up to half an hour to reach the Central Station. Rooms are small and the harbour view was nothing special. Again, I compare the hotel with wonderful accomodation we had in Vietnam and Cambodia for much lower price. I hadn't been to any other hotels in HK and I heard that the standard in this price rang in the city is quite low. We didnt have breakfast (and there aren't much places to get one nearby) and internet is not for free in the loby. On the other hand the staff was extremely helpful and friendly and they gave us a late check out (18.00) at no extra costs. It's a good hotel all in all, but dont expect too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: kayyzee
Reviews.Content: We booked our Executive Floor rooms in advance, so received a good rate. The rooms are a good size, with a full view of the harbour. Could do with a little updating, but other than that, they are very comfortable. Beds were hard, but the hotel has a 'pillow selection menu', which solved the sleep discomfort immediately. The area is very quiet at night too. Our room rate included a full buffet breakfast, which was great. We also had the buffet dinner on several evenings. It was always packed with locals, which is a good sign. Service was very efficient and friendly - our thanks to Maggie. Location is perfect. A 20 minute walk into Central, or the tram is virtually right at the door. The MTR is only a 10 minute walk. Will definitely recommend this hotel to friends who want a good location on a budget. We will be returning again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: echidnatrip
Reviews.Content: Very good rates for HK. Clean room with a lot of amenities except no free wifi. Very helpful staff. The location is fine - tram is the cheapest form of transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value”
Reviews.Author: wineaficionado
Reviews.Content: My review resonates well with the others, but I'll expand on my experience. I stayed 13 nights in a standard room, checked in at 9am an was immediately taken to my freshly prepared room well before check-in time. The room was on the 26th floor facing northwest and I had a decent view of the busy harbour. The room was understandably but had all the comforts - a desk to work, multiple toiletries, a kettle, and a good sized closet. The safe needed it's batteries replaced, but a small call to the front desk later and the problem was taken care of right away. The neighbourhood (Sheung Wan/Western Market) is...well... quiet. Not much going on. But the outdoors are quiet and good for sleeping. The hotel is 1 km away from the western terminus of the island line MTR and this has been a complaint for some reviewers. Fortunately, the hotel offers a free shuttle transfer to Hong Kong station / IFC mall practically every 30 min. If you don't catch them on time, take the inexpensive tram ($2 HK). The line runs right past the hotel and takes you the width of the island. The internet fees are a bit of a drag ($30 HK for an hour, $98/day). But visit any PCCW store for example, and you can purchase internet cards for cheap. The trouble is, the hotel's wifi connection with these outside networks is weak - so coffee shops will have to do instead. If you want to use free internet terminals for short durations, purchase a snack at a Pacific Coffee location (the closest to the hotel is at Des Voeux and Rumsey streets). I did not try the pool or restaurant - There's simply so much else to do and see in HK. The bar is a nice place to sit and have a drink (prices are the same as for other bars ~55 for a pint) before you head out for the night. If you do stay out late and can't take the MTR back, to give you a sense of cab fares: ~$100 HKD from Tsim Sha Tsui and ~$65 from Causeway bay (the price of just one of the many drinks I'm sure you enjoyed). Friendly staff, great price for what you get. Enjoy the city and the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to the centre, but good transport links”
Reviews.Author: Naniwa
Reviews.Content: It took about 45 minutes by road to get there from the airport, but public transport is do-able. It sits at the western end of Hong Kong island, quite far from the hustle and bustle of Central and Kowloon over the harbour. No tube was close by, but the neighbourhood felt safe enough to walk about and there was the tram line running from the end of the street. The hotel itself was fine. Rooms were a little on the pokey side, but they were clean and modern and quite quiet. Staff were friendly and provided maps and gave suggestions about where to go and when. Cannot recall there being much by way of food. There was a breakfast buffet, which was good but not fantastic. We didn't take any evening meals there (not sure if that was even an option) because there is such a vast selection of eateries in more central locations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value”
Reviews.Author: Strawbberry
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 days. The room was a little small but enough for us. It's very clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location was good, we walked to MTR station in ten minutes. Overall, the hotel was good and nice one at the value in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for its location and price”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: The Island Pacific is located in West HK Island. It's a bit off the beaten path (about HK27 taxi ride from Central stn). Our package included free transportation from the airport to the hotel although (usually there's a surcharge), we weren't aware of it til after we had arrived but they did give us free transport to the airport upon our departure. The room is tiny (though typical for HK standards) but decently functional. We stayed two nights and it was fine - longer stays might be a littled cramped. Beds were hard as usual - seems to be that way throughout most of SE Asia as well. We had a good view of the water (and highway). There is a pool and two small work out rooms - more cardio than anything and I believe the gym is 24hrs (not the pool). There was complimentary breakfast in our package and I thought it was pretty good. Internet was pricey (~HK120/day) and it wasn't free in the lobby or dining areas. Taxi's are easy to flag down and there is a tram/streetcar a block away to take you to the subway stations if you need it (very cheap, <HK6, I think). While you're a bit westward, we did walk from the main bar district (Lan Kwai Fong) to our hotel (probably 20+ mins). The price (~C$100/night) seemed reasonable given the location and the amenities. I've stayed in Kowloon (near Jordan stn) and Causway Bay on previous visits and this hotel ranks on the same level with the lower price balancing out the location (remember, taxis are cheap in HK so not a big deal, in my opinion). Overall, good value considering where you're located. I would recommend this hotel but there are plenty of hotels to choose from in HK so I wouldn't suggest this to be a place you had to absolutely stay at but a good choice nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Dallas2Raleigh
Reviews.Content: The Island Pacific Hotel is just outside the hussle and hassle of Central, but still close enough to be a few minutes away from the action. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean and the staff are both helpful and knowledgeable. They were very willing to help me book a spa day at a local salon. I spent 14 nights there in an executive room which was a generous size and had a huge bathroom by Hong Kong standards and the view was fantastic looking over Victoria Harbour and the Tsing Ma bridge. Both tram stops and bus stops are approx 50m away and I never had to wait any more than 2 minutes for a bus. Taxis were plentiful and the concierge team never had a problem hailing a taxi for me. In the vacinity there was a Vanguard convience store, Japan Home Centre, Watsons and a Wellcome supermarket at the top of the hill. The hotel's swimming pool is small but clean and well maintained, likewise the gym facilities. The hotel restaurant was buffet only and a bit overpriced but room service was very reasonable. There is a lack of restaurants in the direct area, but in exploring I did pass a McDonalds 1 block away. I didn't use the internet facilities at the hotel, they were expensive and there's free use of terminals in some of the coffee shop chains like Pacific Coffee. If you are out all day and are using the hotel as a place to sleep I can't think of anywhere better in Hong Kong island. I would definitely stay here again, and would even put the Island Pacific as my number one choice, especially with some of their advance booking discount rates of up to 30% off.

Reviews.Title: “Seemed expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: nickw01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the greatest location, about Hong Kong $20 to get to the IFC where more of the sites are, nor do you get much of a room for your money. Our room with two beds was extremely small, the farthest we could separate our beds was about 2 feet. In addition, we paid (hong kong $300 for a week) for wireless internet during our stay but we could not pick up the signal on either my computer or my friend's ipad unless we were right beside the door to the room, which was just bizarre. There was no free wireless access, even in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here one can experience real HK, a little away from main city hotel galore”
Reviews.Author: RLeo
Reviews.Content: Room were cosy, a little small but comfortable for 2 persons stay. I think our room was delux room with part view of the harbour, full glass window added to the beauty of the view. Adjacent room had better view obviously for a slight higher price. Sheung wan MTR is at 15 minute walk from this hotel and it was wonderful to walk through the lanes and stopping by some real local food delights on the way for bfast and lunch etc. Lots of local shops selling dried fish and a few pawn shops. By a cab the hotel is around 10 mins from the main city. The pictures on the website are a little deceiving. The hotel can be described as great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: elite_007
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is strategic. We booked the hotel extra early and got a great discount. But they put us in a smoking floor but good thing the rooms don't smell. The rooms are clean. There are food stands across the street and they sell good food and they're cheap too. There's a Seven Eleven and a Watson store nearby. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. Not really wheel chair friendly because of the small space. If you wanna take the MTR, you have to take a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. You can ask the staff for directions. There are a lot of taxi cabs passing by so you won't have a problem getting a ride.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: greenlanegirl
Reviews.Content: The Island Pacific is a clean, well run hotel. There was a large breakfast buffet and the staff were friendly and helpful. At the back of the hotel you can jump on a tram that will take you to the nearest metro station in less than 15 minutes. It's worth paying the extra for a room at the front of the hotel because you will get a good view of the Kowloon and the water. The Island Pacific "does the job".

Reviews.Title: “Does the Job”
Reviews.Author: James_attree
Reviews.Content: A fairly nice hotel but only stayed one night. Chose it because it is close to the docks to get a ship to Macau. Everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. The actual area doesnt offer much other than Hong Kong ambiance but from high up in my room the view was very nice. Over all a good hotel which if you intend to get a boat in the morning this is the place to stay otherwise get something in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with nice service, but it came with a price”
Reviews.Author: DBTT
Reviews.Content: I have to say I enjoyed my stay at Island Pacific. It is located in Sheung Wan, which is easily accessible by public transport from Central so it is easy to go out or dine well and return to the hotel without extra hassle. The room I stayed in was adequately sized and fairly well furnished. A small detail was a big stain on the carpet, but other than that, the rooms were cozy and spacious enough for two people and the view was fairly nice as well. I especially enjoyed the large windows, which lighted up the room nicely in the mornings. The service that was provided was very friendly and sometimes even felt a bit excessive, but I guess that is a nice thing. I tried also the buffet dinner at the hotel as I got one person for free. The price normally is around 280HKD+10% SF. The food is mostly delicious but it's lacking variety. I was actually a bit disappointed at first but I found out the reason for the lack of food as the buffet is also all you can drink. So overall I guess it's an ok deal as if you have a few glasses of wine and a beer in central, you already end up paying some 200HKD. If you prefer not to drink alcohol, then I would say the buffet is delicious but definitely lacking variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Niels9001
Reviews.Content: I must see I really enjoed our stay t the Island Pacific Hotel. We stayed there 3 nights in 2 twin bed rooms on the 11th floor. It started off great with checking in 2 hours before the allowed check in time. The rooms are a bit small, but very modern and clean. But I must say that everything worked out just great. The hotel personel are very friendly and will help you with everything you need like finding a taxi or giving you tips. The hotel is located in an old original Hong Kong neighbourhood with a lot of little shops and 24 hour supermarkets (7-11). Its a 10 min walk to the nearest MTR station, and just walking down the street. But you might consider taking a cab because it can be very hot. Island Pacific is great if you looking for a modern, professional and nice hotel. The online downside Is that theres no free wifi; but hey.. There's enough to see!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel not good location”
Reviews.Author: vialactea
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean room. Staff friendly and helpfull. Located far from bus station or MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: chabuqueque
Reviews.Content: The harbour view room is so great! Shuttle bus is convenient going to IFC mall, and getting to MTR from there is hassle free. Love the location cos its not too crowded. Overall a low budget hotel that impressed me with their service. I got no complains.

Reviews.Title: “Bowled over by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joglee
Reviews.Content: Usually stay in the 4 or 5 star mainstream hotels around the world but this time wanted a more local neighbourhood away from the downtown core. I was blown away by this hotel - it delivered what it promised in terms of the room which was perfect for the three days I stayed there. The staff are amazing - as good as Shangri-La and Four Seasons. This is a serious gem and I will most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel's customer care is second to none.”
Reviews.Author: teecup
Reviews.Content: Island Pacific Hotel is a gem. I can’t recommend the hotel enough for its excellent customer care, service and facilities. SERVICE. The hotel prides itself of hygiene, generosity and courteous service. Apart from the easy check-in and check-out system, the helpful bellboys and the free shuttle bus transfers to select places, the hotel is truly a league of its own. The cleaning staff made sure that our beds were made and our towels changed every day. They also restocked our daily supply of personal care provisions (toothbrush, toothpaste, shampoo, conditioner, bath gel and body lotion). A copy of the South China Morning Post made its way to our room each afternoon. We even had a complimentary bowl of fresh fruits arranged neatly on our mini-bar. Don't you find this just wonderful? My sister and I were just so lucky to find vacancies despite showing up without reservations. We were so pleased that the receptionist gave us a tip on how to avail of discounted room rates. He booked us for one night only (on the day we showed up at 1035 HKD) and then advised us to reserve the remaining nights online. We were able to save 375 HKD per night on our succeeding stays by following his advice. ROOM. We stayed at Room 1014 (a non-smoking standard room with twin beds). It was a quaint and cozy room with Western interior design and a fantastic view of the sea. My sister and I are petite, so room size was not a problem. In fact, we were quite impressed with the way the hotel utilized the space. Our room was supposed to be the cheapest yet Island Pacific Hotel made sure that we did not miss out on our creature comforts. We had our own mini-bar where the staff replenished our daily supply of coffee, tea and sugar, an electric kettle, a refrigerator, a safe, an iron and ironing board, a handy multiple plug adaptor and a bathtub and shower (with good water pressure). We were also able to enjoy a variety of TV channel selections (including CNN, BBC, AXN and Discovery Channel) and FM stations. AMENITIES. Of the hotel’s many amenities – swimming pool, gym and restaurant – we made the most use of the business lounge in the 27th floor. The rates are not the cheapest for internet use (40 HKD for 30 minutes), printing (2 HKD for every page) and faxing (5 HKD for every page), but the hotel invited us to enroll in the 98 HKD membership program which allowed us to use the computer and avail of free-flowing coffee, tea and snacks for the whole day. LOCATION. The complimentary shuttle service is god-sent, but we ventured walking around the area and we were able to reach Sheung Wan MTR Station, Shun-Tak Center, Wing-On Department Store and the Macau Ferry Terminal on foot. There are two 7-11 shops close to the hotel. One is on the same block but you have to make a U-turn to get there. The other one is a block away facing Watson’s. We weren’t able to check out the MacDonald’s branch but it’s actually on the same block as Watson’s (just take a left when you reach the corner). The IFC Mall (which doubles as an MTR station) is just 21 HKD away by taxi. The surroundings of the hotel have an “authentic” Hong Kong feel. If you want to experience Western comforts in an Asian atmosphere, then Island Pacific Hotel is certainly the place to be. Good price, value for money and interesting location are reasons enough to choose Island Pacific Hotel. For us, the best deal maker by far was the hotel staff themselves. I wholeheartedly commend them for their warm, wonderful and very impressive customer care.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with great views and exotic region of the city”
Reviews.Author: Totti K
Reviews.Content: Our family landed on Island Pacific Hotel based on a deal we got through webshop. For our stay the hotel provided us with the besic necessities we were looking for during our five day stay visit to Hong Kong. The rooms are quite small even with Hong Kong standards. We upgraded our room to executive level room and there still was very little room for our 2 adults, 2 small children group. The executive lounge was certainly nothing to drag about, a small room with tea and cookies. The view from our room though was spectacular towards the harbour and ferries leaving to Macao. But the rooms were worn to a level that could not be cleaned with regular housecleaning gear. The beds were unpleasant and hard. There were some comments in TripAdvisor about the area and the smell of fish drying in shops. We have been in the area both during summer and winter and to our noses the smell was exotic to the most, but not unpleasant. The are around the hotel is literally filled with shops that sell dried fish, shark finns and other Asian sea-related foods and herbs. To us the area has a pleasant and certainly different flavor. The distance to the business district is easily done in a taxi in 5 minutes or a brisk 30-40 minutes walk if you dont mind the humidity. Overall, average hotel with some disadvantages. But we could stay in the hotel again is needed, no biggie.

Reviews.Title: “Crisp budget accomodation for a night”
Reviews.Author: abhal99
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a room for 1-2 nights, Island Pacific really impressed me. Very crisp and clean rooms. Good local eating places in the adjoining lane.

Reviews.Title: “Decent not Great”
Reviews.Author: ml2ys
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the highway which makes it a quick 5 min ride to Central. The rooms are extremely small, breakfast doesn't include much of a selection and isn't very good. The gym was closed for renovations, and while the pool seemed to be open, they kept finding reasons to not let anyone use it. Internet is extremely slow, and there is only 1 power outlet in the room. If you aren't planning on spending much time in the room, this hotel is acceptable, but I will not be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, staff were very friendly and helpful. This hotel is well situated for both Hong Kong and Kowloon Harbour. The free courtesy bus into central Hong Kong was very useful. Good leisure facilities as well. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elgolo
Reviews.Content: It's located in a good area, not the most famous but just taking a bus or the tram track takes you only 5 to 10 min to be at the center of Kowloon. At the area you have many food stores and supermarkets. The hotel is good, the rooms are very clean, though not too big. The prices inside the hotel (food, wireless) are quite expensive, so plan to buy beverage outside to take it with you. The staff is very firendly and are ready to help with everything you need. Wireless is almost 50 bucks a week, so in order to access (for free) just write your room number at the main page and the passwords is your date of birth i.e 04171980. All rooms have the passwords of the person who signs in at the hotel and every room number. They won't charge it, unless you ask for internet. Besides that I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hospitality, 4 star hotel, 3 star pricing, 2 THUMBS UP!!!”
Reviews.Author: echoi
Reviews.Content: stayed there 8 nights honestly, the only -'ve things are: (and I'm being picky) distance to the subway (which is reachable via tram or 15 minute walk) I hoped the lobby manager would greet guests as they pass. additional bed was US$45/night (which is steep compared with others) Everything else was very pleasing: nice harbor view (even their partial is pretty good) very well mannered front desk, I would say we were very demanding and they did everything they could to help (a few bellboys are green, but courteous) very clean room (my gf is very picky and she liked it) great price (compare with other similarly priced hotels) rooms are good size (again compare with other similarly priced hotels) they have a pool but I didn't go yes, the area smells of salty fish, but it's only partially during the day and none in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Hongkong, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: kmabello
Reviews.Content: Island Pacific Hotel is a very convenient place to stay when vacationing in Hongkong. Rooms were small, bathrooms tiny, but the view was awesome :) There were nearby eating places. Public transpo is very accessible. We had a person with wheelchair by the way. The staff were very helpful and accommodating, however it is the room itself that limited the use of the chair. Bathroom was very small, and there was no room to turn the wheelchair.

Reviews.Title: “Little extras would have made the difference”
Reviews.Author: OxfordTravelady
Reviews.Content: I thank all advisors for writing reviews, as I would have never stayed in this very interesting area otherwise. I was very disappointed with the rooms though. They are in need of refurbishment and revitalsing. I had booked a superior harbour view room and we were given a room on the 26th floor which was minute. We asked to change, whhich the lovely staff helped us with. We were moved to the 15th floor, which was better, however the room was damp and smelly. We got the shower curtain changed and the bathroom re-cleaned, but for the price (not that cheap) I would have expected more. I liked the buzz and atmosphere of the hotel, but it's a shame the rooms weren't as good as they could have been.

Reviews.Title: “Delux hotel”
Reviews.Author: sxusi555
Reviews.Content: The deluxe room had an excellent view when you could see out the windows. We had to constantly wipe the window with a towel to remove the mist. The room heating left you in jumpers and we had to get a second dooner for the nights. The beds are quite firm but comfortable. House keeping continually replace shampoo and conditioner, toothbrushes and paste and provide lots of tea and coffee. Staff was very helpful and always smiley with us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service by Karl Law”
Reviews.Author: stefunny10
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a two week vacation to Hong Kong with my daughter in May. We were planning to spend one week in a hotel in Hong Kong and another week in Kowloon. Prior to the trip, I did a substantial amount of research and came across a restauranteur's comment regarding Karl Law at the Island Pacific Hotel. That individual spoke very highly of Mr. Law and how he took care of her stay at Island Pacific. Out of all the hotels in Hong Kong, I decided to book Island Pacific first because of the price and positive comments that I read. After a week's stay, we decided to extend our stay at the hotel for the second week. This is highly due to the service we received from Mr. Law. We arrived at 8:00am Saturday morning, not expecting to have a room immediately. However, Mr. Law was on duty and offered to give us a room right away. While we waited for the room to be prepared, he offered us complimentary drinks at the lounge. In addition, he upgraded us to an ocean view instead of a city view room. After we decided to stay for an extra week, Mr. Law was extremely accommodating and offered to upgrade our room to a suite on the executive floor. During the room switches, he always took care of the luggage so that we never had to move them around ourselves. When we arrived to our room in the evening, all of our belongings were already there. Moreover, Mr. Law has excellent speaking skills in English which made him very effective in being able to attend to visitors. He also very polite, very approachable, very humble, and very friendly. Whenever we came across a problem, he was always able to take care of it and resolve it immediately. We experienced some problems with the drainage in the bathtub so we requested assistance from the front desk during the evening. After a couple nights and much frustration from the lack of service we received, we approached Mr. Law about it on the third morning. When we returned to the room that evening, someone had already come to the room to fix the problem. My daughter ran into some problems connecting her laptop to the hotel's internet a couple of times so when she went down to the front desk for help. 3 members of the night shift staff attempted to fix the problem, however they showed impatience with her and were still unable fix it after at least half an hour of waiting. She went to Mr. Law the next morning and he was able to fix it with ease, and always with patience and willingness. I hope that the management of the Island Pacific Hotel knows and appreciates what an exceptional job Mr. Law is doing for the company. He is an extremely valuable employee who deserves recognition, we could see him belonging to a 5 star hotel. I've been to many cities in North America and Asia but never have I received service from the front desk like I did for those two weeks from Mr. Law. He consistently and unconditionally goes out of his way to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. Mr. Law greeted us every morning with a smile, and we couldn't thank him more for making our vacation such a memorable one. The next time we return we'll be sure to stay at the Island Pacific Hotel in Hong Kong. I would also like to add that the concierge and bellboys from the ground floor were also very friendly and helpful, always smiling and willing to assist. We much appreciated their service to us as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel with decent views.”
Reviews.Author: Dan2118
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Island Pacific for 5 nights and this was our first ever trip to Hong Kong. First up i thought the location was quite good, it is VERY easy to get around Hong Kong so i would not be too concerned about reviews that say otherwise, our experience was that we had no troubles. We came on the ferry from Macau and walked to the hotel from the terminal, it was about a 10 minute walk with all our bags, could have got a cab but much cheaper to walk. From the hotel it is a 30 second walk to the tram which for 2hk you can ride to any of the stops. You can get the tram to the MTR stations but we just walked as i think it was faster than the trams! (about 10 min walk to the closest MTR). Make sure you get an octopus card as this saves you buying seperate tickets everytime. The hotel is in an interesting more local type area with lots of dried seafood stores and many interesting smelling products! there is also a really great fresh food market just up the hill from the hotel with all fresh meats, fruit and veg, flowers and seafoods, very interesting. The hotel room itself was quite small, but i gather this may be standard for hong kong? Was more expensive than i would expect, especially considering no free internet, but quite comfy and clean. Since it was our first trip to HK don't really have anything to compare it with but i have no complaints about the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, helpful staff, different location”
Reviews.Author: cybergibbons
Reviews.Content: I've just spent two weeks working with a client located in Central, but didn't want to pay the £300+ a night for a hotel really nearby. I went for the Island Pacific, and it's been a very good stay. I arrived before check-in time, and they quickly made a room available. I was in a superior room, and the room is above average in size for HK. The beds are typically hard, there are coffee and tea making facilities, and the shower is like a firehose (which is great!). The air conditioning is adjustable using a thermostat which is great. Internet is 300HKD for a week, which is about average. I'm still not sure why it costs in Hong Kong hotels. The concierges are exceptionally helpful. Taxis are about 25HKD into Central, or you can get the nearby tram for 2HKD. I tended to get a taxi in to avoid getting sweaty and then get a tram back in the evening. There is also a frequent shuttle bus run by the hotel. If you need to head to Kowloon, the tunnel is very close so a taxi is pretty cheap. The area is pretty different to "tourist" areas of Hong Kong. Most shops nearby sell dried fish products, and a lot of the restaurants have no English menu. If you're willing to experiment with food, and take it as it comes, everyone is willing to persist with pidgin English and you'll end up with a decent meal. There is a McDonalds nearby, and Central has a lot of places to eat. I didn't try the food in the hotel. A few other reviews have mentioned that the area feels unsafe at night. It's largely residential, there's not many bars, and the Western police station is a couple of hundred meters away. On the downside, I think even the non-smoking rooms have people smoking in them. My room didn't smell, but people on my non-smoking floor were smoking. This seems pretty common in Asia. The selection of free TV is a bit poor as well, not a problem if you are on holiday but if on business and just needing to veg out in the evening, it can be a bit dull.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room with excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: Maunolito
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in Superior Harbour View room. Room had a view towards Kowloon and a floor-to-ceiling window. Room was small, but ok for few nights. Toilet clean, small, but ok. Location is "local/Chinese" next to the smelly shark fin stores, being away from expats and tourists, but still a few minutes from Center. Tram is the handiest way to the Center and you can also walk for sightseeing. Staff was very helpfull. Big minus is lack of a free internet. In general, you get a decent small room, good location, friendly service with a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and effective”
Reviews.Author: stamphappy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Island Pacific for 5 nights in April 2010. This hotel strikes a good balance of being close to the business and tourist centres in Hong Kong without being so close as to charge a premium for location. The ambience of the hotel is excellent. The lobby, cafe and restaurant are all decked out in gleaming marble, as was the bathroom. The rooms are smaller than what many western travellers may expect but are on par with the standard in Hong Kong. For those wanting to take public transport, a tram stop is only about 100 metres away. Meals from room service come in a very generous size.

Reviews.Title: “AMBIENCE GALORE”
Reviews.Author: sallyhess
Reviews.Content: Took a cab from Macau Ferry and brought to the side entrance. The hotel is right on the streetcar line and don't know why they don't capitalize on this. Was issued a room which is perfectly adequate for one. The view was lovely of the trams to my left and the bay to the right. They are working on the road directly below but the windows are soundproof and heard nothing. Was able to pick up a few things for the fridge at a nearby grocer and there is also a Watsons and other nearby necessities. Don't be put off by reviewers that almost scared me away, just hop on the tram and be anywhere in no time or the free shuttle. I used the computer in the lobby while enjoying the live music, also newspapers and magazines. I ordered an orange juice from the bar and it was fresh squeezed, delicious. The pool area was very relaxing and comfortable lounge chairs. I paid about 67us per night and this is the deal of the century. My safe didn't seem to work but they fixed it immediately. I noticed 2 maids on my floor alone and rooms were kept immaculate. The bell hops are also helpful and if they don't know something they look it up on the internet for you. I'd stay here again as I don't thing you'd find a better deal on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: carminey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Island Pacific hotel for 2 weeks in late March. Here are some pros and cons. Pros: 1. If you want to see old HK, this is the place. It is easily accessible to tram and buses, as well as Sheung Wan MTR station. Free hotel shuttle to Central MTR, Macau ferry, Landmark, etc. 2. Clothes line over the bathtub- convenient for anyone who stays for an extended period of time and needs to do some light laundry. 3. Mini refrigerator – It was meant as a mini bar, but I used it to store milk since I usually drink a glass of milk everyday. 4. Electric teapot- boils water in no time. 5. Sufficiently clean. but room is quite small. Had a view of the harbor , but it was foggy during most of our stay. 6. Friendly bellhops and whenever I called for services, they were at my door almost immediately. 7. I never ate at any of the hotel restaurants. Instead I went to the small restaurants and bakeries nearby. Definitely one way to save money. The bakeries have excellent buns, cakes and pastries. If you do not like congee (rice porridge), some of the restaurants serve toasts, coffee, etc. 8. I was upgraded to a room on the Executive floor, but it is still quite small. In other words, great value for the price. Cons: 1. The vent in the bathroom is also on, thus it gets quite noisy at night. 2. Whenever my neighbor opened or closed their door, my door slammed as well, as if someone was trying to open MY door. And this went on all day ! It’s loud enough to wake you up in the middle of the night. 3. Though the room is decently cleaned, the maid did not vacuum the floor. 4. The toilet’s water pressure is weak. You need to flush several times. Though I had a pleasant experience staying at this hotel, there was one incident that I was not very happy with. BEWARE OF HOW YOU WILL BE CHARGED WHEN YOU CHECK OUT. When I checked out, the charge on the hotel itemized receipt was in HKD. However, when I signed the credit card receipt, it was in both HKD and USD. The exchange rate on the credit card receipt was 7.5 (instead of the current market exchange rate of approxmiately 7.7 ). I called the hotel and asked about whether I will be charged in HKD or USD. The hotel said in HKD. The way how my credit card company works is when I charge something in local currency, my credit card company converts local currency charge into USD, and the conversion rate is based on that day’s market exchange rate (in this case, 1 USD =approx 7.7611 to 7.766 HKD) . However, I checked my credit card bill and found out that I was charged the already converted USD amount that was on the credit card receipt, based on the hotel’s exchange rate of $1 USD = $7.5 HKD. Yup, I felt cheated and was disappointed by this incident. -Carminey

Reviews.Title: “Happy with this place”
Reviews.Author: tfcfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in March 2010 stopping over on my way from Taiwan back to the UK. I booked through expedia and paid $74 US for the night (not including breakfast). This place has a kind of faded elegance about it which I found charming rather than depressing. It’s a functional mid-range business/tourist place. There are supposed to be good views over the harbour, but unfortunately it was foggy so I couldn’t verify this. The fitness centre was extremely small, but it was useful to have a place to run for half an hour to get the heart rate up for a while. The TV had a small problem with it but the staff were quick to sort this out. The bell boys were very helpful and friendly. I used the business centre for half an hour's internet access and the charge was not too high. The hotel was quite conveniently located not too far from the metro and in a quaint Chinatown type area of the city. I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: VIVEKSHARMA63
Reviews.Content: We stayed in This hotel from 8th march 2010 to12 march 2010,service excellent,Co-operative staff,Rooms are good spacious ,clean but had a problem on last day as we have to change a room for non-smoking to other room, smell was there in room but hotel staff was quite co-opertaive they changed our bedding .

Reviews.Title: “I love how the staff here treated us; the bed & shower were highlights too!”
Reviews.Author: Foodie-TO
Reviews.Content: February 2010 was my second time staying at this hotel. We launched our trip to Asia from Hong Kong so we stayed here in Jan 2010 and then again in Feb on our way back (the repeat visit being the first indication we liked it here). We booked Island Pacific online, after reading other Trip Advisor reviews. Just a 10 - 15 minute walk, or a 5 minute taxi, or free bus shuttle from the center, we were very happy with our location. Our room had a lovely view of the water. The bed was incredibly luxurious, with a down duvet; the room and hotel were kept extremely clean (I'm a clean freak of sorts). The shower was amazing. There were thoughtful little touches too, like a basket of fresh fruit in the room upon our arrival, or the power converter and the ipod docking station that were also supplied. Their kitchen was very good too, we enjoyed there outstanding buffet breakfast a couple of times (I am a restaurateur, so my standards with food are pretty picky). What I liked most was the staff. Everyone was incredibly helpful and gracious, we were particular impressed with the service of the front desk staff. We had a few occasions upon which we requested help from them, and they couldn't have been more gracious and hospitable. We had the silly request of staying in the same room in February that we did in January. Being the tail end of Chinese new year, this wasn't possible, but the front desk was incredibly respectful, and helpful, and even upgraded our room to ensure we were well looked after. Many staff impressed us there, but Karl Law stood out as a true hospitality professional. If I was in the hotel business, rather than food service, I'd have tried to poach him on the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory hotel in an interesting area.”
Reviews.Author: MarymayOxford
Reviews.Content: A good place to stay whilst in Hong Kong. A room overlooking the harbour is worth having, but there is a slight hum of traffic below. The hotel is in an area where locals live and work and a walk through the locality is very interesting. It is well placed for the tram and for sightseeing. It is an area that sells dried fish but we did not find the smell a problem, in fact the local shops were a bonus. The hotel staff were very helpful and there is a restaurant if you don't want to go out to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value.”
Reviews.Author: Woodstock1953
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 13 nights with my backpacking-daughter. The room wasn't huge - about the same square-footage as a Travel Lodge room. The place was spotless, beds were beautifully made up daily, and there were always fresh towels on the rail. We had a side-harbour view, which included a view of residential blocks too. But, to be fair, these tower blocks were everywhere so it couldn't be avoided. Staff were always attentive and rushed to open doors or push the lift button for us. There was a small Fitness Room - about 12ft square - but the equipment was state of the art with individual TV screens attached to the treadmills. The Fitness room overlooked the pool, which we didn't try out as the weather was too cold (about 8degrees at one point). Breakfast in the restaurant was a little pricey (128 HK$); we discovered some lovely little cake shops just along the road from the hotel, so these supplied our breakfasts. Internet access was available until 9pm each evening, but cost 30HK$ for just half an hour. Instead, we headed for the Pacific coffee shop where access was free. Trams (just 2HK$ a journey) and buses were plentiful and were within 100yards of the hotel. The MTR was about a 15 minute walk. The Bar served a lovely Virgin Colada, and we were entertained by two singers; they were pretty good considering. I would happily stay at this hotel again, although I might avoid the Chinese New Year next time! (My own fault, I didn't check dates.....).

Reviews.Title: “A great 4 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hordakker
Reviews.Content: Even though the Island Pacific only has got 3 Stars, you will be able to enjoy a full 4 Star experience. The rooms are more than worth the price, I usually paid about 50-60 Euro per night. They are all very clean and if you check in very late you are running a good chance to get a free upgrade for sea-view. Other hotels would costs you a multiple on Hong Kong Island with Victoria Harbour view! The breakfast is optional but good, 4 Stars as well for range of selection and food quality. The dinner buffet at about 25 Euro even includes Deep Sea Alaska Crab which is plentyfull available and will be re-stocked once the tray is empty. For the money there is no, I repeat no, better deal on Hong Kong Island. Forget the comments about footwalk, you are in Hong Kong. Take a 20 HKD cab ride to be at the Macau Ferry Pier, 25 HKD takes you to Central and 130 HKD (~13 Euro) brings you to busy Kowloon Tsim Sah Tsui. Make no mistake, this is no 5 Star resort, the hotel's size alone is the major reason why it doesn't bear 4 full Stars, but you will have a great stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the buck, but a little out of the mainstream”
Reviews.Author: SeattleChappy
Reviews.Content: It is not in the trendiest place, and it is a hike to get to the tourist places, but it has a view of the harbor and a good price. Online price was lower than reception quoted when inquiring about a return trip. Breakfast is good, but overpriced. Close to Macau Ferry term and Airport express is 25HKD trip away.

Reviews.Title: “Kun Hei Fat Choy”
Reviews.Author: elimbah1
Reviews.Content: The deluxe room had an excellent view when you could see out the windows. We had to constantly wipe the window with a towel to remove the mist. The room heating left you in jumpers and we had to get a second dooner for the nights. Initially the heat setting was blocked off and when we complained about the temperature they sent house keeping to remove the tag that hid the heat selection. The temperature was 8 - 11 C outside. The beds are quite firm but comfortable. House keeping continually replace shampoo and conditioner, toothbrushes and paste and provide lots of tea and coffee. I use a wheelchair and getting into the tiny bathroom was nearly impossible. I had arranged for a wheelchair room but despite their assurances it was no different to the other rooms. You must have some mobility to stay at this hotel. Getting around HK in a chair is pretty easy and everyone wants to help. The MTV and airport trains are roll on, roll off and the ferries are a bit of a challenge but the deck hands always help you. Although the room economy was good their dining room was a little exy so we ate at the many restaurants between Sheun Wan and Central. You can buy snack food, water and beer at the local 7/11. Heineken was $1 AUD per can at 7/11 but over $5 in the room. Don't buy the Hong Kong made San Migel it's disgusting. Don't change your currency in Australia. The many HSBC banks give a much better rate. Paying the hotel bill with Master Card also gave a good exchange rate. Overall we were very happy with the Island Pacific It was clean and comfortable, the staff were very friendly and helpful and it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: olddy
Reviews.Content: Plenty of ocmments already about this hotel value for money and it's location, so won't repeat all that. We picked the hotel for it's location close to Macau ferry terminal, less than 1km away, as we were coming into HK via Macau. But possibly too far to walk if you have luggage as need to go up and down steps over footbridge to cross the motorway . Staff were friendly and we used the lounge, washroom as we checked out at noon but not leaving till late afternoon. Internet is expensive, but there is free HK government wifi just the oher side of the road at the Western Sports Centre, again need to walk a bit to use overhead footbridge to get across. Plenty of cheap eats around the hotel, if you happy to eat like a local.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, practical hotel without many frills”
Reviews.Author: pumpkinpatch81
Reviews.Content: Don't let the pictures of this hotel fool you. The room we stayed in was much smaller than we thought it would be, and the partial harbor view was actually mostly that of an apartment building across the street (and their hanging laundry). That being said, the bed and bathroom were decent enough. The swimming pool is pretty nice -- probably best on a clear, sunny day. And the staff was helpful for the most part. The hotel itself is located in a working class neighborhood on Hong Kong Island, which meant it was very active during the day and pretty quiet at night. It was a perfectly fine place to start our days, though, with easy access to taxis, trolleys, and the piers at Central. Things get pretty quiet after the sun goes down, though, so I wouldn't recommend this hotel for people looking for easy access to a vibrant nightlife. Overall, this hotel wasn't bad for our first trip to Hong Kong, and it served us well in terms of basics like sleeping and breakfast. Not a great value, though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel + hidden location = great value”
Reviews.Author: jmonsoon
Reviews.Content: The Island Pacific Hotel is like any of the high quality hotels on Hong Kong Island, but is on the western side of the island in the middle of shark-fin (horrifying, I know) and dried fish neighborhoods. As a result, you get high class service at a steal, and also get to see a less-polished and more interesting (to me, anyway) part of the island. The rooms are nicely furnished and comfortable, although definitely small, but we had an amazing harbor view from the 15th floor that more than made up for being a little squished. The service is very gracious and helpful, and the lobby and bar are refreshingly smoke-free and offer a great place for a drink at sunset overlooking the harbor. We could easily walk to the more touristy parts of town, or spend a couple bucks on a cab, so why spend hundreds more to stay half a mile away in a hotel that's not any more luxurious?

Reviews.Title: “Better location than some suggest”
Reviews.Author: Ginger_Rachel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you don't mind staying a bit out of the 'tourist' centre. Some reviews have made comments that it is not worth staying here if you are in Hong Kong to see the sights - I disagree. There is plenty of public transport which is frequent and easy to negoatiate. The tram line is 1 min walk away and it is $HK 2 for all journeys whatever the length - this is the easiest way to travel .. and feels like an authentic HK experience also. There is a bus from the airport which drops you off 1 min walk from the hotel - just ask the very pleasant tourist info office at the airport - they will write the bus number and stop number (so you don't need to worry about missing the stop!) Hotel is clean and well maintained. Staff are polite, friendly and helpful. All in all very good value for money. There is a free shuttle to the airport train station which we were going to take on the way back. When we came to get it, the staff informed us it was out of service at that moment - however they were more than happy to call us a cab and then pay the driver so we weren't out of pocket. If you haven't already been convinced to stop here then if you want to see the largest array of dried seafood shops in the world (my opinion only!) then the Island Pacific is for you .... it's bizarre, amazing and left me open mouthed each time we walked down the street!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: GrAv3n
Reviews.Content: We spend most of our time in Hong Kong in the Island Pacific Hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpfull we had a Side Harbour view room and the View of the harbour is very nice. The rooms are quite small but clean. The hotel is located in the Des Vaux street with a lot of dried Seafood Shops that does make a lot of stink! It is also quite far from the MTR and you need to take a bus(5B) or the Tram to the nearest station but this is very cheap(2 HKD) and the stops are within 2 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great econimical place in the good location”
Reviews.Author: PharmaHOD
Reviews.Content: I went to deliver my guest lecture in an international conference. The hotel has very good airport pickup and drop off facility. They also have free bus service to major points in the city. The room I booked, through travel agent of conference, was harbour view deluxe room. It was very good room with very good view, the room has almost all facilities you need. The room was clean and toilets were very good. The size of the room is just sufficient for two, so if you have kids then it will be small. The hotel also has buffet breakfast which you can book with room or separately after wards. The staff at reception we too good. This was my first trip to Hong Kong, so i had a lot of queries, the staff was helpful at all times. The staff was well educated and trained for the job. They arrange everything for you. The location of hotel is OK, but not very great if you are going for tourism. The train station is 15 minutes walk from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: CCF007
Reviews.Content: We booked direct with the hotel over the internet. Upon arrival we were given a full harbour view room on the 28th floor. To say that it was a pleasant surprise was an understatement. The room was spacious with very high ceilings. The harbor view through the ceiling to floor windows is stunning. There are marble bench tops in the bathroom and on the bedside table. The shower recess is huge. We particularly like the non slippery floor which is safe for people of all ages. Initially we planned to stay for 2 days but for personal reasons we ended up staying there for 16 days. The staffs are more than professional and efficient. They are warm and friendly. Their service is genuine and caring. During our stay, we get to know most of them. They treat us like friends. It is the extra personal touch that makes us feel like home. The hotel is located in the older part of the city where we can still experience the traditional Hong Kong which is being fast devoured by modernization. To get around is easy. Trams and bus are only meters away. Trams cost A$0.30, buses A$0.50 and the subway is about $A3.00 by taxi. We had buffet breakfast at the IP Café. There are Chinese and western dishes and the standard is high. It may cost a bit more than eating outside but you pay for the quality and the service. If you are looking for a hotel with exceptionally good value for money, it is hard to go past the Island Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but small room and not very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalachiWilliams
Reviews.Content: The hotel benefits from a shuttle service which we would recommend using and it is close to the Macau ferry. The rooms are small and functional and the price made it a great place to stay, but the rooms do not lend themselves to spending much time in them. We were in room 1213 and overall it was OK but nothing special. Cleanliness needs to be improved. If staying at the hotel we would recommending going to Queen Street for food. It looks like a homeless food kitchen and is extremely basic in every respect, but the food is good. The Pacific Coffee Company is a great place to go for coffee and to use the internet for free! The light show that takes place every night is not worth seeing and the Hong Kong Disney is good for under 10's but not as good as the other ones - it is much smaller. Finally, the hotel does have an OK pool, but lacks a bar and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “IP good if you are visiting the Uni!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovebarbeach
Reviews.Content: The IP is a fine hotel ........ the full length windows are the highlight - make sure you ask for a harbour view. The other great thing is that it has an outdoor pool - many hotels in Honkers do not. The area is fabulous, too - far more authentic than down in Wan Chai or Central.................... a local guy on the corner sells freshly bbqed duck with rice and fresh bok choy for $2 AUD take away!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: argasp
Reviews.Content: Finding value for money is not always easy in this city, especially if you want to stay on HK Island. I found the Island Pacific to be just that. I booked a city-view room and was promptly upgraded to a harbour view room. The room itself was small but nicely decorated and well-maintained. Even though there is no metro station nearby, everything is within easy reach by tram or taxi. Only complaint: you have to pay for internet access, and dearly so.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: dcatalao
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we wanted just a room to sleep and explore Hong Kong. It was a good value and is well located as you can go to central by foot, trolley or taxi. Yes is far away from the MTR but you can live with it. Arrived really late and asked where we could have something to eat. They told us there was a 7-11 store and when we were coming back to the hotel we saw a MacDonald’s in the other side of the road. Couldn’t the concierge just said that!! (It was clearly a Mac emergency!!) Our first room was really bad. It was super small with an unbearable tobacco smelling as they gave us a room in a smoking floor. I asked to move to another room and front desk was really nice an upgraded us to a much bigger room, with no smelling issues and with a lovely view to the bay. Breakfast was nice with a lot variety. Bottom line was pleasant stay and exactly what we were looking for to sightsee Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice and great staff service”
Reviews.Author: coockie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Island Pacific, after having find a deal for EUR 55, without breakfast. The hotel is a bit out of the city center, but after all, only a 15 minutes walk from the Star Ferry Terminal. We basically did everything on foot. We were upgraded to an executive room, and although small, had everything we needed, was very clean and tranquil. Only small negative point is the fact the beds are rather small. Staff was efficient, kind and helpful, especially the bell boy downstairs who arranges taxis. We tried the swimming pool, but the water was just too cold for our likings. Overall, we can only highly recommend this hotel, it has an excellent price-quality balance, and eventually, in Hong Kong, you want to spend as much time as possible outdoors, so a hotel like the Island Pacific serves it purpose perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Hong Kong Without the Tourist Traps”
Reviews.Author: dakosh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the "thick" of it all, but what it does offer is a more authentic Hong Kong experience. The hotel is located more in the residential area of Hong Kong Island. You can see and participate in the everyday life of Hong Kong residents. The area is lined with numerous dried seafood and herb stores. There is a 7-11 just up the road along with a small bakery. The staff here is extremely friendly. They opened the door for me whenever entering or exiting the hotel and welcomed me. The concierge was very helpful and the front desk very efficient and friendly as well. The rooms, though not spacious, had more than enough room for myself. I booked just a standard room through Travelocity but was given a side harbor view which was nice, even though I wasn't in the room often. This hotel is easy to catch any number of public transportation systems available in Hong Kong. The tram stop is just a minute away which you can take to the MTR. Otherwise the MTR is just a 15 minute walk. You can also walk to Hollywood Road and Cat Street in about 10 minutes. Really enjoyed my stay and wouldn't hesitate to come back. The hotel may not be centrally located, but I enjoyed getting a glimpse into residential life rather than just seeing all the tourist traps.

Reviews.Title: “Good one with some issues”
Reviews.Author: Pribina
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a good place, but about 15 minutes by foot from MTR. The price is good, but internet is not free but there's a fee. Small issues found, the toilet was little bit broken with water still running and the AC was little bit noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and good value”
Reviews.Author: vixey82
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was a good base. We were out most of the day and night exploring the city but it was nice to come back to a comfortable room. I have read all rooms in Hong Kong are small but this was quite a good size. We had a side harbour view which was nice, i would reccomend a harbour view otherwise you look at unsightly buildings. We only used the swimming pool at the hotel and this was lovely, nice to cool off in after a days sightseeing. You can walk to the tube station, its about 10-15min walk but then you are only one stop away from central where all of the shops are. Also taxis are so cheap its really easy to get around, so really close to nightlife in a cab. Overall this hotel was clean and i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: coolioalexa
Reviews.Content: i managed to book this hotel through asiatravel.com, which offered a good deal...this hotel is more than what we have expected. Even though it is away from the nearest MTR sheung wan station, it is very near to central...it is only about 8-10mins walk to the mtr where you can experience the typical hk ppl living...tram is just a mere 50m away...we like the free hotel shuttle service to IFC very much..it operates at 1/2 hourly till 7pm. it was very convenient to us when we were lazy to walk..they also offer hotel pickup service!! btw, taxi drive from central to this hotel is just hkd 20... the hotel area is rich with great food with reasonable price!! you cant enjoy this kind of delicious food at central/ TST, where higher price is expected!! there is a good wan tan mee specialist restaurant just across the street, each bowl only costs hkd10-15...very nice egg tarts/ fruits just few shops away (need not to visit the famous shop in central)...few other restaurants for dimsum, rice etc.... hotel service is good...frontdesk staff are very friendly and do speak understandable english...concierge is very helpful...even though the room is small, but it is common in hk...since we did not spend much time in the hotel, we were not bothered with this.. overall, i think this is a great hotel to stay..i will definitely stay in this hotel again if there is another good deal!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: MarkM75
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a bargain last-minute deal on Expedia, so I was really impressed by how good it was. Firstly, the location. It's on the waterfront in the Sheung Wan district, just to the west of the Central area (the main business and shopping district). The area itself is completely Chinese which, for me, was a great experience - as other parts of the city are quite westernised. It might seem a bit intimidating when you first arrive, as you won't see many other westerners on the streets - but it's a really safe area, so absolutely nothing to worry about. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the nearest underground station, and probably around 35 minutes walk to the Central area. But by far the best way to get into the centre and beyond is by tram - as they're cheap as chips, and go right past the hotel. It's really easy - you just jump on at the back, and pay the $2 flat rate fare (less than 20p!) as you get off. If you're arriving from the airport with luggage, I'd recommend taking the Airport Express train to Hong Kong Station ($100/less than £10), and then getting a taxi to the hotel (about $30/less than £3). My room was a standard twin, which was perfectly nice. Not massive, but plenty big enough for me. It was spotlessly clean, along with the nice marble bathroom (with a good shower over the bath). I had an LCD tv, with all the usual international channels (CNN, BBC World News etc) - and there was an FM radio with iPod docking station on the bedside table, which was a nice touch. The view from my room was superb - I had a corner window, with one side looking out over the harbour (to the west, so not towards the famous skyscrapers in Central), and the other side facing towards the surrounding tower blocks. The floor-to-ceiling windows were probably the best feature of the room. There was only one real downside - and that was the lack of free wifi (you have to pay for internet access). There seemed to be one internet computer in the bar area, but it was always being used whenever I checked. As I result, I spent quite a bit of time loitering in shopping malls, using their free wifi instead! The hotel staff were lovely - really friendly, and all spoke great English. Checking in and out was easy - and they were happy to look after my bags after I'd checked out, as I had a late flight. They hailed me a taxi to the station, too . I didn't eat or drink in the hotel, but there's a restaurant and bar (the advertised buffet looked a bit expensive). I'd recommend paying a visit to the 7-11 across the road for water and other general supplies, and the Hamburg Cake Shop just opposite the 7-11 for some authentic Chinese breakfast (pork buns, etc). The bar never looked very lively but, then again, I doubt many people come to a great city like Hong Kong to stay in the hotel bar! There's a small gym (which I didn't use, but looked quite good) and a pool (which I used once). It wasn't massive, and not that deep - but was a nice way to cool off after a day in the heat of the city. If you get offered this hotel as part of a cheap deal, you should jump at the chance to stay there. I'd definitely do so again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for price-concious traveller”
Reviews.Author: fter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in late May 2009, room 914. It's not a bad location, not "central" but the tramline runs outside the door of the hotel so everywhere is easily reached. And taxis are not expensive in HK relative to in the west. The street outside is lined with dried-fish shops which makes the street a bit smelly but for me this is just local atmosphere and didn't bother me in the slightest. The hotel was not smelly I must add! Generally this is a "Chinese" area. It's a nice 10 mins walk to Soho area for loads of "western" restaurants. We - 2 adults and 2 small kids - were travelling around Asia on a budget and were afraid of high hotel costs in HK. We got a recommendation to this hotel from a fellow traveller and it worked out very well indeed. The room rate was very reasonable, much lower than most places in HK, and the room was big enough for us all, with the kids sleeping on the carpeted floor on extra sheets. We didn't pay for breakfast at the hotel, instead getting sandwiches and cakes from the Homburg Cake Shop just across the road each morning and drinks from the 7/11 nearby. So for a budget traveller who still wants a decent hotel the Island Pacific is perfect. Pros: + compact room but good use of space + good buffet lunch for HK$128/adult (and dinner for HK$268 with 32% off with discount voucher, but we only had the lunch). Both prices +10% tax. + concierge very helpful, I needed to find a store stocking a specific product and within 10 minutes they provided me a list. + fridge in-room, contained minibar items but there was room for some of our own food + Good "Homburg" Cake Shop in the side-street across the road. Cons: - pool is cold, the kids didn't want to use it - small exercise room, only 1 of the 2 treadmills was working - internet is not free (there may be a single freely accessible Mac in the bar area but we didn't enquire about it) - reception staff wore face masks due to H1N1/Swine Fever. While I can understand the medical reasons for this, it made it a little hard to understand their speech. Plus, most other staff didn't wear masks, e.g. restaurant staff. The lift buttons were also sterilised hourly which seems overkill, but if you're a health-freak you might like that. Final note: It was our goal to spend 2 days at Disneyland and for this we moved to the more expensive Disneyland Hollywood hotel rather than spend time and money travelling in and out of HK each day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, average hotel in a working class neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: LeonTaipei
Reviews.Content: The Island Pacific hotel is an excellent, average hotel. It is not high end, and you should not go in expecting it to be. However our experience was that there is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel, and it delivers on all points for the price we are paying. Was it worth it (value for money)? Absolutely. But will want to know a few things. Here's what we (my wife & daughter) thought was most noticeable about the hotel: The hotel: quite nice, and not grand. Clean, maintained, and comfortably functional. Not a large hotel, but has all the amenities you would want. The service: from the moment we arrived, friendly, very helpful (particularly the concierge), accommodating, prompt, and brilliantly efficient. Everything we requested--from an harbour view to a larger bed to help with the room safe to providing new pillows--was taken care of immediately and with no hesitation. The room: Smallish but definitely comfortable. Normal sized bathroom with tub. Spectacular view on harbor side. Yes, the rooms are definitely starting to show a little wear around the edges, but nothing that really affects the quality of your stay (unless slight wall abrasions or minor carpet stains affect the quality of your stay). Here's what we didn't expect: The location: let's be honest, this hotel is square in the middle of a working-class neighbourhood. You walk out the hotel and you are in the thick of an older, residential neighbourhood. No glitz, no glamour, just fruit sellers, noodle shops, and many trading shops, the majority which sell dried sea whatever (the Chinese have a penchant for clustering a particular commodity into an area). Local restaurants sell cheap, tasty food. Just be prepared for local, not touristy. Please understand, for me being in the thick of working HK is not a bad thing; it is the real deal HK. If you'd like to be just out of the tourist area, this is a good location. It's right on the tram line, so it can take you to the MTR and the center easily. However, we did find that after a long day of traveling, it always felt like an extra effort to get back to the hotel. It's just that little bit 'out there' that the tired body didn't always respond well to.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Clean, Helpful Staff, Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: westwilshire
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package deal. Finding the hotel was easy, it is not in the most central touristy area, but is easily reached by tram or cab. It is within walking distance of the Central Station, and is a good base for a visit. The neighborhood is a funky bustling area, shopping is good, especially if you like dried seafood! We stayed for almost a week, and we're happy with our choice. The room is relatively small, but all the amenities were there. There is a safe that was big enough to fit my small laptop. Our room had a view of the Harbor. The staff was very helpful and efficient. When our bathroom door got stuck in the middle of the night, the engineer was there in less than 5 minutes and had it fixed quickly. We didn't eat in the restaurant, because there were so many cool places to eat nearby. Overall, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Freindly, Best rate, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: zandoon14
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights with my wife and 4 kids, we book for 2 standard double bed side hurbour veiw, they give us 2 Delux full harbur veiw same price, they give us warm welcome and best service. Room clean and tidy and full option. I would like to come back again there.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever!”
Reviews.Author: lindit
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel. Service was so good and we like that distance from center.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service, would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: kurashikisuzy
Reviews.Content: I too was a little skeptical because of the really reasonable price but was pleasantly surprised. We were upgraded from a standard room to a partial harbour view on the 25th floor. Room was comfortable, clean, and spacious enough. Staff very friendly and helpful. Received paper every morning and fruit delivered to our room on check-in. One computer to check email (free) in lobby. Would stay here again if ever in HK and definitely recommend staying here. Only drawback was a bit far from MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: TAKLAYTON
Reviews.Content: The room was large enough, clearn, comfy bed. Love the shower, very strong pressure. The location was good too, tram stop just around the corner, 10 min walk to Macau ferry terminal. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Deal!”
Reviews.Author: bpdogs
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying here for four nights with friends. We had two rooms. Since it is low season, we asked if we could get upgraded from out city view room to a partial harbour view room. They upgraded us both to full harbour view rooms! Clean but small rooms (as are most in Hong Kong). Nice LCD TV on wall, but not many stations and no movie stations. ipod docking station at bed a nice touch. Clean bathroom that wasn't too small. Tub with no separate shower. Beds are firm, but not "Chinese hard as wood firm". Many will still not like these beds though. Clean and comfortable sheets and pillows. Pool was decent size. Can't see why someone would call it small? This is not a 5 star hotel. Pool was in the sun at 3pm. Nice small but new equipment in gym. Never tried the food. For great dim sum, head out the hotel and take a left then go down the block and take another left. Upstairs above the Jockey club. If you pass the 7-11, you went too far. Bar had a free computer to surf the Internet. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. My friend came down with an allergic reaction to some food, and a hotel staff accompanied him to the hospital! Barely smelled the dried fish. And trams around the corner of the hotel took us to the MTR station in 7 minutes and Causeway bay in 15 minutes. How can anyone say this is too far out? Right near Macau ferry, airport express, and underground tunnel to Kowloon. I might stay somewhere else when I go back to Hong Kong, only to try a different hotel. However, if this hotel has another unbeatable rate over the others, I will stay here again. Paid $72 a night (all taxes) and got the free upgrade that was priced at $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: puddletink
Reviews.Content: Big Puddle, Little Puddle (age 9) and me stayed here for 14 nights in May/June. As has been previously stated hotel rooms in Hong Kong are very small. When we arrived we were suprised at how small the room was and that was without the rollaway bed for Little Puddle. When that was set up, up against the window there was only about a foot between the three beds. The beds are extremely hard which affect our quality of sleep and there is also a shortage of wardrobe space and no where at all to put cases especially if there are three of you. Apart from that the hotel was fine. The room was kept very clean and staff were friendly especially the bell hops. The pool was okay although it did not get the sun at all. The location of the hotel was fine. A short and very cheap taxi ride to central or soho. Trams and buses stop just outside the hotel and the nearest MTR is only a 10 minute walk away. The hotel was okay for the price paid but I wouldn't stay there again because of the very small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “stinky”
Reviews.Author: Tuscan72
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this hotel. We booked a room with the sea view, it was so smelly as the curtains were full of mould. We complained and they changed the room but it was stinky as well. As results we got bad sore throat. The view is nothing special as it overlooks the highway, room are so small, lift is obsolete and scary and swimming pool size of bath. Just forget it and your health will benefit

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: monkeyalan5
Reviews.Content: We booked online and were fortunate enough to find a dicount code, going through a large online agent, and herefore for 6 nights we got a pretty good deal. Again in HK most normal hotels you will find twin beds more common than Doubles, Queen and Kingsize, but the hotel does offer the latter as well, just make sure you put it down as a preference. Due to the length of stay, we decided to pay the little extra and pay for the "superior room" supposedly a larger room and a partial harbour view; however we found ourselves on the 10th floor in the smallest room facing the back of the hotel over looking the mainly residential western district.
