Because of this we called up reception and they were happy to offer an upgrade; we were moved to the executive floor (28) and had or partial harbour view and a bit bigger room (note most rooms in HK hotels do tend to be on the small side compared to their european counterparts). Check in staff were friendly, although due to the Swine Flu outbreak, they were all wearing face masks, and upon check in our temperature was checked, and our passport details taken. The hotel is in a nice area, less touristy and had a more local feel to the place, every morning it was busy with people moving about the street, one street directly behind (and paralled to) the hotel there is a nice little bakery that sold a selection of cakes, I became quite fond of the egg tarts and pineapple sugar butter buns. However around the area there are a lot of fish stalls as mention prefiously, and a lot of items are placed on the street; it gives a lovely insight to the place, but if you don't like seeing such things daily, this area may not be for you. On the road infront of the Hotel (Connaught Rd West I believe), if you wal towards western market you will come across a small little local cafe, around 5-10 min walk, which made a change from our normal touristy routine. FInally transport, despite being a little way out from the hustle and bustle HK's transport infrastructure really does shine, I prefered taking the bus to central and then the MTR (underground) or ferry from there. If you want to get to the main business district/shopping area in central try and get the bus numbers 1, 5, 10 and 18 - costing around $3.4- to get to central; they are the cheapest and are very regular (the 3 digit buses tend to be more expensive). I would definitely advise getting an Octopus card no matter how short the stay as the majority of the money paid for the card will be refunded (you pay a $50 deposit when you get the card). If you are in need of any help find a tourist information centre or ask a local, overall we found the friendliest people to be around the Kowloon Walled City (north Kowloon). make no mistake about it HK is a tourist hot spot, and if you spend most of your time in the centres you will pay for it, try go exploring and go to some lesser explored places and you will discover some delightful places and save the pennies :)

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, near central location, but don't expect more than you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mdang1986
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good. Concierge & Bellboys are all extremely nice. Receptionists are OK. Our room was decent, it really is exactly what we paid for. We paid for a superior 20m2 room with view, and that's what we got. No extras. The bathroom was decent, but the room itself, well there wasnt much space around the bed. When my partner arrived at a later date, we were concerned his extra large suitcase would crowd the room - since with my suitcase the room was already "cozy". We kindly asked if the hotel wasn't too full, if they could put us in a room with just a bit more space for our suitcases. This couldnt be done unless we were willing to pay USD50 extra. We were staying at the hotel for 9 nights, and they couldn't help us with some extra space. Aside from the small rooms - after I already booked a bigger room (the standard one is 14m2!), the hotel was adequate, 10 min by tram from central and.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the price”
Reviews.Author: Acidinmyfridge
Reviews.Content: We went to Pacific Island Hotel only because we found out a good deal (37 EUR / night). It was conveniently located on Hong Kong Island, although quite far away from any MTR station. Rooms are rather spacious compared with the usual sarcophagus-alike rooms in HK. The bed was clean and confy, with a flat screen on the opposite wall. Rugs on the floor would need to be cleaned though. OK bathroom, although we couldn't fix the water temperature on our own. Overall OK experience, but only if you have to stay for a spot-night in HK and wants by all means to be located on the Island part without breaking your purse.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and great value”
Reviews.Author: mikethetyke
Reviews.Content: I was sceptical about this hotel as the room rate was very cheap for HK - I paid £38 per night for single occupancy. I was not disappointed - the room had a large double bed, fantastic harbour view and well equipped. There's also has a nice outdoor pool. The service was excellent by Western standards. The restaurant is also good value for HK - offering buffet breakfast for £10 and dinner for about £20 including unlimited free wine (wine is often expensive in HK - but go for the red). The buffet dinner is an interesting culinary experience as it offers a selection of Chinese, Japanese, Korean and Western dishes. The only disappointment was the bar - a dreary affair with expensive drinks - but there are no alternatives in the immediate surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel makes all the other ones on the Island seem overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: cat666
Reviews.Content: We were a party of two and we stayed on an Executive Floor, but the room was small even for Hong Kong. To be fair, the space was just about manageable and not unbearably tiny. However, we only stayed for two nights. It’s possible that a longer stay would’ve felt more cramped. We had two large pieces of luggage, and we struggled to find a place for them. If you are travelling light though, this won’t be a problem. After using the shower, we noticed that the bath had difficulty draining. It’s kinda gross to stand in five inches of dirty water whilst showering. We informed the staff about this, but I’m not sure whether they did something about it or not. The next day the drain was more or less the same. The mini-bar prices! This we took as a joke. A large bottle of Evian water (1 liter) was HKG $68! If you’re a light sleeper, please be aware that you can hear the plumbing from the other rooms. Even though we heard the water pipes all night, we were too jetlagged for it to bother us. Now for the good points. I love it when hotels have pillow menus. We really don’t like down filled pillows, so we requested harder Tempur-like ones. It’s nice to be able to get pillows that are more or less like the ones you’re used to at home. I really liked where the air conditioning vents were positioned. In most hotels, they’re situated in a way that they blow almost right over your face when you lie down on the bed, and I find that too breezy for comfort. These vents dispersed cold air evenly over the whole room. It was a nice touch to have an ironing board and an iron in the room, without having to request housekeeping to bring you one and then waiting for it. Good, powerful hairdryer. Nice iPod dock, the bellboys were lovely, our check-in and check-out were quick, efficient, and trouble-free. When we checked out, we took the hotel shuttle to the ifc. We’ve stayed in other hotels on the Island that were more expensive, but had worse rooms and worse staff. Would we stay here again? Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back as part of a holiday!”
Reviews.Author: ChalkyEssex
Reviews.Content: I'd read the reviews before I went and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were more spacious that the more prestigious, Eaton Hotel in Kowloon and mine had a fantastic view of the harbour. The only down point I would say is that it's not on the MTR but I enjoyed the walk to Central - you get a taste of the real Hong Kong away from the main tourist spots. Yes the drinks in the room are expensive but as someone else advised - try the 7/11 just a couple of minutes away - I got a can of cream soda and a packet of dark chocolate maltesers as well as water all for the price of a bottle of water in the hotel. the buffet breakfast and dinner are worth it especially if they still have the deal that gives you 30% off the dinner buffet if you buy the breakfast! Good pool - not too much chlorine - I had it all to myself. It was Mother's day when I was there (May) and the restaurant was full of Chinese families in the evening who made me feel very welcome. If I get the chance to come for a holiday I'd stay at the Island Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LauriKuu
Reviews.Content: Decided to go for this hotel after reading reviews in tripadvisor. Very helpful staff, good location in Sheung Wan which is a very traditional area on HK island. Tram stop is around the corner and max 5 min walk away but you can easily walk to Central. If you plan to got to Macau then the hotel as great location as the Macau Ferry Terminal is only 5 min away by taxi (and you pay the minimum fare of 18 HKD) or 3 tram stops or 15-20 min walk. Though the rooms are small they are very spacious. In the beginning we were given a room on the 8th floor but as it was a smoking room got a replacement on 26th floor with great views. There are also very good local "restaurants" just across the street and most of them have either a menu in english or someone who can understand you. And going up the hill there is also a nice market.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value + Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SF-Coast-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Island Pacific Hotel for nine nights. I booked through Hotels.com and secured a nightly rate of just under US$100 (all inclusive). This modern high-rise hotel is located in the western part of Hong Kong Island in the Western Market area of Sheung Wan. The Macau Ferry Terminal is an easy ten minute walk from the hotel, the Sheung Wan MTR Station an additional five minutes, and the Airport Express Station just ten minutes from the hotel by taxi. There is tram service on Des Voeux Road with the closest tram stop just one block from the hotel. As mentioned in other reviews, the Island Pacific Hotel is located in the heart of the dried seafood market area. Others have mentioned the smell of dried seafood as strong and offensive. I really didn’t find the smell to be that strong unless walking directly in front of the many dried seafood shops and I didn’t really even notice the smell in and around the hotel. The smell certainly would not deter me from staying at this hotel in the future. Upon arrival at the hotel on my first day in Hong Kong, I was warmly greeted by the bell staff and the front office staff. My check-in was handled efficiently and I was assigned a room on the 20th floor. As mentioned in other reviews, the room was fairly small and narrow. However, the high ceiling and floor to ceiling windows gave the room a more spacious feel. My room happened to be a corner room that offered a partial view of Victoria Harbor and the Tsing Ma Bridge along with views west towards Kennedy Town. There was a small desk and chair placed next to the windows. The room was “tired looking” with dated furniture, carpet, and drapes. The small “tube” TV was located on a shelf next to the closet to the side of the bed. Not the best location for comfortable viewing. It would be nice to have a large flat screen TV mounted on the wall in front of the bed. My room had two single beds. With both beds, there was little room to walk between the ends of the beds and the wall and also between one of the beds and the closet. The room had a small refrigerator (with mini-bar items), a hot water pot, an iron and board, and a small safe. The bathroom was of average size with a tub / shower combination. A phone was mounted on the wall behind the toilet. The hotel provided a nice array of toiletries, although nothing special. A nice feature of the room was that a speaker for audio from the TV was mounted in the bathroom so you could listen to whatever was showing on the TV. Except for some mold around the caulking of the tub and some dust around the corners of the room, overall, the room was clean. The bed was comfortable and the linens were clean. I did not try the hotel restaurant, but one morning I stopped to take a look at the breakfast buffet which I found quite extensive. At approximately US$20 this was more than I wished to spend for breakfast. There is a small bar on the lobby level of the hotel that offers limited views over the harbor. There is a 7-11 market across the street, a wonderful bakery across from the 7-11 along with a Watsons and Merrills for health care products, and a Café-De Coral half a block past the 7-11 that offered cheap and tasty meals. The hotel offers an “Executive Level” on the top four floors of the hotel. I did not see any of the rooms on these floors but I was graciously allowed to take a walk through the Executive Level Lounge which looked quite comfortable and offered nice views of both Victoria Harbor and the surrounding area. In the lounge, there were three computers for use by guests in addition to other reading material and refreshments. A lounge hostess was available to assist with any guest needs or business needs. The hotel offers complimentary half hourly shuttle service, on a first come first served basis, to a few set locations in the area, including the Airport Express / International Finance Center. In my opinion, the most redeeming quality of this hotel is its staff, especially the housekeeping and bell / concierge staff. In all of my contacts with them I was always greeted with a smile and a willingness to do whatever they could to answer my question(s) or make my stay more comfortable. For a sub US$100 per night room rate, I would not hesitate to stay again at the Island Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent”
Reviews.Author: mohammedyeo1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a month. very decent place with good rooms, excellent view and helpful service. Location is a bit of a problem as you need to walk a bit to get to the enarest bus / tram stop or the MTR. Also, takes long to get a cab during business hrs.

Reviews.Title: “loved the location”
Reviews.Author: wisekatebushfan
Reviews.Content: i loved the location of the island pacific...yes it is a leisurely 30min walk to the central, but the route is direct or you can jump on a tram that will get you to the central area in about fifteen mins. but the hotel and its surrounding area will be more of an education into the lives of hong kongs inhabitants than any of the tourist traps! the smell is not as bad as some have stated previously but you will certainly see every concievable part of most fish and birds for sale, either dead or alive. we walked the area most days and some nights too and always felt safe....and the place is far cleaner than my own country!! the hotel itself was good value for money and the staff (the majority anyway) very friendly...the room was a tad small (but this is common apparently) but very clean with a wall mounted flat screen tv that has the usual cnn, discovery channel etc, it also has tea and coffe facilities and an ipod dock.....the bathroom, again, was small but clean and no worse that top range hotels. you need to pay for wifi. rooms were well cleaned every day but once or twice they forgot to replenish coffee and towels but after asking they were brought immediately. we also asked for extra pillows which were privided straight away. the food at the hotel wasn't great, the best being breakfast in the room one morning but in all honesty i would eat out!! the bar is a bit of a damp squid, a sparse corner at the corner of the lobby... i feel they missed a trick here to situate it facing the harbour on one of the top floors. one night i was told they had no beer but carlsberg....when i persisted i was then offered either corona or san miguel......i guess that particular affected little waiter couldn't be bothered!! be warned...hong kong is expensive so whatever your budget is try to stretch it to the most you can afford! be sure you visit lantau and take the cable car to the bhudda....the peak is a must as is kowloon at night so you can look back at the HK skyline.....stanley should also be visited if you tire of the city!! you can catch a bus to stanley from the central bus station and once you get out the city the wiew is well worth it! if you tire of noodles then visit dukes deli in central.......the best cheeseburger i've ever had!! at the peak be sure to go to the roof of the shopping mall (not the sky terrace) to look through the free telescope, a small walk round some of the HK trail is also worth it....just follow the signs. buying an octopus card from any of the mtr stations is great value for using public transport but the trams are the best value at $2 per ride regardless of the length of your journey...you pay as you get off...go from east to west of the island all for $2! in short the island pacific is a good hotel in a great city.....and its location is far more interestingly placed than its promo stuff gives itself credit for.

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff....”
Reviews.Author: racoontraveler
Reviews.Content: Front desk helpful, accommodated me to avail rm even if I was early. Bed was clean, floor was not, carpet grimmy so I did not go barefoot. Toilet was clean, but shower smelled strongly of urine, so I asked staff to reclean and disinfect while I went out to eat. Two hrs later, same condition, this time they cleaned while I was there. After, it still smelled strongly, I told them about it the next day , when I left really early for ferry to Macau. Later that night, still bad situation, I finally figured it out the next day when I was going to check out... there was a drain that was backing up at back of toilet and also the shower curtain could have already assimilated the continous smell. Being a seasoned world traveler, I always wear rubber flipflops inside showers even if it is a very well reviewed upscaled hotel, because cleaning standards may be different in different cultures and establishments. Breakfast buffet is a little high for ordinary familes, but cheap for business travelers on expense accounts. But it was an excellent and sumptuous breakfast. Location is a good 15-20 minute wlk from train station. Their shuttle is only 1-way from hotel. Area is good during days but quite isolated at night. There are other competitive hotels in Hongkong that I would go back to...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: sea2skyaus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in This hotel is located in Sai Wan, about 15 minutes bus or tram to Central or Sheung Wan MTR station. Because of its location (eg no MTR station in the area), it is cheaper than many other hotels. There is a tram stop one minute from the hotel. You should expect to spend an extra 20 minutes travelling each day. We booked an harbour view room. Unfortunately we were given a room on the third floor. The room wasn't too big, but was clean and comfortable. We were very thankful to the staff there. We checked out in the morning, and we were planning to do some sightseeing before getting a night flight back to Australia. However after we checked out, my friend got sick and didn't feel well. We went back to the hotel to ask whether we can rent a "day room" for a fee, but the staff kindly let us stay until the late afternoon for free because of the special circumstance. We were grateful for this.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a special rate at say US$82 City View- US$120 Harbor View then YES!!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiglobetroter
Reviews.Content: As we live in Shenzhen the proximity to the HK-Macau-Shekou ferry terminal is a plus. I was looking forward to a great night at this hotel. My expectations were high based on the hotels own website picture of a habour view room. With the musty smell and the room not at all like the photo my first impression was not the best. I was disappointed. However, we spent little time in it so I guess the container terminal view across the water did not matter. When we arrived at 11.45 to check in we were told the room was not ready. This story did not fit with the very musty smell in the room. It had definitely not been used the night before or the night before that. It was clean but the carpet had some grubby looking stains. The very small room had no decorations, no pictures, only a flat screen TV with a few English speaking channels. The bottled water was HK$38/small bottle. That’s a rip off! We ate out. The tea/coffee making facility in the room is nice to have. The pool looked good but surrounded by high-rise. Staff were very professional. Shuttle bus to Central, very useful. The immediate area is fun to explore and Soho is HK$20 by taxi for good bars and food. Would we stay again? Yes, next week for the HK Sevens. Will the room be musty? I will let you know if you ask! Our rate for the Harbour View room was about US$128, maybe a tad more. Next week we have a city view room booked at US$97. At these prices the hotel is reasonable value compared to others of a similar standard in HK. One day I will learn not to trust the hotel promotional photographs. Our room definitely did not look a bit like the one shown in the hotel website picture which is the same shown by Agoda the booking agent.

Reviews.Title: “Could not Ask fof More, Great hotel, friendly warm staff”
Reviews.Author: CaptainJack1
Reviews.Content: Just on the egde of the Banking sector. This hotel is great value for money. Not large rooms but just enough. Only grumble is the cost of food / meals in the hotel. Then again it is quite pricey all over Hong Kong. A $4.00 cab ride into the heart of hong kong or a 20 minute walk. Walking you can see the heart and soul of HK island and experience more than the average guide book. It is safe to do so. All the back street shops, stalls. Fantastic. go up victoria peak by tram and decend by bus. Sit at the top and at the front for good views.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful when you been asked to”
Reviews.Author: NATLenexa
Reviews.Content: Be careful when you been asked to put room security deposit at Island Pacific Hotel! They did tell us that this was refundable deposit, but when they gave us a receipt we did not pay attention that there was "NO REFUND" note at the end. Front desk clerk both on the check-in and the check out told us that this was just a hold on the credit card, and we won't be changed, but that was not the case, we did get charged and never got our money back, because it was NO REFUND listed..

Reviews.Title: “Functional...”
Reviews.Author: MumbaiMan
Reviews.Content: Clean and functional hotel with (typical for HK) small rooms. Clean loos, room service that delivers, small pool and close to the tram stop! Nice place to stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: wadds89
Reviews.Content: while on my gap year, i decided i wanted to visit australia as it the one place on earth I've always wanted to visit, but never thought i would have the chance. So, as i left 6th form, i chose to do a gap year, im so pleased i did! the one thing that put me off though, was the 26 hour plane journey. so i decided to break up the flight with a stay in hong kong! very glad i did!! i found this hotel on agoda, i got a very good deal on a twin room for 4 nights, so me and my friend decided to go here. we had looked at many other places, all hostels, and i have to admit im very glad we opted for a hotel. after many bad reviews about some of the hostels, i wasnt ready to take that gamble just yet, as it would be our first destination. I cant remember the exact price we paid, but it wasnt that much more than a hostel! now that iv bored you to death with my life story, il tell you about the hotel and place.... the hotel is very good. the staff are all very friendly and most speak very good english. you can ask them anything about the hotel or surrounding area and they will endevour to help you out. (we wanted to know about the peak trip, and after the receptionist made a quick phonecall. we knew exactly where to go and how much it was going to cost ) the enterance is very nice, one of the nicest iv ever seen, even comparing it to a 4 star in NYC! the rooms are very clean and cleaned once daily.(the maid even laid our PJs out nice and neat!) the beds are comfy and the bathroom was spotless. there was plenty in the rooms that we had to call on, (TV, ironing bord, iron, fridge etc) and the aircon was not that noisy. the views from our room were pretty good too. not a harbour view, but still quite impressive, especially ay night! the pool is clean and the gym nice too, not huge but always quiet. dont let other reviews put you off when it mentions the location... its not kowloon, but i think thats a good thing, means you can visit kowloon. it is walkind distance to the centre, 15-20 mins walk and thats the best way to really see hong kong. yes, it is in the seafood market area, but the smell reli isnt that bad, the second your in the hotel, u cant smell it anyway, i thought it added to the character of the area anyway. (also, a tram will get you into town quickly for around 20 pence, just have 2 HKD in your pocket and your sorted! we got to the hotel via the airport express, 100HKD to the centre then a 30 HKD taxi to the hotel. we were at the hotel in around 30 mins from the airport! it might not be the cheapest, but i dont think there is a faster way. MTR is a good way to get round, cheap and efficient, buts the UK bus/rail system to shame a bit. if you want to save money, avoid any eating places with the word steak in! they will take the money from your pocket very quickly! instead, opt for the places where the local people go, dont be affraid to try new things!! the hotel does do a buffet breakfast, lunch and dinner, but it is a bit expensive, try other places (hong kong day is a very good chain to eat cheap but nice food) places to go, of to kowloon for a day and visit the markets, lots of cheap buys and always try to get something cheaper, its part of the fun! avenue of stars is worth s visit. the peak tram is a fun experience with great views, not too costly either.many many shops and malls to look round, so if you have money, you can definately spend it! right, il stop boring you all, quick sum up....smart, clean, quiet, realitively cheap and good area for real, tradtional hong kong city life. its safe too, felt more scared in kowloon! hope i helped!

Reviews.Title: “convenient to tram and buses”
Reviews.Author: digipro78
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was a bit above average. I booked for a queen size bed through the website but when I arrived I was given a room with two twin beds. The front desk clerk said they don't have anymore queen size bed rooms left until 4 days later. When a room with queen size bed came up the front desk clerk called me about the news so I gathered my belonging and made the switch to a harbour view queen size room. MTR is not close to hotel. The nearest MTR station is Sheung Wan and it's about a 10 - 12 mins walk. However, the hotel is close to bus stop and tram. Bus stop and tram stop is about couple minutes walk. On a cool day you can easily walk to Central in 15-20 mins. Hotel is close to dried seafood stores so if you're not used to smelling dried seafood this could be a stench you might not enjoy. It's not that horrible as some reviewers in this site said to be. The staff in the hotel is nice and courteous. The hotel also have a courtesy shuttle that takes you to Hong Kong Station to take the Airport Express train. On the day I left HK I thought my luggages were already on the shuttle but when we arrived at Hong Kong Station the driver said he didn't load my luggages in the shuttle so he drove me back to the hotel to pick up my luggages. There was no complaint from the driver to drive me back and forth. My only complaint about this hotel is that the water in the bath tub does not drain as fast as it should. If I go to Hong Kong again I would definitely consider this hotel and the price is within my budge. Recommended to others.

Reviews.Title: “We have not found better for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have lived in Shenzhen for 4 months and travel over to Hong Kong regularly for weekend mini breaks. We have stayed in a number of hotels in different areas of Hong Kong and this one tops it. If you want good value this one can not be beaten. The staff are very helpful and the hotel is very clean and modern. The outside does not do it justice. For £49 per night we got a standard room which was upgraded to a harbour view for free. The windows are floor to ceiling and gave a cracking panoramic view. The room size is fair with a very comfy bed. The bathroom is adequate with a very powerful shower over the bath. The location is slightly out of the main hustle of central Hong Kong, but close enough to either get the tram, metro or cab. We walked into town one morning which took about 20 mins. We will most definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a smelly location.”
Reviews.Author: Brightrob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite a good value for money. It may not be located in the most central part of Hong Kong Island, but if you fancy a decent hotel at a reasonable rate, this hotel is for you. My room was fairly small, but reasonably quiet and was clean. Staff were pleasant and accommodating. It is located in a dried seafood area, which can be very overpowering and at times unpleasant. It does take a while to get used to the smell when you leave the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great views, great price”
Reviews.Author: Annekewes
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel ourselves on the internet for € 50,00 and were surprised about the location and standard of the room. Luxureous lobby, big room, marble bathroom with bathtub, great view over the harbour with an awesome sunrise. Easy to reach with the HongKong tram. Good price. People at the reception could be a bit more friendly, but the rest made up for that! We went out for diner and breakfast, so no review about the food.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't mind the smell”
Reviews.Author: frankcurious
Reviews.Content: A good deal if you don't mind the smell and the distance from the subway station. The hotel is located a little farther from the busy touristy area of town and in fact is where all the best dried seafood and dried herbal medicine are sold. There was a shop that was auctioning off boxes of dried salted fish. It is also a good 15 min walk to the subway station. Other then these 2 points, it is a great hotel. And by using the tram you can mitigate the inconvenience of the subway station distance. The service is good, and the room is a fair size in Asian standard. The hotel is located on the tram line. It is the cheapest form of transportation in HK. For 2$ HK, you can travel from one end to the other. Most of your shopping/site seeing (other than Kowloon, the Peak, Ocean Park, Stanley Market) can be accessed by the tram. It is a bit slower. It'll take about 35 min to get to the other side (Sogo in Causeway Bay). Hong Kong is very small. It is a short walk from the ferry to the tram line. You can get to Kowloon for 2.6$HK from the ferries. The hotel provides a shuttle to the IFC Mall where the HK Express Station and subway station is also located. When you arrive in HK, you should take the HK Express Train to this station. It is 24 min and you can pay when you leave the train, so don't line up at the airport side. Then take a taxi to the hotel. It is about 35$HK. When you leave, you can take the hotel shuttle back to this station. You can also check-in a day in advance at the HK Express Station for some airlines so you don't have to lug your luggage to the check out counter at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “hotel ok, location.........”
Reviews.Author: brookea
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was really not bad, the staff was professional, housekeeping was good, they say hello and smile. The room was very clean, water pressure good. We stayed in a harborview room. The room size is not big, but not closet size, big enough to put our suitcases and move around. Had buffet breakfast in the hotel resturant once, for $140HKD, it wasn't very good. Every once in while , we could smell the dry fish smell in the lobby, but never in our room. For the location, I can see that being a problem for tourists. it might be cute for a few days being in a "local" area, you might get tired of the lack of Starbucks, the not too clean looking eateries...etc. It 's just not a very exciting area after a while. We lived in HK before, and I still have freinds living in Kennedy Town and up at HKU area. we know how to get around the area, actually almost every bus that goes to Central and Causeway Bay passes by the hotel, And 104 goes to MongKok. it's not hard to get around, but it's a long walk (15-20 min) to the closest subway station. I would probably try another hotel next time, simply because even for me, after a few days I wish I were staying some place else where I could just walk back to my hotel after dinner or a long day out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel,Noisy Air con”
Reviews.Author: jacko657
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel i was a bit disappointed by the outside, the concierge staff are very polite and were helpful throughout my stay whenever I had any questions and would always tell me both the cheapest and most convenient way to get to where I wanted to go. The reception staff were very blunt and abrupt and nowhere near as helpful as the concierge. My hotel room was small but very clean and had a wonderful view over the harbour. The bathroom was absolutely tiny. I ate in the hotel but found that the food was nothing to rave about and quite expensive. The pool is small and disappointing and if you like to sunbathe it is virtually entirely shaded unless you are actually in the pool. The hotel is in the western district of central, but you can use the tram or bus which is very cheap and only a couple of minutes to the ferry and central district, I actually liked to walk and look at all the smelly shops! It only takes about 20 minutes to walk from the Star Ferry and you pass loads of shops where you can get plenty of drinks and stuff cheaper than the hotel! The only thing really negative that I have to say is that the air con is really really noisy so I had to turn it off at night, luckily it was not particularly warm when I was there but I imagine if you were there when it was then it would be really annoying! Other than that a very enjoyable stay and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the money”
Reviews.Author: telster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is to the west of central Hong Kong Island, but right on the tram line and there are frequent buses going almost past the front door. The trams are a little slower, but very easy to use (just pay $2 on the way off) and since the tram line is just a single line very easy to get your bearings on. A taxi from the hotel into the centre of the city is about $25 (under 2.50 GB Pounds). Don't let the fact the hotel isn't right in the centre put you off at all. The area around it is known for its dried sea food. It is a little smelly when you walk past the shops, but then if that bothers you then stay in America or wherever. We've travelled a fair bit in Asia and think that apart from the traffic fumes sometimes, Hong Kong is a pretty clean city and the area around the hotel is no exception. Obviously, some people turn their noses up at some of the sights in Asia (well, anywhere outside the US) but again, they should stay at home. This is a pretty clean area. One complaint we did have was that we were booked into a triple room, and they gave us a double with a third bed squeezed in up against the bedside table. We complained that it wasn't a triple room, and they moved us to an executive room on the top (29th) floor. This also was only really a double, but even with a third bed taking the place of the sofa was plenty big enough and we were satisfied with it. They also gave us a complementary breakfast each for our trouble. The normal rooms were smallish, but the executive room was fine, don't know what the price difference is. How long do you spend in the room anyway? The hotel in general was fine. Clean, friendly, staff not too over the top in your face falling at your feet trying to help you (again, some people like that, we find it nauseating). Apart from the rooms not really being triples, we had no complaints at all and would recommend this hotel completely. Oh, never went to the bar so didn't see most of the prices, but cans of coke were $36 compared to $5 in the shop next door, but that probably compares to other hotels around. Our top tip for Hong Kong is to get an Octopus Card to pay on the transport, saves queuing or keeping change for the trams and buses. Can also use it in some shops and to buy beer at the races!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to shout about”
Reviews.Author: benzneo
Reviews.Content: An average 3 stars hotel that match its rating. When first arrived ,first impression was not that good on the hotel's surrounding .Did not feel like i am on holidays(old shophouses selling dried seafoods).Arrived 1 hr ahead of chk-in time ,i was told to come back an hr later as the room was not ready yet .Upon check-in i was given a room at 11th flr with a limited 30 degrees side view of victoria harbour and a TV betrofitted to cabinet which i need to turn my head 45 degrees to watch it as the bed was located parellal of the cabinet.(minor issue actually as not there to watch TV & seaview all day). Throughout the 3 days of staying there, i found out that the transport network from point A to B was quite good dispite the hotel is located on the western end of hong kong island .There are plenty of options available from trams (hk $2 per trip), buses (hk $3.40), taxi (hk $20) and shuttle services (free) to shang wan MTR which is only 15 mins away from walking. My personal opinion -This hotel will fit well for those on budget and on business trip but not for those for a relaxing holidays and honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Worth the Smell”
Reviews.Author: MojoStevie
Reviews.Content: This large hotel is located just on the side of Victoria Harbor in the middle of dried seafood street. We got a great deal for a week stay on Expedia and we were really worried when the cab driver dropped us off because the area smells like the street name, but the hotel is very professional and classy. The room was small, but it had large window wall with a view of Victoria Harbor. The hotel staff spoke English and were very helpful. Everyplace you want to go is just a short tram-ride away, and each ride costs the equivalent of 20 cents. The tram-stop closest to the hotel is just around the corner. The trams have open windows, which lets the breeze come in on hot days, and they're an excellent way to tour the city. I would not recommend paying more money to stay closer to the city center. There are 2 24hr 7-eleven's within walking distance and a 24hr McD's. Plus, there are several local bakeries and noodle shops in the area. The hotel buffet was decent, but you will get a much better value outside. There is a shuttle-bus that takes you to the airport when you check out. I strongly recommend this hotel for the real Hong Kong experience.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel; Location Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Rors21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all-together okay. The rooms are simple and small yet clean and well kept. The staff is friendly; not all of them speak english but those who don't are quick to point out someone who does. The business center is tidy and very handy. The best thing about the hotel are the views. You'll have spactacular views of the harbor and Victoria's Peak if you're fortunate to stay in a room which faces these sites. However, the biggest drawback of the hotel is the location. It's located in a slum-like area which was a big shock to my senses having just arrived from the West. Outside, it smelled really bad - like something between seafood, ramen noodles and vomit. It's also a bit of a hike to the sites. I didn't stay long enough to figure out public transportation but the closest subway station was a decent walk away. If I had to do it all over, I would have stayed closer to central Hong Kong. Although the hotel was fine for my needs, it wasn't so great as to make up for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a traditional part of town”
Reviews.Author: lizziebreath
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks and thought it was great. It was excellent value because it was a little out of the centre of town. However, with travel as cheap and convenient as it is in Hong Kong, this was no problem. Service was excellent at all times and staff couldn't do enough to help. The room was quite a good size compared with some I have stayed in before, particularly in London, and we had a corner room with two great views. As an extra bonus you get to stay in a more traditional area of the island and see a little of more old fashioned HK life. Some people have commented on the dried seafood shops there - and their smell. We didn't find that the shops smelt much (in spite of temperatures up to 34 degrees and over 90% humidity - phew!) and they were much more interesting than the plethora of department stores and chain stores in the centre. Our only criticism was that our room wasn’t ready when we arrived, even though we arrived mid afternoon from a long haul flight and were hot and exhausted. However, this did not mar the stay, and overall this was a great hotel serving good food and excellent value, particularly recommended if you are staying a little longer in HK. The tramline goes right outside the hotel and across the whole of HK island very frequently, through Central, Wan Chai … for only HK$2 (13p). Get on at the back and go upstairs for a top view, then get off at the front when you want to and drop HK$2 in the box or scan your Octopus card (recommended). For cabs, pick up a hotel card from the shelf by the concierge to show taxi drivers when you want to get back to the hotel - most don't speak English. Taxis to Central cost around HK$25 (£1.75).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: DublinPinky
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 days staying in this hotel in Hong Kong. We booked it through a travel website and got a really great deal - about 45 euro a night. Hotel is a 3* plus and it lives up to this. The facilities are nice and the rooms are comfortable. The hotel is currently undergoing renovations which made a bit of noise but didnt disturb us too much. I've rated the hotel as excellent which really reflects the price - excellent value for money (given the expensive price of hotels on Hong Kong island). The hotel has a pool which is lovely - was a welcome retreat from the madness of Hong Kong! The only thing Id really fault is the location. Although on Hong Kong island, the hotel is a good 10 to 15 minute walk from the Metro station, which is a bit annoying. However, taxis are cheap and easy enough to come by. I think the location is reflected in the price and it does offer exceptionally good value on Hong Kong island. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Avoid the hotel shuttle to the airport - get a taxi to Hong Kong station and take the Airport Express. Much quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the friendly staff....”
Reviews.Author: axl99
Reviews.Content: Booked through BA hotline travel cause i got a good rate! I was hesitating about the area and the true is that is quite away of all the fun,bar,restaurants and shops! Its in a local market area in western Hong Kong district....So location wise is not central at all...the only shops around it are local dry fish stores...so you get the strong fishy smell! The hotel is modern and clean...no smells whatsover as soon as you enter...the staff are friendly and make you feel welcomed! The only problem we had was sleeping on those really hard matresses so If you dont like hard matresses or have any back problem issues though DONT book it! They tried to help us by making the beds more soft by adding extra matresses on top...didn't make a big difference...they even offered to upgrade us for free on an executive floor room. I have to admit that they did whatever they could to assist...and they even let us keep the room and have a very late check out at 8pm for free. The rooms are quite small but clean and most of them with harbour views.If you want views on a standard rate room ask for rooms on a higher floor ( 20th to the 25th and rooms for example 2001-2008) as they are at the front overlooking the harbour and the city! We used taxis a lot to go everywhere as its quite cheap and outside was so hot and so humid...for example to go to Causeway Bay which is at the other side of Hong Hong and the furthest you will need to go ,where is a major shopping area we paid around 35 to 40 HK dollars and it only takes 10 minutes depending on the traffic. The best way to go to the hotel from the airport is to take the Airport express train to Hong Kong, it takes 25 minutes and from Hong Kong station just get a tax,its less than 5-10min ride around 30 to 40 HK dollars including your luggage cost to the hotel! For me the only negative was the location!! So overall if you like downtown action in your feet dont book it!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place with good value”
Reviews.Author: BillEmison
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean but small rooms. We stayed on the 18th floor and had an interesting view of the surrounding neighborhood. Hotel is modern with good, prompt service but its location near the fish markets makes for some nice smells. We found their free shuttle useful to get to other transit stations, so that was a nice amenity. Business centre is very nice and has good PCs for rent - another nice bonus. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - Island Pacific Hotel, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Johnston_m4
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a very enjoyable 5 night stay at Island Pacific Hotel with my Husband and two teenage children. Rooms good size with fantastic floor to ceiling views of the Harbour and Kowloon. Marble bathrooms and very clean and comfortable beds. Rooms have fridge, safe, hairdryer, complimentary toiletries and free morning paper. Free access to hotel outdoor pool and air conditioned gym. Staff very helpful and Free courtesy bus from hotel to various 'key' locations in Hong Kong a bonus! Hotel is walking distance of tram stop (located on Des Vouex Road West). Were given free welcome drink on arrival - nice touch. Were able to request a late check-out, at no additional charge, which is great when returning to the UK on a late evening flight! Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: gobee84
Reviews.Content: The first receptionist we met wasn't the nicest, but she did get some guy to deal with our booking and we got instantly upgraded!!! I loved the room! We had full length windows on 2 adjacent walls, 1 facing the water and 1 facing the surrounding apartments. The cleaning/maid service was really good. Very nice hotel, most workers were very nice as well! Area was good, at least for me, because got to experience everyday living. It was also close to 7-11, laundry services, and cheap food. Close to the tram as well, which is really cheap and close to buses. They also have a shuttle if you get there at certain times. Overall, I would definately stay here again. My only complaints are you have to pay for internet use and for instant noodles and other snacks (which were very overpriced, plus we had to pay for one we put back!). Also, the restaurant in the hotel closes to early! But these are minor complaints, they aren't enough to chase me away.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: igetfuzzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room for 3 nights. The room was very clean, comfortable, and had all the amenities common to a good hotel. The location was a tad far from the metro-- you had to take the tram for about 15 minutes to the nearest main station. This might be a little inconvenient for those who are not acquainted with the city. Since I had been to HK several times, this was not an issue. The mattress is a bit hard, but that's pretty common in Asian hotels. Nevertheless, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an overnight stay, but nothing longer”
Reviews.Author: Brocko25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before flying out, and the Views from the higher floor (23) was great. The room was absolutely tiny though. Harbour view room, with twin beds, and no room to swing a cat. Upon check in, the receptionist told me it would take 2 hours for my room to be ready, (it was after their specified check in time), and when i was less than pleased, this 2 hours became 15 minutes. So they were attentive to guest needs. As with another HK hotel, I found the beds to be far too hard to sleep on comfortably. But housekeeping were prompt when I requested an ironing board. Location is OK, a short tramride to central (or about a 20 min walk). The pool area was nice, and the gym useful. The hotel has a nice bar also. If you need an overnighter before a flight thats cheap and clean, then definately choose this place. But if you need to stay in HK for longer than 2 night stopover, I would choose somewhere closer to central, with a bit more space in the room (and more comfy beds!)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!! Highly Reccomended”
Reviews.Author: Caroline91980
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! We stayed in Hong Kong for 3 weeks, one week on the Island, one week in Macau and one week in Kawloon and this was one of the best hotels! The service we had was fantastic, the waiters and waitresses tried their utmost to look after us and that was the general feeling about the place. Even the concierge was friendly and couldnt do enough. I would highly reccomend this hotel and would say its one of the best i have been to.

Reviews.Title: “island pacific”
Reviews.Author: lannybird
Reviews.Content: we booked our stay through british airways and got it really cheap, was expecting a tiny room but it wasn't actually that small and had a great view over the harbour. the maid came every day and changed the towels, room was very clean, beds comfy, nothing to complain about. it was a little bit further away from the nearest MTR station than would have been ideal, especially in the heat we had, but it's still only 15 minutes if you don't walk too fast. some of the reviews i read said the lobby smelled of fish, we didn't notice it in the hotel though, only on the street outside, but it wasn't terrible. all the staff were very friendly and helpful, the buffet breakfast was good too, loads to choose from. would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in hong kong on a budget and doesn't mind a little walk!

Reviews.Title: “Good service!! Great hotel on HK Island :P”
Reviews.Author: -gelow77-
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at Island Pacific Hotel for 5 nights. Bear in mind to take down the chinese name of the hotel so as to show the taxi driver on arrival at Hong Kong Airport Express station. The chinese name is "太平洋酒店". My BF & I did not know the chinese name of the hotel and asked the Airport Express customer service counter staff for direction. He wrote the hotel name in chinese on a piece of paper but we were actually brought to a hotel in Wanchai (South Pacific Hotel). [To side track a bit, the hotel staff in South Pacific Hotel were REALLY NICE. Not only did they help us to get a taxi, they told the taxi driver our destination, wrote it in chinese for us and even carried our luggages onto the taxi! Impressive service!!] Anyway we got to Island Pacific Hotel and checked in at about noon. The room is really clean and the view from the room was great. We requested for a room on the higher floor and was given one on the 25th! That's the highest for their standard room so it's really good. There's a hotel shuttle bus so we took it out, you can check for the timings at the concierge. The hotel staff are really friendly and polite. They are really helpful as well! The hotel, although not strategically situated, it is just a very short tram ride from Central! Every morning, we will take either the tram or a cheap bus ride towards Central or to Sheung Wan MTR Station and start shopping away! If you are on a budget, the hotel area offers great budget local breakfasts as well. I gave the hotel an "above average" rating instead of excellence because of one incident. Unfortunately and fortunately, there was a thunderstorm one morning when we were in the hotel. Thank goodness we were in the hotel, the area around the hotel was flooded! I guess it's due to the lower ground the hotel was built on, we were actually unable to leave the hotel. It was 8am when we were awake. The water level was at knee level at 7am I heard? Then it subsided to ankle level at around 9am. We stayed indoor till noon. The hotel staff did all they could to stop the water from getting into the hotel lobby. There were sand bags, towels and blankets everywhere! And we were stuck as it was almost impossible for cars to get to the hotel entrance. I was just a little disappointed that they had cancelled the shuttle service for the day due to the flood. The tram service was down as well. Other than this incident of the black thunderstorm & flood which caused the morning to be rather wasted, the hotel is a great place to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Fit for Purpose”
Reviews.Author: Stephen C
Reviews.Content: We arrived in a Thunderstorm amidst the worst rain on record for this area. Luckily the Taxi was able to pull into the area to the rear of the Hotel entrance to let us out. The Staff were very helpful and by the time we had checked in at reception, which was on the first floor, our bags were outside our rooms. A small problem with the keycards but that was soon sorted. The rooms, on the 8th floor, were a bit small for a 10 night stay but were clean and the bed was comfortable. The side harbour view was as expected albeit the continual downpour dimmed the views somewhat. The room was cleaned everyday and the sheets and towels were changed daily too. The Bathroom was tidied daily but was not mopped out daily as I would have liked. It was good to have a mini bar fridge in the room, which I used to store water and stuff, which the hotel did not seem to mind. The buffet breakfast was more than adequate with a wide choice of food. (HK$140) There are 3 lifts that I knew about, only one of which went to the pool which was outside on rear of the hotel. Poolside loungers and mattresses were provided as you arrived, as were towels. When we checked out we were able to leave our luggage with the bell hops and when ready to leave for the airport they were most helpful in hailing a cab for us and loading our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay on the Island”
Reviews.Author: malcognito
Reviews.Content: A terrific place: a real find. Rooms are bigger than average for HK and many have a fantastic view over the harbour. Once you've found it for the first time, it's easy to use the tram to and from anywhere central on the island side. Staff are really friendly and helpful, right from concierge, front desk and all areas. The evening buffet can be a bit of a scrum but if you head downstairs to the bar, you can order a la carte and prices are still reasonable. There are a few places to eat nearby - cross the main road (mind the trams) and head uphill into the back streets. And if you're on a budget, you can't beat the rates here.

Reviews.Title: “More than a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viajeraincansable
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Island Pacific for 3 nights. We found it by internet and it was an emergency option until our previous booked hotel had free rooms, but It was better than we expected and we stayed here all the nights we were going to be in Hong Kong. The staff is extremely considerate and helpful. The hotel is very clean and nice and view from the room is amazing! We booked a standard room and we were upgraded to an executive room. The room was big, nice, comfortable and the hotel was very quiet at night. Rooms have dark curtains to stop morning light, this is important because the window is really big. The bathroom is large and clean. Although the hotel is a bit far of the center, you can find a free shuttle every each half an hour to a subway station, but the taxi is so cheap that we used the shuttle once. Moreover is close to Macau Ferry Habour, and this was great because we wanted to visit Macau too. It has been very pleasant to enjoy the pool and there are several really good and cheap chinese restaurants close to the hotel. The hotel has it's own reataurant, but we didn't experience it.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: hase1
Reviews.Content: This is a standard 3 star hotel, nothing more and nothing less. The lobby is a nice average hotel lobby (if that's important to you) however the rooms are quite dated and very basic. If you are on a low budget and just need a place to stay for, this is a good choice. However the location is not ideal, as it is out of the city centre and no tube station is close. Therefore you either walk to the MTR (15 min walk) or you take the tram which is almost round the corner. We booked a Deluxe Room for a slightly higher rate than a standard room. I am still trying to figure out what the "deluxe" actually was. We were promised a habour view room, which we indeed got however at the same time we had a view on the 6 lane motorway. To cut a long story short, it is a clean very basic hotel, with friendly staff but with no thrills.

Reviews.Title: “love the place”
Reviews.Author: pinayjetsetter
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for four nights. it is clean i really like it, water on the shower is strong but not every time i flush the toilet bowl though, but over all experience is wonderful. very convenient location, accessible to everything especially with the authentic hong kong food just outside the hotel. the staff are nice and helpful. they gave us street and harbor view rooms even if i forgot to request. how wonderful! rooms are just perfect size for standard rooms. clean sheets and towels everyday. we will stay here again and the hotel is really recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: LK27Uk
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed here for 3 nights before flying onto Australia and may I say this is a great hotel. We got a Taxi from the train terminal to the Island Pacific which cost about $20hkd. We pulled up, our door was opened, we were welcomed and our bags taken straight to the room. Check in was a breeze. Our room was on the 20th floor and was a good size with a good sized bathroom. We ordered room service on the first night which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeJP
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, with a gym and pool on the roof. The gym isn't as good as that at the JEN hotel over the road, however. It is very high standard, with lots of glass and escalators, and usually quite expensive. Do look out for offers though, I found a very good price thru Expedia, which was a limited offer. It is west of the centre, just a tram ride to LKF and the MTR rail system. Verdict: only book if you can find a good price, else better value can be found elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant 4-star hotel near the business district”
Reviews.Author: gsk2007
Reviews.Content: The location may not seem good to some travellers but if you are street-smart and have a good travel map of Hong Kong with you, it's actually fine. Island Pacific is actually within a 10-min walk from Sheung Wan MTR station. From the MTR station, you are only 2 minutes away from the central business district, Central, and about 8 minutes away from the shopping district, Causeway Bay. If you know how to take the tram, that's even better. The tram charges a flat rate of HKD2 (approx. a quarter) no matter of the distance you travel. There is a tram stop about 100 metres from the entrance of the hotel. While the tram is slower than the MRT, you will still get to Central in approximately 10 minutes and Causeway Bay in approximately 20 minutes, depending on the time of the day. The conceirge staff are extremely helpful and courteous. The supervisor is especially helpful - I was waiting impatiently for my airport coach to come by where he quickly helped to call up the company and enquire about the status of the coach which was already 20 minutes late. Front desk staff are also professional and amiable. I was given a free upgrade promptly when they had some problems with my Asia Miles mileage accrual (supposed to be able to accrue mileage by staying at this hotel but due to some miscommunications, they were unable to do so). The business centre is managed by a staff during operating hours and she was very helpful and approachable. There were two computers with high-speed internet connection available and printing charges are low compared to other hotels of the same category. Light snacks and drinks are provided at the business centre too. Rooms are clean and well-maintained. While the size of the room is not large (but this is across the board in Hong Kong where land prices are ridiculously high), it is well-decorated and furnished. Basically, the rooms are cosy and chic-looking. Internet connection is also available in every room. The lobby lounge is very cosy and is a good place to have casual business discussion with your partners. As the hotel does not cater to a lot of tour groups, you can be assured that you won't be affected by noisy tour groups while you are having your business discussion at the lobby lounge. Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Hong Kong, whether you are a businessman or a leisure tourist. This is a modern hotel suitable for one and all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great rates”
Reviews.Author: valska
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a few nights and had a great stay. The location is central and it is clean. My only grouse though, it's a fair bit of a walk to the nearest MTR and there is no free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice size rooms”
Reviews.Author: dasberliner
Reviews.Content: Ok so the Island Pacific is in Sheung Wan and approx 5 minutes by cab, 10 minutes on the trolley to Central. Sheng Wan is much more of a local suburb so you see less tourists, and more locals which is nice. Hotel is failry modern, maybe mid 90's, rooms are decent size and well maintained. Outlook is plesant, either back up to the 'midlevels' or a view of the harbour. You can easily book this hotel for around $100 a nite, which is good value for HK.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Tired_travelling_dad
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Island Pacific for three nights following a two night stay at the Peninsula whilst in HK for a wedding. After a stay in the Pen, expected to be disappointed but was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The rooms are on the small side and there is a strange smell in the lobby (mixture of soap and fish). However, the rooms are undergoing an upgrade and ours had a flat screen TV on the wall as well as updated decor in comparison to rooms which had not been updated. Overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis”
Reviews.Author: angelliu8
Reviews.Content: As I write this I am still at the hotel waiting for my trip to the airport. I extended my stay at the IP because well, its clean, its comfortable, its civilized and it was more than I expected. The website is accurate so don't be suspicious. There were no snotty doormen or staff, everyone was extremely accommodating and they will be honest enough to tell you if you are better off using a booking site to save on rates vs their own. The IP is located in Central which is ideal, it is near the ferry, and short cab rides away to Lai Kwan Fong, Man Mo Temple and other hot spots. The rooms are adequately sized, not matchbox small and definitely not dingy, the beds are firm but the comforters and pillows are cush. I booked a non smoking room and didn't sniff a whiff of cigs anywhere (unlike other hotels). I woke up at almost 10 everyday that I was here and lazed around till 1PM, it is that quiet. For the price, you don't get extraneous luxuries, nor do you get just the basics... I would highly recommend this hotel if you have a fair budget ($100 per night). The one thing is that the movie on demand system is a bit archaic but who goes here to watch movies anyway... The business center is huge and combines a lounge with several terminals to use the net for a reasonable fee per half hour or the entire day, they also have complimentary coffee, tea, chocolates and magazines should you want to lounge around as I'm doing now. I didn't try the restaurants but had no intention to anyway doing most of my dining at Lai Kwan Fong... I'd definitely book here again, and owing to other circumstances in my life, I wouldn't mind staying here a month... Most the staff speak English and if they don't know a word they will look it up in order to assist you... angel

Reviews.Title: “More than you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: claster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Island Pacific from March 7-9 and I must say I was more than pleased. The staff is very accommodating. The rooms aren't big, but clean with very comfortable beds. You will only have problems with the size if you plan to dance around the room or carry 5 large suitcases. We got the Spring Special which makes it even better value for money. The "Culinary Delights from North and South China" dinner buffet that came free with the package is amazing. The food tasted great and unlike other dinner buffet fare that tastes like they were made for mass production. You can leave your bags after you check out for up to 30 days!!! When there was a slight discrepancy in the billing (got charged for buffet dinner which was supposed to be free), the check-out staff immediately (within 10 seconds) corrected the mistake. The tram is literally right behind the hotel and if you don't want to walk to the Sheung Wan MRT, you can take the tram and get off there. Alternatively, you can take the tram all the way to the other side of the island for only HK$ 2!!!

Reviews.Title: “island pacific good choice”
Reviews.Author: GillianKPerth_WA
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good, clean and rooms ok size for hong kong hotel. Pillows really good and comfortable this is really important to me as not the usual for a hotel. Bed was firm but i like it that way. The full window view of harbour was nice to wake up to each day. Had confirmation we were to have adjoining rooms but on arrival had been given two rooms not even next to each other, but arranged for a room change later in the day. Location was close to the hong kong tram for ease of getting around the island and hotel shuttle quite convienient. Used shuttle to get to the airport express station on last day where you can also check in your luggage and your flight then travel to the airport easily on the train. Location of hotel was good if you like to be out of the busy areas like i do but there were not many restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “A bit 80s”
Reviews.Author: mrrfrost
Reviews.Content: Situated on HK Island and is about a 12 minute stroll to Shueng Wan MTR station but there are plentiful very cheap taxis around and also buses and the incredibly cheap trams to Central and beyond. The hotel is based on a road selling lots of dried fish and the area itself is pleasant enough without being anything exceptional. Connaught Road seemed especially polluted though and some traffic noise. The lobby of the hotel is more than pleasant and all the staff were accommodating and answered all our questions with a smile. I guess the down side was the room which, whilst an OK size (apparantly we were upgraded..) certainly could do with an update in the decor. Didn't have a particularly great view of the harbour - must have been on the wrong side of the hotel or not up high enough (16th floor). Seemed clean enough and the bathroom acceptable. A tiny gym which was very warm but empty. Didn't try the pool but felt unheated. Also did not have breakfast - a buffet was on offer for about £9. Probably would stay again if there weren't any other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel with amazing harbour views”
Reviews.Author: hongkongzoe
Reviews.Content: I live on an outlying island in Hong KOng and as the ferry service is limited I sometimes stay overnight in Central. I have stayed in quite a few hotels located in Wanchai whic were double or triple the price and half the standard of the island pacific. Island Pacific is well located, a 10 min taxi/tram journey from Central HK, in amoungst the old chinese hustle and bustle. The hotel is clean and well presented, with modern and simple decor. The staff were polite, efficient and helpful. We had asked for a smoking room and got given non smoking, they sorted this out without any fuss or bother. The food was of a good standard, we enjoyed good room service and all for a very reasonable price. I would definitely recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: stoneyLondon
Reviews.Content: Just about to book my third stay at the Island Pacific. I really can't fault it - comfortable rooms, friendly staff, great loction. Yes, it is a good 25 min walk to Central but the MTR is 10 mins away and there are tram and bus stops right outside. Plus this area of the island is, for me, more authentic. The seafood and dried medicine shops are fascinating but do smell - it's a smell I don't think I will ever get used to but will also never forget! It's close to Hollywood Street and some of the fantastic temples. I haven't been able to find better value. One tip - ask the staff to write out the hotel name for you in Cantonese - not all of the cab drivers understand where it is at first - quite frustrating when you are stuck in the New Territories in the small hours trying to get back to the hotel like I was..

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: jude276
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd trip to Hong Kong and after staying at the Excelsior hotel the last time everything else would probably seem a bit of a let down hotel wise as we just didnt have the money to pay for this class of hotel again. We stayed at the Island Pacific for 8 nights and i booked it because it was on the British airways website and it had a harbour view!!! We got the coach from the airport which was supplied by Vigor which only took just over 35 mins and was a decent journey this was booked through Octopus travel. We also booked other trips with them as i found them excellant value for money compared with other websites. Check in was nice and easy and the hotel staff were very pleasant. Our room was lovely and clean, small but who needs a large room when your going to spend most of the time exploring what Hong Kong has to offer and also a very impressive view of the harbour. Once outside the hotel you were in the seafood area of Hong Kong which you could instantly tell because the smell of fish was pretty strong. The cheapest way to travel anywhere was probably by tram which was basically a 2 minute walk in either direction at the rear of the hotel in des voeux road west. The tram only cost 2HKD per journey and you could quite happily travel up and down the length of Hong Kong island. It did however get very busy and we very often were crushed in during these times. The nearest MTR station is Sheung Wan station which is probably a 10-15 min walk away. We walked this a couple of times however during the day it is very hot and humid so its probably better to get the tram to Central. The MTR is an excellant way of travelling round and we bought tourist passes to get us about. Its much more spacious than the London underground and very tourist friendly. There is also a hotel courtesy bus that goes at various times throughout the day until 7pm and drops you off in Central. We had breakfast a couple of times at the hotel which was okay with lots of choice but we tended to venture into Hong Kong and find somewhere a lot cheaper. Overall this hotel was excellent value for money, clean and modern with friendly staff. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ammar_s
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is not as bad as I thought its located in the western area of Hong Kong Island and its even better located than the Ramada Hotel which is a little bit further down the road. The first day I went in the hotel I realised the fish smell but never recognised it afterwards. The area is full of dried fish shops but the smell is not that strong unless you walk all the way next to the shops to the nearest MTR station. Its only 15 mins walk to the nearest station, or you can take the bus (there are plenty of them) which will take you to the nearest MTR station within less than 5 mins and will only cost you HK$3.80 about 25p. I advice that you buy an Octopus Card from the airport or at any MTR station, its the best and easiest way to pay for buses and underground fares, its similar to the Oyster card here in London but even better you can use it as a payment card which is widely accepted in shops and even in McDonalds, KFC's and more etc.. I stayed in a superior room which has a partial harbour view and a main city view, the bed was hard but it was comfortable and there wasn’t too much noise from other rooms except sometimes in the morning you can hear the neighbours shower which doesn’t bother me at all. The room was cleaned every day and the bed sheets were replaced every day as well but the carpets looked rather old and need some freshening. The bathroom was very clean as well, the towels were replaced with clean ones every day and the shower is very powerful and had hot water all the time, Note some hotels will charge for water but Island Pacific don’t, the best and safest way is to pre-book your hotel before arrival. This hotel bathroom is very spacious compared to the hotels in the city centre and some of them have only showers with no baths at all and with a very limited space you can barely move around which is annoying. The space in the room is rather small but more than enough for 2 persons. The staff was very helpful and they are very happy to answer any question you have, they also was very fast to bring any thing you request to your room. Lastly the food in the hotel wasn’t that great with limited choice and expensive, you can eat out side quality food for much less. There was no menu in the room so I had to ask for one. English breakfast about HK$ 120 (I think cant remember maybe less) better have breakfast somewhere else though. Buffet Lunch HK$ 140 Buffet Dinner HK$ 240 hotels and most resturants will include 10% service charge in your bill. Overall I'm very satisfied with the hotel and will defiantly stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Go west old man!”
Reviews.Author: MrHobbs
Reviews.Content: I had one night stay here and chose it because I had never stayed before. I had a meeting on the west side. FYI the location is really at the western most end of the MTR line on the island. To be honest, the location was not that convenient even for my meeting but it is a great view. That remains the most memorable part of my stay, the view from my room, looking onto the harbour. Hotel could do with a “kiss and cuddle” although it was clean. As mentioned by previous reviewers carpets and soft furnishings have the “used odour.” The room was spartan in fit out but warm, bathroom showed its age. The Bar area and restaurant is small and the lack of staff numbers made service slower than I have come to expect in HK, but really no negatives (regarding service and staff) other than that. Who would stay? Well I have no complaints if you wanted something quick, comfortable and cheap. If I had another 3 nights there, I am sure my review may have changed. Very quick business in the western district OK, The frugal traveller/ tourist it is a good choice to get the atmosphere of the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: DavidKLondon
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a one night stay booking at short notice and paid a bargain GBP 42.00. I would have no hesitation recommending this hotel. The location is good on the edge of Central in the heart of an overwhelmingly Cantonese area. Lots of dried fish stores nearby but no problem with smells. It is only a 5 minute walk and a 5 minute tram ride to IFC Mall in the heart of Central. The bathroom was very spacious by any let alone HK standards as indeed was the rest of the double.Maybe not the most modern decor but it was clean and well maintained. We were given a Victoria Harbour side facing room and the view towards the vast apartment buildings in Western District was at least as good as the part of Kowloon on view. The staff were very efficient and we would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Characterful location”
Reviews.Author: R-R2025
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the IP many times, and will do so again in March 2007. The rooms are small, the carpets could do with some refreshment (!), but the staff are excellent. The breakfast and buffet dinner bars are very good value only if booked as part of your package. I usually stay for 10/15 days on business, and enjoy being on the island, and in a 'real' part of HK. The tram is excellent for getting to Central or Star ferry terminal, etc. A nice walk is to leave the hotel, and find Hollywood Road, the Man Mo temple, and follow the antique shops into Central via The Foreign Correspondents Club. The dried seafood and frogs, etc on sale are a source of local character, and the gy at the Kwok Wah Ateam Laundry (300 yards up the hill on the right) does an excellent, cheap job overnight! Watch out for variable room rates if there is a conference/exhibition taking place, and the tour groups from the mainland hogging the lifts. For a change, the Nepalese Indian restaurant (up the hill to the lights turn right, then on the right) is wonderful value! Enjoy and save money!!

HotelInfo.Name: Island Pacific Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.152 Connaught Road West, Hong Kong, China
